loans.name: Teresita De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Teresita O. es socia del banco comunal El Progreso de Azogues, vive la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de sus calles, sus iglesias son el símbolo de la religión en la ciudad, su gente es amable y cordial, cuentan también con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La Señora. Teresita tiene 55 años, es divorciada y tiene 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, cuatro son casados y solo 3 hijos viven independientes, su hijo casado que vive en su casa comparte los gastos del hogar y su último  hijo es soltero y está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Teresita es profesora de educación primaria, actividad que la desempeña hace 32 años, también hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias maracas, este producto lo vende a sus amigas y conocidas en su tiempo libre.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes comparte cada quince días en las reuniones del grupo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cosméticos para la temporada navideña. Su sueño es tener  casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs Teresita O. is a member of the 'El Progreso de Azogues' community bank.  She lives in the city of Azogues.  This city is known for the architectural beauty of its streets.  Its churches are the symbol of the city's religion.  It people are kind and friendly.  The city's gastronomy is also very impressive.

Teresita is 55 years old.  She is divorced and has 5 grown-up children.  Four of her children are married but only 3 live independently.  Her married son who lives at home shares in the household expenses and her youngest son, who is single and studying at school in the city, doesn't have his own home.  He rents.

Teresita is an elementary school teacher.  She has been doing this job for 32 years.  She has also been selling various brands of cosmetics for four years.  She sells her products to her friends and acquaintances in her spare time.

Teresita has been a member of her community bank for 2 years.  She has very good friends in the community bank with whom she shares meetings every fortnight.  Her loan will be invested in buying cosmetics for the Christmas season.  Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy various brands of cosmetics

loans.name: Carmen Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen A. es socia del banco comunal El Progreso de Azogues, vive la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de sus calles, sus iglesias son el símbolo de la religión en la ciudad, su gente es amable y cordial, cuentan también con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

Doña Carmen se dedica a la cría de pollos, actividad que desempeña hace 2 años. También labora en el arreglo de casas hace 3 años y medio en donde también se dedica a planchar ropa ajena, trabaja solo 3 días a la semana.

La Señora. Carmen tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 12, 11, 9, 4 y 1 año de edad, sus primaras hijas estudian en el colegio, su tercera hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora en su taller de fibra de vidrio en donde realiza tinas de hidromasajes, guarda choques para vehículos etc., no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y en su alimento. Sus sueños son ayudar a su esposo que tenga un taller más grande y llegar a tener un súper mercado.
texts.en:
Carmen A. is a member of the 'El Progreso de Azogues' community bank.  She lives in the city of Azogues.  This city is known for the architectural beauty of its streets.  Its churches are the symbol of the city's religion.  It people are kind and friendly.  The city's gastronomy is also greatly varied.

Carmen has been raising chickens for 2 years.  She has also been cleaning houses for three and a half years.  She irons people's clothes as part of this service.  She only works 3 days a week.

Carmen is 36 years old.  She is married and has five children aged 12, 11, 9, 4 and 1.  Her eldest daughters study in high school and her third daughter studies in a local elementary school.  Her husband works in his fiber glass workshop where he makes hydromassage tubs, car bumpers, etc.  They don't have their own home and have to rent.

Carmen has been a member of her community bank for a year and a half.  She will invest her new loan in buying more chickens and chicken feed.  Her dreams are to help her husband to acquire a larger workshop and to own a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Cesar Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 22 years old.  He lives in the town of Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is located in a more tropical region of northern Peru.  It is primarily populated by small farmers who raise animals and have fruit plantations. Raul lives with his parents, brothers and sisters.  He has no children and is unmarried.

Raul raises animals on a property near his parents home.  He has a herd of 12 sheep, as well as a number of pigs and turkeys.  Raul also works as a factory worker, earning 21 soles per day.  Between these income-earning activities, Raul is able to help support his family and earn funds for his future.

This will be Raul’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed for his animals.  He hopes to be able to purchase balanced feed, which will accelerate and promote the proper growth of his animals so that he can sell them at the best price.  Raul is a very hard worker and is well respected in the community.  He is proud to support his family and earn his own living.

loans.use: To purchase feed for sheep, pigs and turkeys.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is fifty-three years old.  She lives in the village of San Martin in the district of Tambogrande, a tropical region of northern Peru populated primarily by small farmers who raise animals and have fruit plantations.  She lives with her husband and children in a home they own. 

Rosenda manages a small general store out of the front of her home.  She sells various basic items to her neighbors, assisting them in reducing the time it takes to complete their shopping errands.  She can be found in her shop daily at almost all hours.  Her husband is a farmer.  He manages a small plot of land on which the family raises various crops throughout the year.

Rosenda's family have worked with this lender in the past.  They are well known in the region and have always used credit responsibly and repaid punctually.  Rosenda plans to use the loan to increase her stock of merchandise and to purchase fertilizers for the farm.  She is a responsible and dedicated woman who is constantly striving to get her family ahead.  She appreciates having access to credit to help her achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Luz Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is fifty years old.  She lives in the village of Atahualpa Valle D. los Incas in the district of TambogranD., a tropical region of northern Peru populated primarily by small farmers who raise animals and have fruit plantations.  She owns her own home and shares it with her husband and their remaining dependent child.

Georgina manages a small general store out of the front of her home.  She sells various basic items to her neighbors, assisting them in reducing the time it takes to complete their shopping errands.  She can be found in her shop daily at almost all hours.  Georgina’s husband is a farmer.  He manages a small plot of land on which the family raises various crops throughout the year.

This will be Georgina’s first time working with Edpyme Alternativa.  She has good references and is well respected in the region.  She plans to use the funds to purchase additional merchandise in order to meet the ongoing demand at her store.  She hopes to be able to increase her family’s income in order to better proviD. for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José Raúl tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el Caserío Punto Cuatro del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Por más de cuatro años de ha dedicado a comercializar menestras en el Mercado Moshoqueque (el mercado mayorista de la región). El adquiere los productos de los agricultores de la zona y los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas y minoristas que frecuentan el centro de abastos. El negocio es la fuente más importante de ingresos con la que cuenta, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

José Raúl desea contar con un capital propio para poder adquirir mercadería las veces que necesite, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
José Raúl is 34 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and three children in Punto Cuatro, in Mochumí district.  This is an agricultural area with regular commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than four years, José Raúl has been selling vegetables in Moshoqueque Market (the region's wholesale market).  He acquires his produce from the area's farmers and sells it to wholesale and retail traders who frequent the market.  His business is his most important source of income.  For this reason he always tries to keep it going to the best of his ability.

José Raúl would like to have his own capital so that he can acquire merchandise when he needs it.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for his sales business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda, y vive con dos de sus diez hijos en el Pueblo Joven Santa Rosa, en los alrededores de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva 33 años vendiendo carne de pollo en el Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el mercado principal de la ciudad, por las mañanas y por la tardes vende anticuchos de carne (meat kabob) en la ciudad de Lambayeque, estos negocios ha sustentado a su familia durante todo este tiempo y sigue dando lo mejor de sí para seguir adelante.

Ella compra la carne, tanto de pollo como de vaca, a diversos distribuidores, los que la abastecen periódicamente, ofrece sus productos a sus clientes a un precio razonable, razón por la que ha sabido mantener una fiel clientela.

Carmen desea adquirir carne de pavo para implementar su negocio y poder responder a la demanda que suele aumentar por estas fechas navideñas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Carmen ya ha trabajado anteriormente con un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. El anterior préstamo le permitió adquirir mas carne para poder ampliar su negocio y gracias a ello su clientela aumentó. Por ello Carmen se encuentra contenta y agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través del fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
Carmen is 62 years old.  She is a widow and lives with her ten children in the village of Pueblo Joven Santa Rosa, in the suburbs of the city of Chiclayo.

She’s been selling poultry in the Modelo Market in Chiclayo for the past 30 years.  This is the city’s principle market.  She also sells meat kabobs in the mornings and the evenings in the city of Lambayeque.  These businesses have supported her family for all this time and she continues to do her best to get ahead.

She buys the meat, both chicken and beef, from different distributors, who supply her periodically, and she offers her products at reasonable prices.  Because of this, she has loyal customers.

Carmen wants to buy turkey meat to add to her business and meet the customer demand that swells during the Christmas season.  For this reason she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa, in order to help meet her goal.

Carmen has had a previous loan that was also funded through Kiva and obtained through Edpyme Alternativa’s seed money.  Her previous loan allowed her to buy more meat so that she could expand her business.  Thanks to this, her customer base also increased.  Carmen is happy and grateful to those who have helped her through Kiva.

loans.use: Turkey

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María Nelly es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Quemazón del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola habitada por personas humildes y muy trabajadoras, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Usualmente cría aves de corral, cerdos y ovejas en algunos ambientes situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo viaja hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo para venderlos en el Mercado Moshoqueque. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, por ello María siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda responder a la demanda que durante estas fechas suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Nelly is a 25 year old mother who lives with her husband and son in the Quemazón settlement, located in the Mórrope district.  This is an agricultural zone where the people are humble and hard working.  It’s located within the Lambayeque province and is more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells animals; usually farm birds, hogs, and sheep in an area behind her house.  When they have reached a level state of development, she takes them to sell in the Moshoqueaue market in Chiclayo.  This business is an important source of income for her family’s finances, so she always tries to keep it in the best shape possible.

María wants to expand her business by buying more animals and balanced feed so that she can meet the end of year demand.  For this reason she has seen fit to request a loan for 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Animals and feed

loans.name: Alexis Ivan

texts.es:
Alexis es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en la localidad de Pacanguilla, una zona ubicada en el distrito de Pacanga, provincia de Chepén, región La Libertad. Una zona agrícola situada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace más de dos años a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El cría sus animales en diversos ambientes situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona con frecuencia y al público en general. La actividad es la más importante fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta por lo que trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

Alexis desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para poder satisfacer la demanda que se suele incrementar por temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Alexis is 34 years old and head of household; he lives with his family in the town of Pacanguilla which is an area located in the district of Pacanga, a province of Chepén, and a region in La Libertad.  He has been raising and selling small animals for more than 2 years.  He raises his animals in diverse environments in the back of his residence and when the animals have reached a good level of development he sells them to merchants who frequent the area and to the general public.  This activity is the most important source of income that he counts on, which is why he tries to maintain it as best as possible.  Alexis wishes to purchase more animals and balanced feed to be able to meet the demand that tends to increase during Christmas time.  This is why he has deemed it convenient to solicit Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 2000 ($725 USD) nuevos soles.

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed to expand his business of raising and selling livestock.

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.en:
Etelvina is forty-six years old.  She lives in the village of Sandial in the district of Pitipo, a region of northern Peru near the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  She shares her home with her husband and their one young child.

Etelvina and her husband are farmers.  They both raise animals and manage a small plot of farm land.  Etelvina raises pigs and turkeys.  Her husband primarily tends to the land, raising yellow corn.  She plans to use the loan to complete the next farm planting and purchase additional feed for her animals.

This will be Etelvina’s second loan funded through Kiva.  She paid punctually and used the previous loan responsibly.  She has used a portion of the funds from this loan to repay the previous loan.  She has good personal and business references from her community and other businesses.  Edpyme Alternativa is proud to be able to work with her and assist her in meeting her goals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting corn and feed for animals

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío Prada del distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida a nivel nacional por sus festividades religiosas. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a más de una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cuatro años se dedica al cultivo de maracuyá, este cultivo es bastante común en la zona y los agricultores del lugar lo siembran en base a asociaciones, las cuales les permiten vender sus productos en el mercado nacional y extranjero. El cuenta con experiencia en el manejo de este cultivo y además siempre está al pendiente de las novedades técnicas de su manejo. Como es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta en su familia siempre trata de mantener su cultivo del mejor modo posible para obtener una buena cosecha.

José desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, de modo que se pueda garantizar una buena cosecha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José Manuel is a family man of 38, living with his wife and children in Prada, a rural settlement located in the district of Motupe, an area nationally renowned for its religious festivals. A part of the Lambayeque province, it is located at more than one hour 20 minutes form the city of Chiclayo.

He has been engaging in growing passion fruit for four years. This crop is fairly common in this area, and it is planted by local farmers organized in associations which allow them to sell their products in the national and international markets. He is very experienced in caring for this crop; on top of that, he always keeps himself updated on the technical novelties of this type of farming. As this is the only source of income his family can count on, he always tries to care for his crop in the best possible way in order to obtain a good harvest.

José wants to buy some fertilizers to provide good care for his crops, in order to be able to grant himself a good harvest, and for this reason he has though it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to maintain his passion fruit crops.

loans.name: María Clementina

texts.es:
María Clementina es una madre de familia de 56 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola y comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida al paso, para lo cual cuenta con un pequeño local situado en su domicilio. El domicilio se encuentra en una calle céntrica de su domicilio, además ella prepara sus alimentos con buena sazón y ofrece a sus clientes buen trato, por lo que su negocio tiene muy buena acogida. Esta es la principal fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta su familia, su esposo suele ayudarla en esta actividad.

María desea adquirir más insumos para preparar más comida, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en lo logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Clementina is a 56-year-old mother living with her family in the Tambogrande district, a rural and commercial area located in the Piura region, more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

She engages in preparing and selling fast food, and she does it in a small stand she has established in her house. Her activity is very well acknowledged not only because her house is located in a central street of her hometown, but also because the meals she prepares are really tasty and she treats her customers well. As this is the main source of income her family can count on, her husband usually helps her with it.

María wants to buy more ingredients to prepare more meals, and for this reason she has thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan on 1000 PEN that she plans to invest in order to reach her goal.

loans.use: To improve her activity by buying ingredient to preapre and sell meals.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is twenty-two years old.   He lives in the village of Senquelo in the district of Olmos.  Olmos is an area in northern Peru, primarily populated by small farmers. 

Marcos raises animals, specifically sheep and goats.  He raises the animals to the appropriate size and age and then sells them in local markets.  The animals serve as food for the local populace and are important parts of many traditional dishes.  Marcos has been raising animals for four years.

Marcos plans to use the loan to expand his herd and purchase additional feed for his animals.  His dream is to move on to larger animals one day, specifically cattle.  Marcos has good references and is considered a responsible young man.  He appreciates the opportunity to use credit to get one step closer to his dreams.

loans.use: Expand his herd and supplies of feed

loans.name: Natalio

texts.es:
Natalio tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en la localidad de Huaca de Barro del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola y comercial poblada de gente humilde y bastante trabajadora. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con animales menores los cuales cría en algunos corrales situados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Usualmente cría cerdos y aves de corral, alimentándoles de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona y al público en general. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia.

Natalio deseas adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para poder satisfacer la demanda que se suele incrementar por temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Natalio is 20 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Huaca de Barro, in Mórrope district, which is an agricultural and commercial area full of humble and quite hard-working people.  It is in Lambayeque province, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Natalio has young animals which he raises in some pens located outside his home.  He usually raises pigs and poultry, feeding them grains and natural fodder.  When the animals have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who always visit his area.  He also offers them to the general public.  He uses the profits he makes from this activity to cover his personal expenses and support his family.

Natalio would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed so that he can meet the demand which normally increases around the Christmas period.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy animals and balanced feed to expand his business

loans.name: Elar Odon

texts.es:
Elar es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijas en el sector La Clake , una localidad rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Reque, una zona comercial ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades agrícolas desde que era joven, actualmente el cuenta con un pequeño criadero de cuyes, los cuales engorda para ofrecerlos en venta a sus vecinos y negociantes que siempre vienen a comprárselos para comercializarlos en los principales mercados de la región. Adicionalmente el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar maíz. Con los ingresos que el percibe se encarga de solventar los gastos de su familia y sacarlos adelante.

Elar desea hacer mejoras en su criadero construyendo mejores corrales y adquiriendo alimento balanceado para lograr que sus cuyes de desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a un mejor precio.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitara Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elar is a 39 year-old father who lives with his wife and two daughters in La Clake sector, a rural place in Reque district which is a commercial area located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Elar has worked in farming since he was a young man.  He currently has a small guinea pig farm.  He fattens the guinea pigs up and then offers them for sale to his neighbors and traders who always come to buy them from him so that they can re-sell them in the main markets of the region.  Elar also has a plot of land where he grows corn.  He uses the income he makes from this activity to cover his family's expenses and get them ahead in life.

Elar would like to make improvements to his guinea pig farm, building better pens and acquiring balanced feed so that his guinea pigs develop in the best way possible and can be sold for a better price.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed and to fix his pens so that he can expand his business raising and selling guinea pigs

loans.name: Rossana Judith

texts.es:
Rossana es una madre de familia que tiene 25 años de edad, reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector Cusupe del distrito de Monsefú, una zona agrícola que situada a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a confeccionar artesanalmente carteras y canastas de junco, las cuales vende a los comerciantes de artesanías del distrito de Monsefú. Adicionalmente cuenta con un horno de pan que también le sirve como herramienta para garantizar el sustento a su familia. Actualmente se encuentra fabricando panetón y los está vendiendo a las tiendas de la zona. Estas actividades le permiten ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rossana desea adquirir material para poder fabricar más carteras, así como insumos para seguir elaborando panetón por temporada navideña, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rossana is a 25 year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in Cusupe sector, in Monsefú district, an agricultural area which is fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Rossana hand makes bags and baskets from reeds.  She sells these to handicraft dealers from Monsefú district.  She also has a bread oven which she uses as a tool to guarantee her family's maintenance.  She is currently making panettones and selling them in local stores.  These activities allow her to help her husband to support their family financially.

Rossana would like to acquire material so that she can make more bags as well as supplies so that she can keep making panettones for the Christmas season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy reeds to make her bags and baskets

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.en:
Blanca is thirty-four years old.   She lives in the village of Escute in the district of Olmos.  Olmos is an area in northern Peru, primarily populated by small farmers.   Blanca shares her home with her partner and their two children.

Out of the front of her home, Blanca manages a small general store.  She sells various basic goods including hygienic supplies, food, candy, and miscellaneous tools.  She is proud to be able to serve her community and reduce the time they must spend traveling in order to complete their shopping.  She has managed the store for a number of years now and has a loyal clientele. 

Blanca plans to use the loan to expand her merchandise.  She hopes to be able to obtain bulk discounts and improve her store’s profitability.  It is her dream to own a larger and more sustainable store.  She hopes this loan will hope her reach that growth.  Blanca is very well respected in her community and has good references.  Edpyme Alternativa is excited to be able to introduce you to her and to help her obtain access to credit.

loans.use: Expand her inventory

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Mi Carcape, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la siembra y comercio de flores. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde las siembra para luego cortarlas y ofrecerlas en venta en los cementerios de la región, cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro y gracias a esta actividad ha podido solventar los gastos económicos de su familia y sacarla adelante.

Fidel desea brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos para lograra obtener flores de mejor calidad, por ello ha creído conveniente comprar abonos, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles
texts.en:
Fidel is a 47 year-old father who lives with his wife and three children in Mi Carcape, an agricultural area in Monsefú district which is more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Fidel grows and sells flowers.  He has a plot of land where he sows his flowers to later cut them and offer them for sale in the region's cemeteries.  He has quite a lot of experience in the field and thanks to this activity he has been able to cover his family's expenses and get them ahead in life.

Fidel would like to maintain his crops so that he obtains better flowers from them.  For this reason, he would like to buy fertilizer and he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To maintain his flowers to improve his business

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen de 50 años, reparte comida a trabajadores haciendo en su casa los almuerzos. Es soltera y vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo. Ella comenzó hace 5 años atrás a vender comida a sus vecinos ya que no había tenido oportunidad  de trabajar en una actividad fija. 

Comenzó ha vender almuerzos por el valor de $ 1.60 el cual contiene sopa de vegetales, plato fuerte y jugo. Por la buena administración que ha tenido en sus comidas ahora reparte comida a diferentes trabajadores en la tarde. Actualmente hace las comidas en su casa porque no tiene un negocio estable.  Tiene muchas metas que cumplir todavía pero por ahora ella quiere tener un restaurante para asegurar su vejez aunque no tiene hijos ni esta casada ella quiere seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a sus hermanas y esperar en un futuro tener su familia. 

Quiere tener su propio local por eso con el préstamo va a comprar sillas, mesas y un horno para su cocina. En el futuro quiere tener el restaurante típico del Ecuador.
texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old.  She delivers meals to workers, making the lunches in her home.  Carmen is single and lives in an urban area called Guasmo.  She started selling meals to neighbors five years ago as she didn't have the opportunity to work in a regular job.

She started selling lunches for $1.60.  This included vegetable soup, main dish and juice.  Through her good management of her business, she now delivers meals to different workers in the afternoons.  She currently makes meals in her home because she doesn't have a stable business.  She has many goals which she would still like to achieve but for now she would like to own a restaurant to guarantee her old age.  Although she isn't married and doesn't have children, she would like to continue working so that she can help her sisters and hope, in the future, to have her own family.

Carmen would like to have her own premises.  She is requesting this loan to buy tables, chairs and an oven for her kitchen.  In the future she would like to own a typical Ecuadorean restaurant.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business and meet the needs of his family

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to make a bakery in her house and support her husband

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is thirty year old, single  and a mother of four. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, in a rented house. She has a dream of owning her own residence in the next five years. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for three years. The income generated has helped her to pay the school fees for her children. She hopes to become a wholesale seller in future. 

Enid needs the loan to buy supplies of sugar, salt and soap to resell.

loans.use: Buying supplies of soap, sugar and salt to resell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 36-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda, staying in a semi permanent house with a dream of owning a permanent one in the future. For seven years now, he has been in tea farming, which has helped him buy land for plantation extension. His dream is to increase it by up to 10 acres of land. Lawrence intends to use the credit facility to plant more tea.

loans.use: Planting tea

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a thirty five year old married man with six children living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda.  He has a dream of educating his children up to tertiary level. For two years Christopher has been in the motorcycle business and the sector has helped him to promptly provide basic needs for his family. Christopher needs the credit to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional DJ Equipment

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 43-year-old mother of six children. Layla has a cosmetics salon which she runs from her home.

Layla needs this loan to buy cosmetic supplies such as creams, lotions, wax, and manicure and pedicure products. Layla is building up a steady clientele who are appreciative of her professionalism and high quality of work.

Layla wants to make sure her eldest daughter studies at university and gains her degree and eventually she wants all of her children to receive a higher education. In her business she wants to branch out to gift products and specialty items for holidays and anniversaries. One day she wants to develop her business into a specialty boutique salon serving women of the entire area.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 40-year-old mother of 11 children. She is a skilled seamstress who began selling children's clothes and making a living for herself and her family. Since Sahar opened her store a year and a half ago she has sold children's clothes and gained a strong clientele.

With the loan, Sahar will expand to women's clothing as well. There is a high demand with the holidays and this stock could ensure important income. One day Sahar wants to expand into men's clothing and become one-stop shopping for the entire family. In the future she wants to branch out into other items such as shoes and accessories. Sahar is developing a steady income with her business and has gained the respect and support of her husband and family.

loans.use: To expand her stock to include women's apparel

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 59-year-old mother of four grown children. She has run her own daycare since 1990. Originally she lived and ran her business in northern Israel but during the recent war she was forced to close her daycare since her clients all evacuated the area for security reasons. During the war Sylvia ran into trouble with the bank. She never had a history of economic difficulties before but the war and the difficult situation in the north had their effect.

She relocated to central Israel and has reopened her daycare this year. During 2010 she became certified by the municipality and is promised clients with payments through the city. Sylvia wanted a bank loan but was unqualified due to her past problems during the war. She took this loan to purchase cribs, toys and additional supplies.  

Sylvia knows she has a promised flow of children through the municipality.  She hopes to move to a location with a garden attached to her daycare in the future and continue thriving in her business. With her children grown she looks forward to helping them establish their homes and helping them economically.

loans.use: To purchase cribs, toys and other daycare supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish renovating her store and purchase store supplies

loans.name: Blandine

texts.en:
Blandine is 32 years old and married with three children between five and 12 years old. She owns a business selling children’s clothing and her husband is a security guard.   

Blandine has been running her business for the past 11 years. She will use her loan to buy more children’s clothes. Blandine hopes to use the profits from her business to buy a house instead of renting. In the future, she would like to sell a variety of clothes for both men and women.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 68 years old and married with four children who are between fourteen and twenty years old. All of her children currently go to school. Esperance’s husband works as a driver. 

For the past six years, Esperance has been selling CDs and DVDs. She will use her loan to expand her business and buy additional stock. In the future, Esperance dreams of setting up a studio.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Nayima

texts.en:
Nayima is 27 years old and married with one child who is currently attending school. For the past five years, Nayima has been selling products such as shampoo, hair relaxer, and hair conditioners. Her husband works with Nayima in a hair salon. 

Nayima is requesting a loan to purchase more beauty products for the salon. With the profits from expanding her business, Nayima plans to renovate her house and, in the future, she would like to own a studio.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is 40 years old and married with six children between one and 19. All of her children, except the youngest, are currently in school. Matilda’s husband is a motor vehicle mechanic.

For the past 14 years, Matilda has been operating a business selling various food items. She will use her loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Matilda plans to refurbish her house.  In the future, she would like to establish a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: to buy food items

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 42 years old and married with eight children between four and 22. All of her children currently attend school. Zainabu’s husband works as an artist. 

For the past seven years, Zainabu has owned a business that sells palm oil. She will use her loan to buy more palm oil and also to buy women’s clothing. Zainabu hopes to use the profits from her business to provide food for her family. In the future, she would like to buy a market stall for her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 35 years old and married with two children between seven months and three years old.  Her husband sells clothes. For the past eight years, Florence has owned a boutique business that sells variety of items. She will use her loan to buy more merchandise to sell. Florence hopes to use her profit to re-invest in her business and renovate her house. In the future, she dreams of seeing her business quickly expand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Appolinarie

texts.en: Appolinarie is 31 years old, married and has one child who is five years old. Appolinarie has operated a business selling foodstuffs for 5 years. Her husband works as a carpenter. Appolinarie will use this loan to purchase more items and increase her stock. With the new profits from her expanded business, Appolinarie plans to build a house. She hopes to have her own truck in the future for business use.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas is 38 years old and single. He takes photographs for a living and also owns a men's salon. He has been in this business for seven years. He says that his business is successful because he has managed to build a house from his business. He has requested this loan to buy more equipment for his business. With the profits, he plans to improve the quality of his photos.

loans.use: to buy more cameras and salon equipment

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 28 years old and she is married to a motorcyclist. She has three children aged between five months and six years. One of her children goes to school. Delphine has been operating a boutique, selling a variety of items, for two years. She needs this loan to buy more items such as soaps, rice, biscuits and sweets to sell. From the profit, she expects to buy a house which will be given to her first born. She would like to get a loan of 800,000 RWF in the future.

loans.use: to buy more soaps, rice, biscuits and sweets to sell

loans.name: Odile

texts.en: Odile is 21 years old and married with a child of four months. Her husband works as a mechanic. Odile has operated a business selling motorbike and bicycle spare parts for four years. She says that her business has done a lot in her life. With this loan, she expects to buy more spare parts to sell. The profits will be used to reinvest and import spare parts. She would like to be a great spare parts dealer in the future.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 24 years old. She is married and has two children, 1 and 2 1/2 years old. She has been working as a tailor for two years. Solange has requested this loan to upgrade her tailoring business. She hopes to establish a tailoring shop with the profit. She says that her business is crucial because it has allowed her to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more machines for her business

loans.name: Helenne

texts.en: Helenne is 25 years old. She is married and has two children, 1 and 5 years old. Her husband works as a photographer. Helenne has operated a business selling clothes for five years. She would like to get this loan to buy more clothes and she hopes to use the profit to buy a house instead of renting. She says that her business prospers because she has raised money to buy a plot of land and a camera. In the future, she would like to have 80% of the total business as profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 27 years old. She is married and has four children, including twins. Two of her children attend school but the twins are still too young for school. Her husband works as a mason. Marie Chantal has operated a business selling foodstuffs for three years. She would like to get this loan to buy more potatoes, green bananas and rice to sell. She says that her business is very significant because it has enabled her to renovate her house and build more houses. With the profit from this business, she would like to buy a vehicle to help in her business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Assinathi

texts.en: Assinathi is 20 years old, and is married with one one child who is five months old. Her husband works as an electrical technician. Assinathi sells charcoal.  She has been in this business for a period of two years. She would like to get this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Currently, she has reached the level of having her own boutique as a result of her business selling charcoal.  She wishes to expand her house as well as re-invest in her business. In the future, she would like to have a commercial shop.

loans.use: To buy chacoal to sell.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a single energetic man who is 31 years old. He has a boutique which sells a variety of items. He decided to request this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell and he has planned to build a home from the profits he anticipates. He would like to have a booming business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 29 years old. She is married and has two children who are between six and ten years old. Her husband works as a vet. Agnes sells clothes and she has spent seven years in this business. She needs this loan to buy more clothes to sell and she believes that the profit from the business will be used to buy livestock and reinvest. She dreams to get 70% of the total sales in the future as profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Gina Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Gina, ella tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 16- 10  y 9 años, el mayor esta en colegio y los menores en escuela, se marido es comerciante.

Trabaja junto a su marido  vendiendo   pescado, tres días a la semana se desplazan en el carro del marido a crucita donde compran el pescado que luego lo llevan a otras ciudades para vender su producto, entre las ciudades que visitan  todas las semanas están los cantones Pichincha, El Empalme y Quevedo, entregan al por mayor y al menudeo, en estos días trabajan desde las 5am hasta las 21h00 que regresan a su hogar. Dice que llevan haciendo estos recorridos por cuatro años  y que gracias a Dios les ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado y llevarlo a las ciudades antes mencionadas. Está en el Banco Comunal  ya 9 ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es tener otro carro un poco más grande.
texts.en: The members of the Las Américas Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of los reales tamarindos ["Reales Tamarindos" is the name of Portoviejo's soccer stadium and airport]. There you will find Ms. Gina, who is 32 years old and in a common-law marriage. She and her husband have 3 children together, who are 16, 10, and 9 years old. The oldest is in high school and the younger two are also in school. Her husband is a merchant. Gina and her husband work together selling fish. Three days a week, they travel in her husband's car to Crucita, where they buy fish that they then bring to other cities to sell. The cantons of Pinchincha, El Empalme, and Quevedo are among the cities that they visit every week. They deliver both wholesale and retail. On these days, they work from 5 AM until 9 PM, when they return home. Gina says that they have been covering this route for four years and that thanks to God, they have been doing well. This loan is to buy fish and bring them to the aforementioned cities. Gina has been in the communal bank for 9 cycles and she likes it for the ease of obtaining credit. Her dream is to have another car a little bit bigger than the one they have now.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Jessica Maricela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Jessica, ella tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de  10 y 7años, los dos están en escuela, su marido es comerciante. Para ella este es su sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la Fundación Espoir.

Se dedica además de su hogar al comercio, vende bisutería y dulces como: manjar, suspiros, galletas, rompope, ella prepara estos dulces bajo pedido, trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 12 pm ya que a esa hora llegan sus hijos de la escuela y tiene que atenderlos. La mercadería la compra en distribuidoras que le dejan a buen precio, para que a ella le quede ganancias.
 
Este crédito que solicito lo va a emplear en comprar bisutería e ingredientes necesarios para preparar los dulces. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Las Americas" meet every 15 days.

Here we find Jessica, who is 29 years old and in a common-law marriage which produced 2 children, who are 10 and 7 years old.  Her children are in school, and her husband is a merchant.  This is her 6th loan cycle with her communal bank, and she likes it because of the assistance provided by the 
Fundación Espoir.

She is devoted both to her home and her business, selling costume jewelry and sweets such as: dulce de leche, meringues, cookies, and eggnog.  She takes orders for these sweets, and she works every day from 9am until noon, because at this hour her children arrive home from school and she has to attend to them.  She buys her merchandise at a good price from the wholesalers so that she can have good earnings.  

This loan that she requests will be used to buy jewelry and the ingredients needed to make her sweets.  She dreams of having her own house, since the home she is living in is a rental.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, milk, sugar, butter and other ingredients to make sweets, and also to buy jewelry

loans.name: Raisa Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
Para Raisa este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado ya que a través de los créditos a podido incrementar sus ventas y así obtener ingresos que le sirven para poder seguir adelante en sus estudios. Ella tiene 20 años de edad, está soltera y estudia el segundo semestre de auditoría en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí. Vive en la casa de sus padres que la apoyan en lo que ellos pueden.

Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Nature Garden, trabaja todos los días tres horas por día y también en las noches en la universidad, donde les vende a sus compañeras de clases y profesoras. Entre los productos que mas vende están la linaza, shampo para la caída del cabello, gel reductor, entre otros. Los productos los recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar gel reductor, linaza y todos los productos que ella vende. Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y tener un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Américas communal bank meets every two weeks.

For Raisa this is her third cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help it’s given her because she’s been able to increase sales thanks to the loans thus obtaining income that has allowed her to continue with her studies.  

She is 20 years old, single and is in the second semester of Accounting at the Manabí Technical University.  She lives with her parents who support her in every way they can.

She sells natural products of the Nature Garden brand.  She works every day, three hours per day and also at nights at the university where she sells to her classmates and professors.  Among the products that sell best are the flax seed, shampoo to prevent hair loss and reducing gel, among others. She gets her products from a supplier in Portoviejo.

This loan is to buy reducing gel, flax seed and all the products she sells.  Her dreams are to finish her career and to have a good job.

loans.use: To buy Natural Garden brand products like reducing gel and flax seed.

loans.name: Olga Cristina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Olga, ella tiene 64 años de edad, está soltera  pero de una relación que tuvo hace mucho  tiene dos hijos de  33 y 22 años, los dos aun viven con ella y estudian en la universidad.

Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Nature Garden, también vende tarjetas de telefonía celular, aguas, colas y gelatinas, todos sus productos los vende en su casa, trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 19 h00. Entre los productos que más vende están el vitatoro, Esperoline, vitacerebral, gel reductor, entre otros. Los productos los recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar gel reductor, vitatoro, vitacerebral y otros productos que ella vende. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Las Américas Communal Bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

In this place we find Olga, 64 years old.  She is single, but from a relationship long ago she has two children, 22 and 33 years old.  They both live with her and study at the university.

She sells Nature Garden brand natural products, as well as cell phone cards, water, soda, and jellies, all from her home.  She works every day from 9am to 7pm.  Her best-selling products include Vitatoro, Esperoline, Vitacerebral, and reducing gel, among others.  She receives the products at a distribution company in Portoviejo.

This loan is to buy reducing gel, Vitatoro, Vitacerebral and other products that she sells.  Her dream is to have her own house, since where she lives is rented.

loans.use: To buy reducing gel, Vitatoro, Vitacerebral, and more products such as cell phone cards, water, soda, and jellies.

loans.name: Victoria Azucena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas. 

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Victoria, ella tiene 41 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijas de 16 y 5 años, la mayor esta en colegio y la menor en escuela.
 
 Al verse sola con los gastos de su familia y mucho mas con los gastos de la escuela ella decidió instalar en su casa un pequeño bazar en el que vende bisutería y otras cosas, en la actualidad desea comprar ropa para la venta ya que con lo que gana con los artículos que vende no le alcanza para los gastos que ella tiene, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 08h30 hasta las 16h00.

Este crédito es para comprar más cosas de bazar además de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y otras prendas de vestir. Está en el banco comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta los créditos y la facilidad para conseguirlos. Sus sueños son tener un buen trabajo y darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Américas communal bank meets every two weeks.

Here we find Victoria, 41, a single mother of two daughters who are 16 and 5 years of age.  The oldest is in secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school.

When she found herself alone with all the family expenses to take care of and later even more with educational costs she decided to set up a small store in her house to sell costume jewelry and other things.  She currently wants to buy clothes to sell because what she earns selling the other things just isn’t enough to cover her expenses.  She works Monday through Saturday from 8:30am until 4:00pm.

This loan is to buy more things for the store like pants, blouses, t-shirts and other articles of clothing.  She has been in the communal bank for two cycles and she likes the loans and the ease with which one can get them.  Her dreams are to have a good job and to provide the best for her daughters.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store: costume jewelry, pants, blouses, t-shirts and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Agustina Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Agustina, ella tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15 – 10 y 7 años, la mayor esta en colegio y los menores están en escuela. Su marido es mecánico. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación Espoir.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa,  también tiene un restaurante en la casa de su mamá, trabaja de lunes a sábado,  prepara deliciosos platos y el preferido de sus clientes es el viche de mariscos, además en su restaurante aprovecha  para vender la ropa a la mayoría de sus clientes. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil. En su negocio le ayuda su mamá.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, pantalones, camisas, blusas, etc. Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Américas communal bank meets every two weeks.

Here we find Agustina, 37.  She is in a common law relationship and has three children who are 15, 10 and 7 years of age.  The oldest is in secondary school and the younger two are in elementary school.  Her husband is a mechanic.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the help she’s gotten from Fundación Espoir.

She sells clothes.  She also has a restaurant in her mother’s house.  She works from Monday through Saturday.  She prepares delicious dishes.  Her customers’ favorite is seafood ceviche (marinated seafood cocktail).  Besides, she takes advantage of the restaurant to sell clothes to most of her customers.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil.  Her mother helps her with the business.

This loan is to buy clothes: pants, shirts, blouses, etc.  Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Wilma Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
La señora Wilma está en  el Banco Comunal hace  12 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que ha recibido de parte de la institución y por las charlas que le sirven de mucha ayuda. Ella tiene 57 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de 23 – 20 y 14 años los mismos que estudian en Universidad y la menor esta en escuela. Ella además cuida de unos sobrinos.
 
Se dedica a preparar  y vender  almuerzos, los mismos que los vende en su casa donde ha adecuado un pequeño comedor,  también prepara para ir a entregar a personas que le realizan los pedidos de comida. Trabaja de lunes a viernes y los sabados y domingos prepara el delicioso encebollado el  cual vende solo en su casa, en su trabajo le ayudan sus hijas.
  
Este crédito es para comprar ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus sueños son que sus hijas terminen sus estudios y sean buenas profesionales. Además  algún día tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Américas communal bank meets every two weeks.

Here we find Wilma who has been in the communal bank for 12 cycles.  She likes it because of the additional benefits she has received from the institution and for the talks that she finds very useful.  She is 57 years old and has three children who are 23, 20 and 14 years of age.  The two older ones are in the university and the youngest is in school.  She also cares for some nephews.

She prepares lunches to sell.  She sells them in her house where she has set up a small eatery.  She also prepares meals for home delivery to people who order them from her.  She works from Monday through Friday and on Saturdays and Sundays she makes the delicious “encebollado” (fish stew typical of the coastal regions of Ecuador) which she sells only at home.  Her daughters help her with her work.

This loan will be used to buy ingredients to prepare her meals.  Her dreams are that her daughters finish their schooling and that they become good professionals.  She’d also like to have a great restaurant some day.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: José Amadeo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
Aquí conocimos a don José, él está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos y le gusta porque en las charlas aprende mucho y además porque los créditos le sirven de mucha ayuda. Tiene 55 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 14 años que estudia en colegio. Nos cuenta que además con su primera esposa que falleció hace muchos años tuvo tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su mujer se dedica a las labores del hogar.
 
Tiene un negocio  de transporte escolar de lunes a viernes,  los sábados y domingos se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado en la feria libre. Nos cuenta que realiza dos a cuatro viajes diarios para dejar a los alumnos tanto en sus colegios como también en su casa cuando ya salen de sus colegios, nos cuenta que lleva prestando este servicio ya por 8años y que esto le ha servido para sacar a su familia adelante. Y que vende sus frutas porque en la actualidad con lo que gana en el transporte no le es suficiente y esto le representa ganancias extras.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas, verduras y legumbres. Su sueño es ver que su hijo menor sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the 'Las Américas' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Here we meet José.  He has been a member of the community bank for two loan cycles and he likes it because he learns a lot from the talks and the loans are very helpful.  José is 55 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife, with whom he has a 14 year old son who is in high school.  He tells us that he had three children with his first wife who died many years ago.  These children are already grown up and independent.  His wife looks after the household chores.

José has a school transport business in which he works from Monday to Friday.  On Saturdays and Sundays he sells fruit and vegetables in the farmers' market.  He tells us that he makes two to four journeys a day to drop his students off both in their schools and at home when they get out of school.  He tells us that he has been providing this service for 8 years and that this has helped him to get his family ahead in life.  He says that he sells fruit because currently his income from the transport business isn't enough and the fruit sales make him extra money.

This loan will be used to buy more fruit, greens and vegetables.  His dream is to see his youngest son become a great professional.

loans.use: To buy fruit, greens and vegetables

loans.name: Nelly Mireya

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas. 

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nelly, ella tiene 40 años de edad,  está soltera  pero de una relación que tuvo hace mucho  tuvo  cuatro hijos de 20 – 17  - 13 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela.

Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos, productos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Además de ropa tanto nacional como también colombiana, entre lo que más vende están la ropa intima de mujer que son muy solicitadas por las damas, trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, cobra semanalmente y dice que le encanta vender.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería, como camisas, blusas, pantalones, ropa intima y productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco hace tres ciclos y le encanta por la ayuda que le dan. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the 'Las Américas' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Here we meet Nelly.  She is 40 years old, single, and has four children aged 20, 17, 13 and 7 from a relationship she had a long time ago.  Her children are studying at university, high school and elementary school.

Nelly sells products through catalogs and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  As well as national and Colombian clothing, what she sells most of is women's underwear which is very much in demand.  She works for five hours every day.  She sells her products door to door and to order.  She collects her payments every week and she says that she loves to sell.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as shirts, blouses, pants, underwear and Yanbal products.  Nelly has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it for the help that it has given her.  Her dream is to own her own home since the one in which she is currently living is rented.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, blouses, underwear and Yanbal products

loans.name: Gissela Renata

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.

La señora Gissela lleva en el Banco Comunal  5 años, desde que cumplió la mayoría de edad y pudo ingresar ella entro a formar parte del Banco en el cual está  muy contenta, le gustan las charlas más que todo las de salud. Tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hermoso bebe de 7 meses.
 
Se dedica al comercio, vende de ropa de todo tipo, sandalias y además tiene  una pequeña distribuidora de agua en bidón. tiene muchos clientes que le realizan pedidos  y entrega sus productos en su casa. Ella deja sus productos a créditos y cobra semanalmente. Compra su mercadería en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja cada fin de mes y a veces hasta dos veces  dependiendo de las ventas que realice. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 14h00.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, sandalias y ropa de niñas. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia y un  local comercial.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Américas communal bank meets every two weeks.

Gissela has been in the communal bank for five years.  Since she became an adult and was able to join she became part of the bank.  She is very happy in it.  She enjoys the talks, especially the ones on health.  She is 23 years old and is in a common law relationship that has produced a beautiful 7 month old baby.

She is a merchant.  She sells all kinds of clothing and sandals.  She also has a small drinking water jug distributorship.  She has many customers that place orders with her and she home delivers.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil, a city she travels to every end of the month and sometimes even twice depending on how sales go.  She works every day from 8am until 2pm.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, sandals and girls’ clothes.  Her dreams are to have her own house and a commercial locale.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, sandals and girls' clothes.

loans.name: Martha Tereza

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 25 Rosas.

En este hermoso lugar encontramos a la señora Martha, ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero que aún viven en su casa, su esposo es comerciante, vende mariscos.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo donde vende productos básicos, mariscos, queso, carne, etc., trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que su tienda es pequeña pero que tiene de todo en cantidad y variedad ya son varios años que lleva con ella. Su mercadería la compra en Bahía y Portoviejo. Además también recibe en su local parte de la mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más productos para surtir aun mas su tienda como arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la tesorera del Banco. Su  sueño es tener una tienda mucho mas grande.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the '25 Rosas' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

In this beautiful place we meet Martha.  She is 47 years old, married, and has two grown-up children who still live with her.  Her husband is a salesman who sells seafood.

Martha has a small store where she sells basic household products, seafood, cheese, meat, etc.  She works every day from 7.00am to 7.00pm.  She tells us that her store is small but that she has everything in quantity and variety.  She has been in this business for several years.  She buys her goods in Bahía and Portoviejo.  She also receives some of her goods direct to her store.

Martha will use this loan to buy more products to stock her store such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, etc.  Martha has been in her community bank since the beginning and she is the current treasurer.  Her dream is to have a much bigger store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other goods

loans.name: Juana Ofelia

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 25 Rosas.

Para la señora Juana los años han pasado muy rápido aun recuerda cuando con algunas amigas decidieron unirse y formar el Banco Comunal, ahora después de tantos años se siente satisfecha por la ayuda que han recibido tanto ella como sus compañeras del grupo, se desempeña como secretaria del Banco, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 17 y 9 años los cuales estudian en colegio y escuela.
 
Ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo. Su forma de venta es  puerta a puerta o por encargo, tiene muchos clientes que le piden sus productos ya que les da facilidades de pago, ella cobra los fines de semana lo cual es una ventaja ya que al cobrar realiza nuevas ventas. Trabaja los fines de semana casi todo el día con la ayuda de una hermana. La mercadería  compra una vez al mes en Guayaquil ya que allá hay más variedad de productos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pantalones de damas y caballeros, camisetas, blusas y carteras ya que tiene algunos encargos. Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas y un almacén donde ampliar sus ventas con mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, rich food, and quality of people, the 25 Rosas (Roses) Communal Bank meet every 15 days.

For Juana, the years have passed very quickly although she still remembers when some friends decided to band together and form the communal bank. Now after so many years, she is satisfied by the help that she has received as well as by the help her fellow members have received. She acts as secretary for the bank, she is 41 years old, and she is a single mother of two children who are 17 and 9 years old and are in primary and secondary school.

She is a sales woman, selling all types of clothes. She sells door to door and by advance order. She has a lot of customers who order her products because she gives them payment options. She collects payments on weekends which is good because when she's collecting payments she can also make additional sales. She works almost all day on the weekends with her sister's help. She buys her merchandise once a month at the market in Guayaquil because there is more product variety there.

This loan will be used to buy men's and women's pants, shirts, blouses, and wallets because she already has several orders. Her dream is to buy a car that she can use to make sales in. She also wants a store where she can expand her sales to include a larger variety of products.

loans.use: Purchase women's and men's pants, shirts, blouses, and wallets

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 25 Rosas.

En este hermoso lugar encontramos a la señora María, ella tiene 52 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado cuatro  hijas de 33 – 23 – 20 y 19 años, con ella viven las dos menores una de ellas estudia en la Universidad, su esposo es comerciante, vende mariscos.

Ella y su esposos se dedican al comercio,  venden  mariscos, trabajan todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 15h00, realizan todas sus actividades que van desde la comprar de sus productos a los pescadores hasta llevarlos a entregar a sus clientes, entregan sus productos al hospital de Bahía,  también tienen un puesto en el mercado en el cual venden al menudeo a las personas que a diario llegan hasta el lugar a realizar sus compras, dice que tienen en su negocio ya por 20 años y que siempre le ha ido bien ya que a ellos el trabajo no les incomoda.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos como pescado, camarón, ostiones entre otros. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es comprar un carro para llevar sus productos a entregar en Quito que es un buen mercado.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the '25 Rosas' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

In this beautiful place we meet María.  She is 52 years old and lives with her common-law husband with whom she has four daughters aged 33, 23, 20 and 19.  She still lives with her two youngest daughters, one of whom is studying at university.  Her husband is a salesman who sells seafood.

María and her husband both sell seafood.  They work every day from 5.00am to 3.00pm.  They buy their products from the fisherman and they deliver them to their customers.  They deliver their products to Bahía Hospital and also have a market stall from which they sell their seafood retail to people who come there every day to do their shopping.  They say that they have had their business for 20 years and that it has always done very well because they are happy to work.

This loan will be used to buy more products such as fish, prawns, scallops, etc.  María has been a member of her community bank for 5 years and she likes the ease with which she can obtain loans.  Her dream is to buy a car so that she can take her products to Quito which is a good market.

loans.use: To buy fish, prawns, scallops, etc.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, ella tiene 64 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado 4 hijos, ya todos son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos este año se incorpora del colegio. Su marido es taxista. Hace varios años estudio corte y confección en un centro de estudios de Bahía. Ella está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución.
 
Tiene un pequeño taller de corte y confección en su casa, realiza muchos trabajos a las personas que la buscan para que ella les confecciones sus obras, además de coser también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas) y agua en bidón, trabaja todos los días en sus diversas actividades desde las 8am hasta las 19h00.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, productos Yanbal y agua en bidón. Sus sueños son tener un local más grande y un mejor negocio.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Los Laureles' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

Here we find María.  She is 64 years old and lives with her common-law husband who is a taxi driver.  They have four grown-up children.  The youngest is in high school.  Several years ago, María studied dressmaking in a community college in Bahía.  She has been a member of her community bank since it was first founded and she likes it for the additional benefits with which our institution provides her.

María has a small dressmaking workshop in her home.  She does a lot of work for people who want her to realize their dressmaking projects.  As well as sewing, she also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories), and cans of water.  She works every day in her different businesses, from 8.00am to 7.00pm.

This loan will be used to buy fabric, Yanbal products and cans of water.  Her dreams are to have bigger premises and a better business.

loans.use: To buy fabric, Yanbal products and cans of water

loans.name: Mercy Mayuri
