texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

La señora Mercy  está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del mismo  y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por la ayuda que ha recibido tanto ella como sus amigas y colegas del grupo. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y ha procreado 6 hijos, cuatro de ellos son mayores de edad, los menores tienen 17 y 8 años que son los que viven en su casa y estudian en escuela y colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar como planchas, licuadoras, tostadoras, sabanas entre otros, también vende prendas de vestir. Trabaja dos días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, la mercadería se la llevan hasta bahía, ella realiza los pedidos y los recibe en su ciudad. Además de esto también tienen un tanquero en el cual reparten agua a las personas que les piden este servicio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos como planchas, licuadoras, camisas, pantalones, etc. Sus sueños son que sus hijos menores terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Los Laureles' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

Mercy has been a member of the community bank since it was founded.  She is the bank's president and she likes it for the additional benefits which our institution provides and also for the help which both she and her friends and fellow group members have received.  Mercy is 47 years old.  She is married and has six children, four of whom are grown up.  Her youngest two children are 17 and 8 years old.  They still live in her home and study in elementary school and high school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

Mercy is a saleswoman.  She sells household goods such as irons, blenders, toasters, sheets, etc.  She also sells clothes.  She works two days a week and sells her goods door to door.  Her goods are brought from Bahía.  She makes the orders and receives them in her city.  As well as this, she also has a tanker from which she distributes water to people who request this service.

This loan will be used to buy more products such as irons, blenders, shirts, pants, etc.  Her dream is for her younger children to finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy irons, blenders, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Yina María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Yina, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 3 años, los tres  mayores están en escuela. Su marido es mecánico.

Tienen un taller de mecánica automotriz en el que realizan muchos trabajos… además también  venden repuestos, llantas y aceites. Trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 7h30 hasta las 18h00, trabajan con la ayuda de dos operarios, mientras su esposo se encarga de los trabajos de mecánica, ella se encarga de lo que es la contabilidad, compra y venta de los repuestos, nos cuenta que llevan en ese trabajo ya por 9 años y que aunque al principio fue duro con el tiempo han conseguido muchos clientes que los prefieren por su trabajo y responsabilidad.

Este crédito lo va en emplear en comprar aceite, repuestos, filtros. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde los inicios del mismo y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Su meta es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Marianita de Jesús' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet Yina.  Yina is 28 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 10, 8, 6 and 3.  The three oldest children are in elementary school.  Her husband is a mechanic.

Yina and her husband have a garage in which they carry out a lot of work.  They also sell spare parts, tires and oils.  They work from Monday to Saturday, from 7.30am to 6.00pm.  They work with the help of two employees.  Whilst her husband works as a mechanic, Yina takes care of the accounts and buying and selling spare parts.  They tell us that they have been in this business for 9 years and, although it was difficult at first, over time they have attracted many customers who are loyal to their business because of the work they do and their responsibility.

This loan will be used to buy oil, spare parts and filters.  Yina has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it for the benefits that our institution provides.  Her goal is for her children to be good professionals.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, oils and filters

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

La señora Jessica es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que fue ella una de las personas que propuso crear este Banco, le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la institución a las socias que como ella realizan los créditos. Tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 7 y 4 años, la mayor esta en escuela, el marido trabaja en albañilería.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo de marcas nacionales y colombianas. También vende productos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días por las tardes, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella visita a sus clientes, les enseña la revista para que ellos vean que es lo que desean comprar, luego ella realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar más de su mercadería como pantalones, camisetas, blusas, y productos de Yanbal y Avon. Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén y ser profesora ya que le encanta enseñar.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Marianita de Jesús' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

Jessica is a founding member of her community bank and she tells us that she was one of the people who suggested the bank be founded.  She likes the bank for the help that our institution provides to its members who take loans like she does.  Jessica is 24 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 7 and 4.  Her eldest is in elementary school.  Her husband works as a construction worker.

Jessica is a saleswoman.  She sells national and Colombian clothes through a catalog.  She also sells Yanbal and Avon products (beauty pr4oducts, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every afternoon, selling door to door.  She visits her customers and shows them her catalogs so that they can see what they would like to buy.  She then makes her orders and delivers her products.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as pants, t-shirts, blouses and Yanbal and Avon products.  Jessica's dreams are to own her own store and to be a teacher since she loves to teach.

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and Yanbal and Avon products

loans.name: Ines Sabina

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

La señora Inés  es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la institución y por los beneficios adicionales que da la institución como por ejemplo el crédito emergente. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cinco  hijos, dos de ellos son menores y tienen 17 y 14 los mismos que estudian en colegio y viven con ella, el marido trabaja de operador de maquinaria para el cuerpo de ingenieros del ejército.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal y Esika ( productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería,  y accesorios para damas) trabaja cinco  días a la semana  desde las 8 am hasta las 16h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas cuando los productos salen más baratos y que cuando pasa la promoción los vende a precio normal con lo que se gana un dinero extra, y lo que más vende son los perfumes y bisutería.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos como: cremas, perfumes, bisutería entre otros, e invertir mas en los que estén de oferta ya que estos le dejan mayores ganancias. Su sueño es algún día tener un gran restaurante ya que además de la venta le encanta la cocina.
texts.en:
The members of the Marianita de Jesús communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Inés is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help the institution has provided as well as for additional benefits the institution gives like the emergency loans.  She is 43 years old, married and has five children.  Two of them are still minors; they are 17 and 14 years of age are in secondary school and still live with her.  Her husband is a Machine Operator for the Army’s Corps of Engineers.

She is a housewife who sells Yanbal and Esika brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories) to help with household expenses.  She works five days a week from 8am until 4pm.  She sells door to door. She tells us that she takes advantage of the promotional sales when the products are offered on sale and then she resells them at full price to earn a little extra.  What sells the most are perfumes and costume jewelry.

This loan is to buy products like: creams, perfumes and costume jewelry, among others, and to invest more in those items that are on sale and that produce the better profits.  Her dream is to someday have a great restaurant because besides sales she loves cooking.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Edita María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

En este lugar encontramos  a la señora Edita, tiene 57años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas vive en su casa con el esposo y tres hijos pequeños, los mismos que son la alegría de doña Edita. Su marido es albañil.  Ella es parte del Banco Comunal hace ya 3 ciclos y está muy a gusto por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Tiene un negocio de preparación y venta de corviches,  empanadas y helados de varios sabores, tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde todas las tardes vende las empanadas y corviches porque los helados los vende todo el día, trabaja en las mañanas en la producción de sus productos y en las tarde los vende.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales tales como maní, plátano y especias para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus sueños son ver que sus nietos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Marianita de Jesús communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Edita, 57, is married and has five adult children.  One of her daughters, her husband and three small children live with her.  They are Edita’s joy.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three cycles already and is very happy with the ease in getting loans.

She has a business making corviches (dough made from grated plantain, deep fried and stuffed with spicy fish or minced meat, topped with salad, mayo, chili), turnovers and ice cream of various flavors.  She has a small stand in her house where she sells turnovers and corviches in the evenings; she sells ice cream all day.  She works mornings preparing her products and then sells them in the evening.

This loan will be used to buy ingredients like peanuts, bananas and spices for the food preparation.  Her dream is to see her grandchildren go to school and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, bananas and spices.

loans.name: Rosa Dolores

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.
 
La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben para incrementar sus negocios. Tiene 39 años y está separada pero de esa relación que tuvo cuatro hijos  de 17, 14, 11 y 2 años los dos mayores estudian en colegio, otro en escuela.
 
Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 21h00, nos cuenta que no le dificulta vender hasta más tarde ya que su tienda la tiene en su casa, además de productos de primera necesidad también vende productos de Avon y Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería,  y accesorios para damas). Su mercadería la compra en Bahía  y Portoviejo. Recibe en su local parte de la mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, enlatados, etc.  Su sueño es tener un mini market con todas las comodidades para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the Marianita de Jesús communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Rosa is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help they get to increase business.  She is 39 years old and separated.  She has four children who are 17, 14, 11, and 2 years of age.  The two oldest go to secondary school and the other one is in elementary school.

She has a small grocery store.  She’s open every day from 6am until 9pm.  She says it isn’t difficult to stay open so late because the store is in her home.  Besides groceries she also sells Avon and Esika brand products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She buys her merchandise in Bahía and in Portoviejo.  Some of her merchandise is delivered to her location.

She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, etc.  Her dream is to have a minimarket with all the comforts for her customers.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Narcisa Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Narcisa, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos uno de 26 y  21 años,  el menor de ellos vive en su casa y está estudiando en universidad. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella trabaja en las tardes en un centro de recreación vacacional en la ciudad de bahía, pero en las mañanas se dedica junto  a su esposo al comercio,  compran y venden de pollos, tienen un puesto en el mercado de Bahía en el cual venden el pollo por libras o entero a las personas que a diario asisten a este lugar a realizar sus compras, trabajan desde las 6am hasta las 12h00 ya que a la 13h00 ella tiene que presentarse en su trabajo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más pollos para la venta de la semana. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la seriedad de las socias. Su sueño es  llegar a ser la administradora de su propio centro vacacional.
texts.en:
The members of the Marianita de Jesús communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

We find Narcisa, 46, here.  She is married and has two children who are 26 and 21 years of age.  The youngest still lives at home and is going to the university.  Her husband is a merchant.

She works afternoons at a vacation recreational center in Bahía but in the mornings she works in commerce with her husband.  They are chicken merchants.  They have a stand in Bahía’s market where they sell chicken by the pound or whole to people who come by daily to shop.  They are open for business from 6am until noon because at 1pm she has to report to work.

This loan is to buy more chickens for the week’s sales.  She has been in the communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because the members are committed.  Her dream is to become a manager of a vacation center.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Diana Gabriela

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Diana, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 2 años y de 4 meses. El marido es obrero, transporta material de construcción en una empresa. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon, (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana  desde las 9am hasta las 11am y de 14h00 a 16h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra los días sábado.

Este crédito es para comprar productos como: cremas, perfumes, bisutería entre otros. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus pequeños hijos para que algún día sean muy buenas personas y buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Marianita de Jesús' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet Diana.  She is 19 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have two children aged 2 years and 4 months.  Diana's husband is a worker.  He transports building material for a company.  Diana has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because the interest rates are very low.

Diana sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week from 9.00am to 11.00am and from 2.00pm to 4.00pm.  She sells her products door to door.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every Saturday.

This loan will be used to buy products such as creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc.  Her dreams are to provide her young children with a good education so that some day they will become good people and good professionals.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Ana Packili

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

La señora Ana tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre  de la cual ha tenido  tres hijos de de 19, 12 y 4 años, la mayor ya se comprometió y ya no vive en su casa.  Una de sus hijas estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el cual además de comida también vende batidos de frutas y otros productos elaborados. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, desde las 15h00 hasta las 23h00 o hasta que se termine lo que  preparo. También se dedica a la venta de ropa trabajo que lo realiza en las mañanas y también vende en su restaurante hasta donde sus clientes llegan a buscarla cuando necesitan alguna prenda de vestir. La mercadería la va a comprar una vez al mes a Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar dos licuadoras, vasos, y productos para la preparación de la comida, además de ropa para la venta. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y está muy contenta. Sus sueños son tener un restaurante más grande y un bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Unbelievable Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Ana, 35, is in a common law relationship and has three children who are 19, 12, and 4 years of age.  The oldest is engaged and no longer lives at home.  One of her daughters is in school and her husband’s a merchant.

She has a small restaurant in her house where besides selling food she also sells fruit smoothies and other prepared items.   She works every evening from 3pm until 11pm or until she sells out everything she prepared.  She also sells work clothes during the mornings and even sells clothes in the restaurant where customers can find her when they need an article of clothing.  She buys her merchandise once a month in Guayaquil.

She will use the loan to buy two blenders, glasses and ingredients for her meal preparation as well as clothing to sell.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she is very happy.  Her dream is to have a larger restaurant and a store.

loans.use: To buy two blenders, glasses, groceries and clothes.

loans.name: Martha Fanny

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Fanny  que nos cuenta algo de su vida. Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ha procreado dos hijos de 32 y de 24 años, su hija menor  vive en su casa con sus dos pequeños hijos. Su marido es comerciante.

Tiene una pequeña granja donde cría pollos y chanchos, compra los pollos pequeños en Bahía  en una incubadora y los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses hasta que estén listos y con buen peso, luego los pela y los lleva a entregar a las tiendas del lugar, igual hace con los cerdos los tiene por 4 meses y junto a su esposo los faena y vende la carne por libra a los vecinos y personas del lugar. Trabaja todos los días en el cuidado de sus animalitos unas tres horas por día pero cuando entrega hasta 8 horas ya que tiene que repartir sus productos.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar más pollos ya que la temporada que viene es muy buena y se venden muchos de estos animalitos.  Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a los Bancos. Sus sueños tener buena salud ella y los suyos y ver que sus nietos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Unbelievable Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Here we chatted with Fanny who tells a bit about her life.  She’s 57 years old, married and has two children who are 32 and 24 years of age.  Her youngest daughter and her two small children live with her.  Fanny’s husband is a merchant.

She has a small farm where she raises chickens and pigs.  She buys the chicks from an incubator in Bahía and keeps them for two to three months until they are ready and at a good weight.  She then butchers them and takes them to the local stores.  She does the same with the pigs.  She raises them for four months and then with her husband’s help she butchers them and sells the meat by the pound to neighbors and locals.  She works every day caring for her little animals about three hours a day except on delivery days when she works up to 8 hours because she has to make all her deliveries.

This loan will be used to buy more chickens because the season that’s approaching is a very good one and a lot of these little animals are sold.  This is her second cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because interest rates are very low compared to banks.  Her dream is that she and her loved ones are always healthy and to see her grandchildren become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Yesenia Vitalina

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

La señora Jessenia  tiene 27 años de edad, está casada hace 1 año y 10 meses y está en su cuarto mes de embarazo. Su marido trabaja de agente vendedor de artefactos en la ciudad de Bahía de Caraquez. Ellos son de Portoviejo pero por trabajo se vinieron a esta preciosa ciudad. 

Se dedica al comercio,  vende  productos de Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería, bisutería y accesorios para damas) lo cual realiza todos los días en las tardes ofreciendo sus productos que se los hace por pedidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días lo cual aprovecha para ofrecer otra vez sus productos.

Esta es la razón por lo que solicito este crédito ya que quiere compra más de sus productos como: cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, entre otros.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio, es socia fundadora y siempre le ha gustado por las charlas que le ayudan mucho en su vida diaria, es la tesorera del Banco.  Su meta es  tener una casa propia ya que en la que vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Unbelievable Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Jessenia, 27, has been married for a year and 10 months and is four months pregnant.  Her husband is a Home Appliance Sales Agent in the city of Bahía De Caraquez.  They are originally from Portoviejo but came to this beautiful city for work.

She is a merchant.  She sells Oriflame products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, costume jewelry and women’s accessories) every day during the afternoon.  Her sales are conducted on order.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks taking advantage of this opportunity to sell still more.

This is the reason behind the loan request.  She wants to buy more of her products like: creams, perfumes and cosmetics among others.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning, she is a founding member.  She has always liked it because of the talks that are very helpful in her everyday life.  She is the bank’s Treasurer.  Her goal is to own her own house because she is currently living in a rented one.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

Para la señora Ana este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de cumplir. Tiene 21 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, estudia el cuarto año en un colegio de la localidad.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de damas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, tiene muchas clientes, trabaja  cuatro horas a la semana en la entrega y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra por quincena. Su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo cada quince días  o al mes de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga y la urgencia de estos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa  interior ya que tiene algunos  pedidos para esta quincena y quiere cumplir con sus clientes. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad de sus compañeras del Banco. Le gustaría estudiar y ser una gran doctora.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Unbelievable Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Ana is in her third cycle with the communal bank.  She tells us that she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  She is 21 years old, single and lives with her parents.  She is in fourth year of high school.

She sells ladies underwear door to door.  She has a lot of customers.  She works four hours a week delivering and collecting payment since she sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo every two weeks or monthly according to how many pending orders she has or on how urgent they are.

This loan is to buy underwear since she has some pending orders for this two week period and she wants to comply with her customers.  This is her third cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because her fellow members are committed.  She’d like to study to become a great physician.

loans.use: To buy underwear.

loans.name: Edith María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Edith, ella tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 3 y 2 años. El marido es comerciante.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido y  a su familia  solicito este crédito para utilizarlo en el negocio que tiene su marido, el trabaja en la compra y venta de bidones de agua, el todos los días se desplaza en su moto que la ha adecuado para cargar muchos bidones, con la que sale a recorrer y entregar a los muchos clientes que tiene y a los que día a día entrega. Trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su marido lleva en este negocio ya  tres años y que en la actualidad tiene muchos clientes.
 
Este crédito que ella solicito es para comprar diez bidones con botellas y agua para tener sus propias botellones  con lo que el producto le saldría más barato y tendría más ganancias. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que viven en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Unbelievable Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

We find Edith, 21, here.  She is in a common law relationship and she has two children who are 3 and 2 years of age.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife who, in order to help her husband and family, requested this loan to use it in her husband’s business.  He sells large containers of drinking water.  He goes out every day on a motorcycle that he has adapted to carry a large amount of water jugs to deliver water to his large number of customers who he has to deliver to every day. He works from 8am until 8pm.  Our friend tells us that her husband has had this business for three years now and he has quite a few customers.

The loan she requested is to buy ten water jugs and water for them to store so that the product will be less expensive that way and their profits will be higher.  This is her third loan with the communal bank and she likes it because interest rates are low.  Her dream is to have her own house because they currently live in her mother’s house.

loans.use: To buy ten large jugs of drinking water.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside junto  a su familia en el caserío El Romero, una zona agrícola de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de dos años, el cuenta con animales menores los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel  de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes  que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Con esta actividad el se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Andrés desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Andrés is a 31 year old father living with his family in El Romero, a farming area of humble and hard working residents located in Mórrope district over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has worked for over two years raising small farm animals.  He raises them in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants who tend to visit the area where he lives.  This activity is what he supports his family with.

Andrés would like to acquire more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them to expand his business and sales.  He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to help him reach this goal.

loans.use: To acquire more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
Bernardino es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto  a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Jayanca, una zona agrícola de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de seis años a la venta de helados de manera ambulante, para realizar su actividad se vale de un carrito. Sus zona de venta son su mismo distrito y los sectores aledaños a la zona en donde vende. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Bernardino desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más helado de modo que puedas satisfacer le demanda de sus clientes durante la temporada de verano. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500.
texts.en:
Bernardino is a 36 year old father living with his wife and two children in Jayanca district, a farming area inhabited by humble and hard working people that is located over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For over six years he has been a street vendor of frozen treats.  To do this he avails himself of a small ice cream cart.  His sales zone is his same district and the areas neighboring where he lives.  Income from this activity allows him to support his family.

Bernardino would like to expand his business buying more ice cream to meet customer demand during the summer season.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500.

loans.use: To buy more frozen treats.

loans.name: Lkagvasuren

texts.en: Lkavgasuren is a 42-year-old single man. He lives alone in a small house which he built in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been operating a taxi business for five years.  During these years he has gained much experience. He is planning to sell his old car and purchase another second hand car, due to safety regulations for transportation. He gives the income he earns to his sister for saving. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a second hand car.

loans.use: To purchase seccond hand car

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que reside junto  a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Punto Cuatro del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de repuestos para bicicleta y motocicleta. El cuenta con un establecimiento en su domicilio en donde atiende al público en general. El negocio goza de buena acogida por parte de sus clientes ya que las motocicletas y bicicletas son unos medios de transporte bastante utilizado en el lugar.

Oscar desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más repuestos para poder atender a más clientes y percibir mayores ingresos de modo que pueda percibir más ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles
texts.en:
Oscar is a 38 year old father living with his wife and children in Punto Cuatro, Mochumí district, a farming area inhabited by humble and hard working people located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He sells replacement parts for bicycles and motorcycles.  He has an establishment in his house where he tends to the general public.  The business is well received by his customers because bicycles and motorcycles are one of the area’s most used modes of transportation.

Oscar would like to expand the business acquiring more replacement parts to tend to more customers and earn higher income for his family.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more replacement parts.

loans.name: Francisca Benita

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

Aquí conversamos con las señora Francisca, ella tiene 61 años de edad, hace unos  años se separo de su marido y fruto de aquella relación tuvo 7 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, en la actualidad en su casa vive un nieto que es como su hijo el cual tiene 15 años y estudia en colegio.

Además de ser una buena ama de casa también se dedica a realizar trabajos y manualidades hechas con fomix, ella realiza sus obras en su casa y luego las lleva a Guayaquil a un bazar que es de su sobrina a la que ella le entrega todos sus trabajos para que allá los comercialice, realiza trabajos como  abecedarios y en la actualidad está haciendo muchos adornos navideños,  nos cuenta que su trabajo es muy solicitado en temporada de clases, tiene pedidos de miles de unidades. Trabaja desde las 9am hasta las 16 h00, de lunes a viernes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar fomix, pegamento, pinturas, crayones y otros materiales para sus trabajos. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gustan las reuniones. Su sueño es ver que su nieto termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Incredible Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its beaches, rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

We chatted with Francisca here.  He is 61 years old and was separated from her husband a few years ago.  She had 7 children with him all of whom are now adults.  Her grandson who is 15 years old and like a son to her lives with her and goes to school.

Besides being a good housewife she also makes crafts out of Foamex.  She makes the crafts at home and then takes them to Guayaquil to a store her niece has.  She gives her all her creations to be sold there.  She makes such items as alphabets and currently is making lots of Christmas decorations.  She tells us that her work is quite sought after during school terms; she has pending orders numbering in the thousands of units.  She works from 9am until 4pm, Monday through Friday.

This loan will be used to buy Foamex, glue, paints, crayons and other materials for her work.  This is her third cycle in the communal bank.  She likes the meetings.  Her dream is to see her grandson complete his education.

loans.use: To buy Foamex, glue, paints and crayons.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng N., 31 years old, is the mother of two school-aged children.  She now lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She currently sells a few grocery items from her home in the village. She sells such items as shampoo, cooking ingredients, fast food, and plastic items. Pheng N. can earn around $3 a day for her family.  Additionally, she also helps her husband grow various crops for extra profit. 

They are raising two children, who are students. Pheng N. would like to request a loan, of which 50% will be used to grow a rice crop and the rest to buy some necessary items to sell. 

Note: Mrs. Pheng N. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop, and to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Victorina es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Pimentel que se encuentra ubicada a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su clientela prefiere su negocio porque ella siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares y mantenerse activa.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Victorina is a 35 year old mother living with her family in a marginal urban zone in Pimentel district located fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a store installed in her house.  She stocks daily use items and groceries.  Her customers prefer her store because she always stocks quality items and because of her kind treatment.  The business helps her husband meet household expenses and helps her to stay active.

She wants to expand the business buying more stock items in order to meet customer demand.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock items for her store.

loans.name: Lubinda

texts.es:
Lubinda  es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su clientela prefiere su negocio porque ella siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares y mantenerse activa.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lubinda is a 40 year old mother living with her family in Tambogrande district, a farming district that is part of Piura region located over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She has a store installed in her house.  She stocks daily use items and groceries.  Her customers prefer her because she always stocks quality products and because of her kind treatment.  The business helps her husband meet family expenses and helps her stay active.

She wants to expand her business acquiring more stock items to meet customer demand and has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock items for her store.

loans.name: Carlos Leonel

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

Carlos tiene 19 años de edad y está soltero, el vive en la casa de sus padres, estudia el tercer semestre en la Universidad Técnica de Manabí extensión Bahía, la especialidad que él sigue es Ing. En Acuacultura.

En la casa de sus padres tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende agua en bidón, trabaja todos los días desde la s8am hasta las 16h00 ya que allí tiene que irse a estudiar, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya  año y que le ha ido mas o menos ya que por lo menos este trabajo le da para sus gastos de la Universidad y al mismo tiempo le da tiempo para estudiar, el agua la recibe en su local de una planta de tratamiento de agua.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más botellas de agua y tener mayor capacidad de venta y otra parte es para pagar sus estudios. Es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta el grupo por que se ven personas serias. Sus sueños y metas son terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Las Increíbles (The Incredible Ones) communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.  

Carlos, 19, is single and lives with his parents.  He is in the third semester at Manabí Technical University majoring in Aquaculture Engineering.

He has a small drinking water sales business in his parents’ house.  He works daily from 8am until 4pm when he has to go to his classes.  He tells us that he’s had the business for a year and has done more or less ok.  At the very least the work produces enough for his university expenses and it leaves him with time to study.  He gets the water from a local water treatment plant.

The loan is to buy more bottles of water to have a larger sale potential and to pay for his schooling.  This is his first cycle in the communal bank and he likes it because you can tell that the group members are serious people.  His dreams and goals are to finish his education.

loans.use: To buy bottles of water and pay for his studies.

loans.name: Cristhian Marlo

texts.es:
Cristhian es un padre de familia de 25 años de edad que reside junto  a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de dos años, el cuenta con animales menores los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel  de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes  que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Con esta actividad el se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Cristhian desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a 25 year old father living with his family in Tambogrande, a farming district that is part of Piura region located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

He has worked raising small farm animals for over two years.  He has small animals that he raises in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where he lives.  This activity allows him to support his family.

Cristhian wants to get more animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand his business.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to help him reach this goal.

loans.use: To acquire more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Esperanza Gardenia

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

La señora Gardenia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe por parte de la Fundación Espoir. Ella tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 7, 6, 4 y 3 años los tres primeros están  en la escuela. Su marido trabaja en el Municipio de Bahía.

En la actualidad administra dos departamentos y además se dedica  al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo ya que dedicarse a una sola línea no le permitiría ganar lo suficiente para sus gastos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana desde las 7h30 hasta las 11 am que llega a hacer el almuerzo para sus hijos y en la tarde desde las 15h00 hasta las 17h00, en las noches se dedica a sus hijos ayudarles en las tareas sobre todo al más pequeño. Compra sus productos en Guayaquil ciudad a la que va una vez al mes.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a traer más mercadería, (pantalones, blusas, camisas, etc.) porque allá salen más baratas. Ella está en el l Banco Comunal  desde sus inicios y le gusta por las facilidades que dan para los créditos. Su sueño es tener un local donde vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The Las Increíbles (The Incredible Ones) communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Gardenia is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because of the benefits she gets from Fundación Espoir.  She is 25 years old and is in a common law relationship.  She has four children who are 7, 6, 4 and 3 years of age.  The three oldest are in school.  Her husband works for the City of Bahía.

She currently manages two apartments and is also a merchant.  She sells all kinds of clothes because sticking with just one line does not produce enough to cover costs.  She sells door to door.  She works four days a week from 7:30am until 11am when she returns home to make lunch for her children.  She returns to work from 3pm until 5pm.  She dedicates evenings to her children helping them with their homework, especially the youngest.  She buys her products in Guayaquil, a city she visits once a month.

The loan is to go to Guayaquil to bring more merchandise (pants, blouses, shirts, etc) because they are less expensive there.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the ease in obtaining loans.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, blouses, undershirts, etc.

loans.name: Kum

texts.en:
Kum P. is a 41-year-old woman, married to Pao Chan, age 45.  They both appear in the picture here.  Her husband helps her in her business, and often chops firewood in and around his community in order to make additional income. 

This old couple lives with two school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland.  Kum P. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest and sell when they mature. Recently, her crop is growing well and she can get a great success from her business. 

Kum P. is pregnant now. The number in her family is small so she cannot harvest her crop on time.  Kum Phean will use her loan to hire a domestic laborer to harvest her potato crop.

loans.use: To hire a domestic laborer to harvest potato crop

loans.name: Santa Dorila

texts.es:
Santa de 49 años,  no está casada y tiene 4 hijos pero solo dos mantiene. Con la dedicación que les ha dado a sus hijos hace ya 27 años atrás ella comenzó a trabajar como comerciante informal vendiendo ropa, perfumes, cremas para poder mantenerlos con una economía estable. 

Viviendo en la Perimetral de Guayaquil una zona periurbana y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y rodeada de un estero ha podido mantener a sus hijos recorriendo estas calles y vendiendo a sus vecinos los productos para obtener un ingreso. En la actualidad vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y en ocasiones ropa trabajando independientemente en las mañanas y tardes. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene cuando trabaja es la columna que ya ha su edad le esta presentando molestias. 

Santa quiere seguir trabajando por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa, perfumes, cremas para asegurar su vejez. Tiene como meta mejorar su vivienda y poder incrementar la mercadería que tiene actualmente en venta.
texts.en:
Santa, 49, isn’t married but has four children.  She only supports two of them still.  Dedicated to her children, she started selling clothes, perfumes and creams 27 years ago to provide them with economic stability.

Living along Guayaquil’s beltway, a periurban area characterized by its unpaved streets and surrounded by a salt marsh, she has managed to support her children traversing the streets selling her products to her neighbors to earn income.   She currently sells perfumes, creams, deodorants and sometimes clothes.  She works independently mornings and afternoons.  One of the inconveniences she has to face while working is problems with her spinal column which at her age is starting to bother a little.

Santa wants to continue working so wants to use the loan to buy clothes, perfumes and creams to insure her old age.  Her goal is to improve her dwelling and increase the amount of merchandise she has on stock to sell.

loans.use: For perfumes, creams, clothes.

loans.name: Magaly Margarita

texts.es:
Magaly de 40 años, es madre soltera con tres hijos ha trabajado desde que se quedo sola con sus hijos. Una de sus amigas le hablo de ser vendedora por catalogo de productos y cosméticos Ebel (compañía que ofrece oportunidades de venta por catalogo). 

Trabaja desde las 08h00am recorriendo las calles de su sector en el suburbio de Guayaquil ya que es una zona urbana ella la recorre ofreciendo los productos a los conocidos de sus vecinos y amigos para tener un ingreso estable y poder mantener a sus hijos. Ofrece perfumes, cosméticos, tratamientos a un valor económicos. Una de sus desventajas para vender los productos son las camitas que hace que le produzca cansancio y concurre a enfermarse rápidamente. 

Ella quiere seguir trabajando y que sus clientes tengan variedad al comprar los productos por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, tratamientos faciales etc. En el  futuro quiere tener una cartera de clientes grande y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Magalay is 40 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children.  She has worked since she was left alone with her children.  One of her friends talked to her about selling Ebel products and cosmetics through catalogs (Ebel is a company that offers opportunities for people to make catalog sales).

Magaly works from 8 o'clock in the morning.  She works in the streets of her district of Guayaquil suburb, which is an urban area.  She offers her products to her neighbors' acquaintances and her friends.  This provides her with a stable income and allows her to support her children.  She offers perfumes, cosmetics and treatments at affordable prices.  One of the disadvantages of selling her products is that she gets tired which contributes to her getting sick quickly.

She would like to continue working and would like her customers to have a wide variety of products to buy.  For this reason, she would like to use her loan to buy perfumes, creams, facial treatments, etc.  In the future, she would like to have a larger customer base and for her children to successfully finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and creams

loans.name: Evangelene

texts.en:
Evangelene J. is from the village of Punta, near Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Evangelene owns & operates a transportation service business. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evangelene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be Evangelene’s second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita A. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Elenita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Elenita plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Elenita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Elenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Elenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin M. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 21 years old. Arvin is single. To make a living, Arvin owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Arvin has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arvin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arvin is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arvin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad T. is from the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old.  Natividad is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Natividad owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC.  

Natividad is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Natividad from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand pig farming business

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
Eulogia P. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub. She is 56 years old. Eulogia is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Eulogia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector running a service-based business. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing sewing services in the local community. Eulogia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eulogia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eulogia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Eulogia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eulogia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Procora

texts.en:
Procora E. is from the Maquilao Tangub City. She is 42 years old. Procora is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Procora owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood in the local community. Procora has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Procora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Procora is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Procora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seafood products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita V. is from Gango Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Teresita is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. 

Teresita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina T. is from Maquilao Tangub City. She is 55 years old. Martina is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Martina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Martina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Martina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Martina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Martina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Martina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy B. N. is a 47-year-old married man and father.  He lives with other family members in his own small family home in Kompong Cham province. He owns a piece of land that he inherited from his grandmother.   Luy B. N. cultivates a rice crop to earn a living, and his wife also helps in the farming business. 

Luy B. N. has six children, four are single and the other two are married.  Three of his children are employed in different occupations, and they always share their profit with him to help with the whole family’s expenses. 

In the previous month, Luy B. N. has been hiring a domestic labor to plow in his farmland, but now he lacks money to pay for the plowing cost. The remaining fund will be use to buy seeds and fertilizers to support one of his children, who is also a farmer, to plant his crop.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee, and buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Esmerna's Group

texts.en:
Esmerna P. is from the town of Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is 40 years old. Esmerna is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pandan.

Esmerna is married. To make a living, Esmerna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood product such as fish in the local community.  Esmerna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Esmerna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmerna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Esmerna is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Esmerna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise

loans.use: To buy a new carpet weaving frame and other needed items

loans.name: By

texts.en: By T. is a 37-year-old professional teacher in the province of Kompong Cham. She was married, but she divorced her husband years ago. She now has two children. They are single and still living under her management. By T. has over 10 years teaching experience. She can make an income of approximately $3 per day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. Currently, By T. is concerned that her motorbike is getting old, and breaks down while driving. By T. will use her loan, combined with her personal savings, to buy a used motorbike to replace her broken one so she can drive to work reliably.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia O. is from the village of Deboloc Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Sylvia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Sylvia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, pancit [noodles], shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Sylvia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Sylvia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Sylvia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Sylvia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

Nelfa T. is from the village of Solinog Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Nelfa is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Nelfa owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, bread, canned goods, noodles, and rice in the local community. loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen A. is a 21-year-old woman who has been working in a garment factory as a seamstress in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has done this work for over two years, and she always receives a salary every month. 

Sen A. has partnered with her father who is a silk seller in another province. They share the responsibility of supporting the family’s daily expenses. Presently, Sen A.’ father thinks that his business is very profitable for him and the family. That is the reason why Sen A. will use her loan to go toward purchasing extra silks for her father’s business.

loans.use: To purchase extra silks to sell

loans.name: Tserenpeljee

texts.en:
Tsrenpeljee is 36 years old, and lives with his wife and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in one-bedroom studio apartment, which they rent in the wintertime. In summertime, he lives in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic tent, with his family on his younger brother’s plot of land.  His daughters are attending local secondary school. 

For 3 years, Tsrenpeljee has operated a taxi service in the city. He enjoys transporting people and is a very hardworking person. His wife, Oyunchimeg, is a kitchen assistant at a local café. Tsrenpeljee is providing a good education and other necessary expenses for his children. In the future, he is planning to purchase an apartment. He is requesting this loan to purchase some spare parts for his car and also to pay for apartment rent fee.

loans.use: To purchase some spare parts for his car and also to pay for apartment rent fee

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy G. is from the town of Maular, Aloran. He is 33 years old and married, with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Joy sells a variety of food products at his store. Joy has been engaged in his business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Joy is requesting a new loan, his third from GDMPC, for 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yeiza

texts.en:
Yeiza D. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Yeiza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Yeiza owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing halloblock-making and cement services in the local community. Yeiza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Yeiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yeiza has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Yeiza is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP that will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Yeiza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo S. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old. Edgardo is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Edgardo owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing welding services to local community members. Edgardo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Edgardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9400 PHP from GDMPC. Edgardo is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Edgardo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
