loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: So

texts.en: So O. is a 55 year old widowed villager who lives in Phnom Penh. Her husband died of senility years ago and she have no children. So O. currently works as public officer in the Ministry of Public Works. Besides this work, she opened laundry business in her house with several staff to provide her services. So O. typically makes around $6 of profit each day to use for daily expenses. So O. is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. She now faces a problem. Her house requires repairs. Because she does not have sufficient savings, So O. would like a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, where she has been farming for fifteen years. She has employed two farmhands to assist in her farm. Her farm produces tea and coffee which she sells to the local factories and maize which she sells locally. She also earns income from her business of selling both second hand clothes and new clothes at the local market.

She recently completed paying her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to expand her cereal business. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family. Her biggest challenge has been insufficient funds to expand her farm and be able to access wider markets.

Ruth is 34 years old. She is married with 4 school-aged children who all attend school. She comments that Juhudi has helped her grow economically.

loans.use: To expand her cereas business.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred A. is from Capatan, Tuguegarao City. He is 34 years old. Fred is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Fred owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing tricycle transport services to local community members. Fred has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fred joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fred has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Fred is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair the vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Fred from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle used in his transport business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She enlarger her business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years and has employed three farmhands. Her farm, which is located in Kisii town in western Kenya, produces tea, coffee, maize and bananas which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her cereals business in the same location. She is forty years old and married with six children who are between the ages of 12 and 18. All the children attend school except one. 

She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She hopes that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for home consumption and for sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will go towards the education of her children. In the future, she would like to open a cereals store in her location. Her biggest challenges have been insufficient funds to expand her businesses and market competition.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood and necessary ingredients and materials

loans.name: Floriano

texts.en:
Floriano V. is from the village of Victoria. He is 43 years old. Floriano is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests corn to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-nine years and earns approximately $117 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Floriano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mt Usambara Group

texts.en:
Daudi M. is in his late forties and is married with 6 children.  For the past year, Daudi has been running a general store.  The store is open from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and earns Daudi a low monthly profit. 

This will be Daudi's first Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  Daudi aims to use this loan to increase his stock of goods and begin to sell mobile phone credit vouchers.  Daudi's dream is to be able to afford to put his children through college. He also hopes to be able to build himself a new house. 

Daudi will share this loan with his loan group Mt Usambara, which totals 8 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Daudi can be seen as the only one wearing blue.

loans.use: Increase his stock of goods and begin to sell mobile phone credit vouchers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth and thread

loans.name: Turgunai's Group

texts.en:
Turgunai N. is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married. Her husband works in construction. Together they are raising two sons and a daughter. The sons are at school and the daughter is not yet. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 20000 soms, Turgunai decided to build a sauna. Now they provide sauna services; in this way the family makes 8200 soms per month.  Turgunai applied for the loan because she needs money to make some repairs to the sauna. In the future she wants to improve her living conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: Sauna repairs

loans.name: Zuurakul's Group

texts.en:
Zuurakul B. is 42 years old, and she is married to an excavator operator. The couple is bringing up four children: three daughters and a son. All of them are students except the youngest daughter who is only two years old.

For seventeen years the family has made their living through cattle breeding. Animal fattening and resale makes it possible to make a profit. As a result, the family has managed to celebrate a daughter's wedding and to prepare a dowry of 16,000 KGS.  

Zuurakul intends to increase the family budget by increasing their cattle stock. For this reason she wants to purchase livestock animals with the sum of 20,000 KGS and to spend the rest of the money on buying coal for the winter. For her plans to come true, she needs a loan. In the future, her aim is to give a proper education to her children, and then to obtain a car.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Nha In, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1975 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Mr. Nha In is a fisherman and a construction worker.

Sophal is a farmer and she also sells the fish that her husband catches to others living in their village. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle to carry the fish she sells.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to carry the fish she sells

loans.name: Jyldyzkan's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyzkan A. is the leader of this group. She is 49 years old and divorced. She has raised a son who is now 24 years old. He went to work in Russia to make money. 

In order to cover personal expenditures, Jyldyzkan sells fruits and vegetables in the local market. She has been doing this for sixteen years. In this way she earns about $113 per month.  She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase more fruits and vegetables in order to increase the turnover of her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S. is a hard-working woman who earns a living by working in a garment factory. She has been working in that sector since 2006, and earns a regular salary every day. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a driver in a construction company as well as a motor taxi driver for extra profit in and around Phnom Penh City. He earns an average income of $3 per day. This couple is blessed with two children, both of whom are single and living with them. 

Bun S. said that the core resource of her family revenue comes from her husband’s business. Unluckily, her husband’s motorbike was broken while providing his service, and he has paid a great deal of money many times for repairing it. In order to solve this problem, Bun S. is seeking a loan for her husband to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn M. (pictured with her loom) is 56 years old, and her husband, Mr. Khorn Thav, is 57. They have been married since 1979 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Thorn has been weaving for almost 20 years. Her husband is a television and radio repairman. She is requesting her first loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent has been in the farming business for the last four years and employs two farmhands. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces tea, which he sells to a local tea factory, and maize, which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to provide the needs of his family. Innocent is 52 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This dairy cow will enable his family to get enough milk for home consumption and for sale. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. 

In the future, he hopes to buy a matatu (minibus) and venture into the transportation business. He faces the challenge of drought and diseases which affect his farm production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Bella is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Bella owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Bella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Bella is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Bella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Erdenebileg G. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband is retired and receives a pension. Her son is a university student and her daughter attends a local primary school. 

Erdenebileg operates a meat trading business in her town. She began her business in 2000 and has gained much experience as a businesswoman. She purchases livestock and a large amount of  meat at wholesale prices and sells it as a retailer at the local market. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her son's tuition fees. Erdenebileg is a hardworking and modest person. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital in order to buy more meat to sell.

loans.use: To buy more meat for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying clothes for sale

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira  J. is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married. Gulmira is a resident of Tashkomur, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband works in construction. Together they are bringing up three sons.  All three sons study at school. In order to earn money Gulmira breeds livestock animals and then sells them after fattening, at a higher price. She started this activity ten years ago with the initial investment of 1600 soms. Now in this way she earns 6000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Gulmira wants to purchase five goats in order to increase the number of livestock she owns. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock animals

loans.name: Sokry

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokry U. (pictured with her husband) is 54 years old and her husband, Mr. Oeun Sim is 53 years old. They have been married since 1979 and have four children--one son and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, another one is a garment factory worker, and two attend school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sokry is a farmer; she grows green beans on her farmland in the village. Her husband has been selling cows and oxen for almost 30 years; he buys them from other villages and nearby districts and sells to a middleman who comes to buy them at his home. 

Sokry is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide her husband with capital to purchase more cows and oxen for resale.

loans.use: To provide her husband with capital to purchase more cows and oxen for resale

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en:
Otgonsuren L. is 46 years old and a single mother and lives with her three sons in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her oldest son is a university student, and her twin sons attend a local high school. Otgonsuren supports her family by operating a grocery trading business in her town. She sells a variety of food products and fruits. She started her business in 1994, selling only flour. 

After years of successful operation, she was able to expand her product line by selling a variety of foodstuffs and fruits since 2004 and has built up a stable operation. Her earnings have enabled her not only to pay her son's tuition fees but also to provide her family. 

Otgonsuren is a modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more varieties of grocery products in order to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of grocery products

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a twenty-eight-year-old married man blessed with two children, living in his mud wattle house in Fort Portal, Uganda, but having an aspiration of owning his own residence. He has owned a retail shop and tea plantation for six years now and these businesses have helped him to pay school fees for his children, however he longs to plant tea extensively. Robert intends to use the loan facility to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: Buying seedlings for planting

loans.name: Chanthen

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthen N. (pictured here) is 27 years old and her husband, Mr. Sophea Some is also 27 years old. They have been married since 2003 and have two children--one son and one daughter. Their daughter attends school and their son is still very young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanthen has been weaving for 12 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She is requesting her first loan of US$ 300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en:
Tumurbaatar L. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest child, a daughter, is a university student and his two younger children both attend a local secondary school. His wife works as a conductor of a mini-bus and Tumurbaatar operates a taxi service.

 He began his taxi business in 2004 and has gained a lot of experience since then. In addition, he worked as a driver of a mini-bus between 2008 and 2009 to supplement his earnings. After years of running this business, his earnings have enabled him to not only provide for his family but also pay his daughter's tuition fees. 

Tumurbaatar is a modest, open-minded and hard-working man and is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to improve his car that is used as a taxi.

loans.use: To improve his car

loans.name: Chinara's Group

texts.en:
Chinara B. is the leader of this group. She is 36 and married. Chinara is a resident of Tashkomur, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, her husband went to work in Russia. They have a son and a daughter; both of them are at school. Chinara herself is engaged in cattle breeding.  She resells her cattle after fattening, and in this way she makes 7000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a calf for breeding.  In the future Chinara wants to start building a house.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia R., 42 years old, is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has three children aged 14, 7 and 6. Alicia's business, a sari-sari (general) store, sells various products including sardines, sugar and cigarettes. She has been running the store for more than two years now and earns approximately PHP 3000 every month. Alicia works hard to earn more and be better able to sustain her family's needs, especially her children's education.

Alicia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Mr. Sophon L., 49 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kong Soeung, 45 years old, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have seven children - three sons and four daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers; one is a construction worker, and the others attend school.

Sophon is a construction worker, while his wife is a weaver. The couple also grows rice. Sophon is now requesting his first loan of $1,000 to use for farming and to buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: To use for farming and to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 39 year old married man with three children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, and one of his aspirations is to have an educated family. Godfrey has been working in the taxi transportation business for five years and his work has enabled him to pay for his children’s education. Godfrey will use his loan to help service his car to increase his business efficiency. In the future, his goal is to have three taxis on the road.

loans.use: to service vehicle

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men M. (shown here) and her husband, Mr. Ros Touk, have been married since 1984 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Four of Men’s children are married and live outside the family home and the other one attends school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Men M. sells fish and eggs and her husband raises ducks at home. In addition, the couple also grows rice. Men has received two previous Kiva loans. She is now asking for a third loan of 800 USD to purchase an irrigation machine for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase an irrigation system

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Thirty-nine year old Hellen O. is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last fifteen years and employs two farmhands. Her farm produces tea, which she sells through a local tea factory, maize and tomatoes which she sells locally. She mainly depends on her farming income to provide for the basic needs of her family. 

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family. In future, she would like to buy a motorcycle to transport her produce to the market. Her biggest challenge is insufficient capital to expand her farming activities. 

She is grateful to Juhudi for their financial support in alleviating poverty.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosemary Wanjiru

texts.en:
Rosemary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years. She is 35 years and a widow, and the mother of three children, ages 18, 16 and 13 years, respectively.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan of Kshs. 30,000 in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers, seedlings for planting, buy a cow and pay for farm labor.

In the future, she hopes to be self sustainable, by practicing large-scale farming

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer, and a cow, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Molhi

texts.en:
Molhi H. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence. His youngest two daughters both attend a local high school and his middle son works in a local company called Suat.

Molhi has been working as a driver for the Suat company for past 30 years and has gained a lot of experience. Based on his many years of experience, he taught his two sons how to operate a transportation business. Since 2006, his oldest son has been operating a coal delivery and other transportation service using his own Russian truck between local sub-provinces and the countryside. His younger son drives taxi in his town. Over the years, both his sons' businesses have established into stable operations.

Molhi is a very modest and clever man and says, "I have been teaching a life skill to all my children." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary spare parts for both vehicles in his sons' transportation businesses.

loans.use: To purchase necessary spare parts

loans.name: Synem

texts.en:
Mrs. Synem H. (pictured with her loom) is 36 years old and her husband, Mr. Bora Yun, is 41 years old.  They live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married since 2000 and have three sons.  Two attend school and another one is still young.  

Synem has been weaving since 1990.  She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh.  Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase materials for her weaving business and buy rice for food.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her weaving business and buy rice for food.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista N. lives in the Katanga neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 9 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother).

Teopista has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Teopista sells her products from home on a wholesale basis. Teopista has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenges for Teopista include the rainy season and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages in Luwero for charcoal. Teopista lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Bev

texts.en:
Mr. Bev M. (in the photo), 58, is a widower with two sons. Both are garment factory workers.  

Bev is a motor taxi driver. His sons do not have transportation to get to work, so they very often spend a lot of money for traveling costs. Bev is asking for his first loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for his sons.  

The family lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his sons to get to work.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a thirty-eight-year-old woman, married with six children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, longing to have a permanent house for a residence as they are currently in a semi-permanent one. She deals in a number of businesses such as retail shop, poultry and taxi businesses which have enabled her to educate her children and live a modest life, however her ambition is to own a another taxi. Irene needs the loan to buy a taxi.

loans.use: Purchasing a taxi for business

loans.name: Koemsroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Koemsroeun P. (pictured with her young daughter) is 28 years old and her husband, Mr. Tharith Chea is 33 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 20 kilometers away. They have been married since 2000 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. The eldest attends school and other two are still too young. 

Koemsroeun sells rice and food in the village. Her husband has been a security guard for 2 years. She is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sailauhan

texts.en:
Sailauhan H. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His three children attend a local secondary school and his wife works in the local cafe. 

Sailauhan operates a raw materiasl trading business in his town. He started his business in 2009 by purchasing and selling animal skins in his local area. He purchases raw materials such as sheepskin, goat skin and cow and horse hides from local people at wholesale prices and sells those skins and leathers to big suppliers adding 500-1000 MNT on each item price. His daily sales income is between 40,000 and 60,000 MNT with 10-15% of net profits. He continues to make progress with his business and uses his earnings to improve his family's quality of life. 

Sailauhan is a clever, modest and talented man. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more animal skins and hides due to upcoming preparation of meat for winter.

loans.use: To purchase more animal skins

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase sewing materials such as different kinds and colors of thread, big-size needles and so on

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap H. (in the photo) is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sovan Some is 31 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2002 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and another one is still too young. 

Mr. Sopheap H. has a full-time job in Phnom Penh. His wife sells silk and cotton products (fabrics and scarves). She buys them from the weavers in the village and transports to sell in other provinces. 

Sopheap is asking for a loan of $1,200 to provide his wife with capital to purchase more silk and cotton products for resale.

loans.use: To provide his wife with capital to purchase more silk and cotton products for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah B. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  Sarah has a business selling smoked fish. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Sarah sells her products at the market, wholesale. Sarah has requested a loan of 700,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of  smoked fish.  She also generates additional income through roasting meat. 

The main business challenges for Sarah include defaulters and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to fish in islands of Lake Victoria and also build her own house. Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy all the essential construction supplies to repair his war-damaged house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha T. (in the photo with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Vit Ses, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1983 and have six children--three sons and three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, two are garment factory workers, and the other two attend school. 

Mrs. Sokha T. has been selling porridge and Cambodian cake for more than seven years. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. In addition, Sokha also started new business selling fruit (mangoes). She buys them from her fellow villagers under contract before the harvesting season comes and sells them to a middleman who comes to buy them at her home. 

She hopes to expand her business, so she is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase more mangoes for resale and she will use a part of the loan to repair motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more mangoes for resale and to repair her husband's motorbike

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna C. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Mirna married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Mirna owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mirna has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mirna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirna is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mirna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new carpet frame and to expand his business as well.

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Meth A. is a 45-year-old woman who has a low-income.  She currently lives in Phnom Penh in Cambodia.  Meth A. and her husband sell ice which they break into small pieces, making a product similar to ice cream.  After that they add boiled sugar water.  Ice with sugar water is the kind of product that this couple sells every day, and they make a profit which they use for their family’s expenses. 

This couple runs their business by using their old motorbike, but now it is getting old and it is usually broken down.  They want to buy another one to replace the old one, but their funds are insufficient.  To solve this problem, Meth A. will use her loan to purchase a used motorcycle and with the rest of the funds buy a trailer to connect up with an existing motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle and with the rest of the funds buy a trailer to connect up with an existing motorbike.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mr. Sao H. (who is in the photo with his wife) is 34 years old and his wife, Mrs. Khum Phary is 24 years old, live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 2006 and they a young daughter.  

Sao has been driving a motordub (motor taxi) for four years.  His wife is hired by villagers to farm.  She gets paid with fees. 
Sao’s motorbike is old and breaks down often, which costs him a lot of money to make repairs.  He could not manage his income to support his family.  Hence he has decided to ask for his first loan of $500 to purchase a new one.

loans.use: To replace his motorbike with a new one.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita O. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 42 years old. Angelita is married and has 7 children. Her eldest child is 24 years old while the youngest is only aged 1. Angelita is a fish vendor. She directly buys assorted fish from the fishermen where she can get it at a lower price. She then goes around their neighborhood to sell the fish. Angelita said she needs the loan to buy fish supplies, styrofoam and a scale.

Angelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell and other materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of fish and other materials

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a forty two year old man living in a mud wattle house with five children in Fort Portal Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after seven of his house hold members and his family dream is to have an income generating activity that provides an assured daily income. He is a farmer and deals mainly in cassava. He has been in business for five years and earns tangible profits. Francis needs the loan to buy more cassava  to sell

loans.use: Buying cassava for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business and increase his monthly income

loans.name: Winda

texts.en:
Winda G. lives in the town of Trinidad. She is 34 years old, married and has seven children. Her oldest child is 13 and her youngest is only 4 months.

Winda makes a living by fishing. She helps her husband, who is also a fisherman, operate their boat and sells their catch in a local market. She also sometimes dries fish for sale later. She dreams of helping her family live a better life, and joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 35 years old, married and has four children, all of whom live with him in his house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He dreams of building a new, larger home and currently makes a living as a a supervisor at a private tea estate. He has worked there for four years, but hopes to go into business on his own as a commercial farmer. He has applied for this loan to help care for his cassava garden, which is an important food source for his family.

loans.use: To help care for his cassava garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a cow and expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر 40 سنة يعمل في بيع الخضار والاعشاب محمد متزوج وله اربع اولاد يحب اولاده ويتمنى لهم العيش الكريم يحب الحياة 
كثيرا ويحب عمله وله  فيه اكثر من 20 سنة يحب ان يرقى بعمله الى مستوى متقدم لكي يدعم نفسه وعائلته له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان يتلقى دعم كامل
من عائلته وقد ساعده القرض القديم بتحسين مستوى عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة للزيتون بسبب  الموسم وشراء الزيت
يحب التجارة ويحب ان يكون متنوع بها طموح يسعى جادها الى تحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي والتربوي لأولاده
texts.en: Mhamad, 40, is married with 4 children. He works in selling vegetables and herbs. Mhamad loves his children and wishes to secure them a decent life. Mhamad loves his life very much. With 20 years experience, Mhamad has developed a passion for his work. He wishes to develop his business to support himself and his family. Mhamad has a good credit history with A. Majmoua as he receives full support from his family. The previous loan he got from A. Majmoua helped him improve his work. He wants to get a new loan to buy a machine for extracting olive oil during the harvest season and to buy oil. He likes his trade and he wants to diversify his business. Mhamad is ambitious and he is keen to improve his financiA. conditions as well as his children's sociA. and pedagogicA. life.

loans.use: To buy an olive oil and an oil extraction machine

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia B. lives in the town of Trinidad. She is 54 years old, married and has five children, the oldest of which is 28. She makes a living by making and selling food, including "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies. 

Anastacia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 7,000 PHP, to buy the ingredients she needs to make her food items. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make baked good to sell

loans.name: Sinore Enole

texts.en:
Sinore Enole S. is 50 years old. She is married to Pariken S. and the mother of four children between the ages of 5 and 15.

Sinore is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land, which she has been doing for the last 12 years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members in KADET. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to spend to prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten-acre wheat farm for the next planting season. Wheat has proved to be doing well in this area and the market is readily available in the area to both retail and wholesale buyers.

She hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Sinore's dream is to do large scale farming and to own farm machinery.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten-acre plot

loans.name: Mak's Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people are requestiing a village loan; they are located in Preaek Char village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mak K. is 45 years old and was selected as the village bank president by the group's members. While each member of this village will use his/her portion of the loan to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Mak K. and her husband, Mr. Pum Pe, are farmers who own 1.50-hectare rice field.  They do not have enough money to cultivate it so she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to grow rice. The couple has six children, one of whom is seamstress in a garment factory, two of whom are construction workers, and four of whom are students who also help their parents with the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline to grow rice

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar B. is from the town of Trinidad. He is married and has five children. Apolinar is a food vendor and he makes and sells banana que and comote que (deep fried bananas and sweet potatos with caramelized sugar), rice cakes and other delicacies. Apolinar has been selling food for almost four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP each month.

Apolinar joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Apolinar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase bananas, sugar, and other raw ingredients needed to make his food products.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients including bananas and sugar

loans.name: Zina

texts.ar:
زينه في عمر 43 سنة  تعمل في مجال بيع الألعاب والهدايا للأطفال زينه طموحة تحب عملها وتسعى الى تطوير مصلحتها
زينه متطورة ونشيطة بالعمل تعمل اكثر من 4 سنوات تلقى دعم كبير من العائلة تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة العاب 
جديدة وتسديد للتجار لكي تزيد من البضائع بسبب موسم الأعياد زينه تعتمد على مصلحتها لكي تساعد عائلتها فهي تعيل والدتها واهلها تتلقى دائما
الدعم منهم ويحبونها كثيرا
texts.en: Zina, 43, works in selling children's toys and gifts. She is ambitious, likes her work and seeks to develop her business. Zina has been working in this field for 4 years. She is active and wants to stay up to date in her work. She enjoys great support from her family. Zina wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new stock for the feast season and to pay for the goods she gets from wholesalers. Zina works to support her mother and family. Her family loves her very much and always supports her.

loans.use: To buy toys to stock for the feast season

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en:
Conrada A. is 62 years old and married with six children. She is from the town of Trinidad. To make a living, Conrada owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Conrada joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Conrada is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Sot Moa's Group

texts.en:
This village loan group consists of seventeen members who are located in Preaek Char village in Kandal province. The group selected Mrs. Sot Mao as the village bank president. Each member of this loan group will use his or her portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sot Mao, who is 50, and her husband, Mr. TR. Vor, are farmers who own a hectare of land that they use to grow rice. They have two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factoR. and the other is a waiter. The couple does not have enough money to cultivate their plot of land and they will use their loan to buy fertilizer and to purchase gasoline.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and purchase gasoline

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna O. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Erna raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Erna also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products.

Erna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Erna is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Thirteen members are requesting a village loan; they are located in Preaek Char village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sok N. is 54 years old and she was selected as the village bank president by the group. Each member of this village will use his/her portion of the loan to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Sok N. is a farmer who owns one hectare of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She does not have enough money to grow rice so she is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds for cultivating rice.  

Mrs. Sok N. is a widow and farmer who works very hard to support her three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory and two of whom are students who also help with the farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seeds for cultivating rice

loans.name: Elham

texts.ar:
الهام في عمر 38 سنة متزوجة ولها ولدان زينة تحب عائلتها كثيرا وهي كل اهتمامها تعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية 
بالاضافة الى حبها للخياطة الهام تعمل من اكثر من  12 سنة تريد تطوير نفسها وعملها وعائلتها من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة تريد شراء 
بضاعة جديدة للمحل شوكولا وغيره بمناسبة العيد لها مهارة عالية في عملها فهي متطورة وطموحا عملها مميز بالدقة والنشاط تحب ان تساعد عائلتها 
على تحسين وضعهم المادي فهي من يهتم بعائلتها واولادها
texts.en: Elham is a 38-year-old wife and mother of two who loves her family very much and wants to help them advance. For the past twelve years, she has been working at a convenience store and as a sewing professional to help provide for her family. Elham is very skilled in her work, which she applies great meticulousness and energy to. Elham now would like to seek a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase chocolate products and other foodstuffs to stock up for the holiday celebrations.

loans.use: Purchase foodstuffs for convenient store.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda S. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda prepares and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks like bread, chips, fish balls, and other dim sums to the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Imelda's first loan from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Keldihan's Group

texts.en:
Keldihan A. is a resident of Tashkomur and the leader of this group.  Keldihan is 53, married, and has one child who attends school.  Her husband works in construction.  In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Keldihan breeds livestock animals. She resells livestock after fattening at a higher price. She has been doing it for 25 years and earns 5,000 soms a month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock animals for breeding.  In the future, she hopes to improve the family's living conditions and purchase a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135   If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan. They live in Preaek Hour Kaeut village in Kandal province. This group loan selected Mrs. Van C., a 48-year- old married woman, as the group leader. The members of this group hope that they will increase their income to improve their families with this loan. 

Mrs. Van C. and her husband, Mr. Suong Sroeun, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate different vegetables for a living. They don’t have money to grow the farm. Thus, Mrs. Van C. would like to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating vegetables. 

This spouse is working hard on the farm to support their four children. Two of the children are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a construction worker and another is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating vegetables.

loans.name: Eoun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan includes five members. They are located in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. Mrs. Eoun C., a 30-year-old married woman, is the group leader, having been selected by its members.  The members of this village group loan will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Eoun C. is a grocery seller in the local village. Since the grocery business is still bringing in only a meager income to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Eoun C. would like to expand her store. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her current business. Her husband, Mr. Sour Noeun, 35 years old, works as construction worker where he can receive only a little income to support his family. This couple has a child who is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to enlarge her current business

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has been in the farming business for two years and employs two casual laborers. She has a mixed farm in Kitale town in western Kenya that produces eggs which she sells locally. She also runs a kiosk where she sells vegetables and tomatoes. She is 24 years old and married with 2 children aged 1 and 7. Her elder child is currently attending school. 

She has requested this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farm.  The proceeds from her poultry business will help in the education of her children and for food sustainability in the family. She says that her major target is to venture into broiler farming and finally to a poultry meat-processing farm in future. Her primary challenge is the poor road network within her locality.

She appreciates what Juhudi is doing to help the small-scale farmers in the rural setting.

loans.use: To expand her poultry farm

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 24 years old. Jacquiline is married and has 3 children aged 8, 6 and 4. To make a living, Jacquiline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jacquiline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Jacquiline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacquiline has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jacquiline is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret M. is a fifty-one year old-woman, married to Benson Lugadiro, who is employed as a civil servant in the Kenyan government.  Margaret sells her fruits wholesale in Eldoret Municiple market; she has been in this business for five years and gets a monthly income of 8,000 shillings.

This will be Margaret's first loan with KADET, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more fruits, such as pawpaws, so that she can increase her stock.  With the expected income from the loan she plans to buy a shop in the market and also stabilize her finances.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business, raise her stardard of living and have a stable and happy life.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for resale.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 40 years old. Lyra is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 9. To make a living, Lyra owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lyra also helps her husband till their rice farm. She said that her farm needs additional rice seeds.

Lyra joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyra has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lyra is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice seeds and additional products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and additional products to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two relatives). 

Margaret has a business selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret   sells her clothing at the market, retail.     Margaret has requested a loan of 600000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through clothes cleaning.

The main business challenges for Margaret include transportation and ever increasing prices of second-hand clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second-hand clothes and also start selling wholesale only.   Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry K. is 37 years old and married to Salinah Kibii, a public health officer. Together they have been blessed with six children between the ages of five and 14. Henry's spouse helps supports the family.

Henry has run a quarry business in Koitebes village in Koibatek district for the last fifteen years. Henry earns an average monthly income of KES 15,000 from this business. This income enabled him to fully support his family before his wife found employment.

Henry has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET. He intends to use KES 5,000 to purchase tools for extracting stone - the stone will be crushed as ballast and used to construct roads. KES 15,000 will be used to hire labour. 

Henry anticipates using the profits to hire a truck to transport the ballast to Eldoret town for sale - this will reduce the cost of transport. He also hopes to open a yard where he will sell the ballast.

loans.use: To purchase tools and labour for quarrying

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana T. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 56 years old. Marciana is married. To make a living, Marciana owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marciana also provides general alteration & tailoring services to her neighborhood. 

Marciana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marciana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase cloth and additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and additional products to sell

loans.name: Pion

texts.en:
Pion Y. is 36 years old and married to Ester Y.. Together they are the parents of four children. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last five years.
  
Pion learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan, and he is planning to prepare land for the next planting season by buying chemicals and fertilizer. Wheat has proved to grow well in his area due to good climate conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

Pion hopes he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land in order to plant wheat on a larger scale. In the future, he also hopes to buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer to prepare the land for the next planting season

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene T. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 39 years old. Arlene is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business gathering and selling seaweed at the market. 

Arlene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including nets

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon A. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Corazon's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zuena Munga

texts.en:
Zuena Munga N. is 30 years old and married to Mohammed Mwanza, an employee at Athi River Cement. Together they are blessed with three children. Zuena is a soap and kerosene supplier from the city of Mwele.

This will be her first loan with KADET, and Zuena plans to purchase kerosene and soap. She will direct the anticipated profits into adding more stock. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene and soap

loans.name: Ek Bo Group

texts.en:
Nineteen members are forming a group loA.. They are located in Veal Kandal village, Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Ek B., 54 years old, as the group bank president. Each member of this group will use his/her portion of the loA. for a different purpose. 
 
Mrs. Ek B. and her husband, Mr. Hang Sophy, are farming laborers, where they earn a little income to support their family. They have four children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory and one of whom is a student.  They work hard, but they still earn less income thA. is needed to support the family. Thus, she is requesting a loA. to buy rice for food intake.

loans.use: To buy rice for food intake

loans.name: Cresina

texts.en:
From the town of Trinidad, 60-year-old Cresina M. is married and has children. The owner and manager of a sari-sari (general) store for almost 15 years already, Cresina sells various products including shampoo, bread and soft drinks, and hopes to acquire new items, including rice, to expand her product offering.

Cresina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah O. is 35 years old and from the Kondele area of Kisumu. He is married to Juliet, and together they have three children: Daniel (12), Venesa (7), and Sydney (2).

Isaiah has been selling second-hand clothes for ten years. He is applying for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. after being introduced by a friend who had benefited from a Kadet loan. Isaiah intends to use the money to buy more bales of clothes to add to his stock. The profits made from his business will be used to support his family and pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to see his business grow and educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes to add to his stock.

loans.name: John Naut

texts.en:
John Naut E. is a twenty-eight year old man, married to Elizabeth Naut. Together they have two lovely children who are still very young. John has run a motorcycle business in Eldoret Town for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. He also owns a shop where he sells groceries such as green vegetables.

This will be John's first loan with KADET. He plans to use it to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and groceries for resale. In the future, John plans to expand his grocery business, so that he can have enough income to feed and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for a motorcycle and groceries for resale

loans.name: Fatiya

texts.en: Fatiya N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of her mother and father.  Fatiya operates a food stall.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days a week. Fatiya sells her products from home.  She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cassava, bananas, and sweet potatoes.  The main business challenges for Fatiya include transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers directly.  Fatiya lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cassava, bananas, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Matano Kombo

texts.en:
Matano Kombo M.. Is a 40 year old man.  He is married to Halima and they are blessed with two children.  Matano has been a retail shop owner as a primary business and a poultry farmer at the same time, which he has done for the last one year.

This marks his second loan from KADET.  He plans to invest the loan in purchasing chicks for upkeep and sale.  The anticipated profits will be directed into adding stock into his retail shop. His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: purchasing chicks for upkeep and sale in poultry farm

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki M. is a 28 year-old married woman. She has operated a food kiosk for the past year at Kijiwetanga in Malindi town.

Riziki was introduced to KADET LIMITED by another client of the company, and this will be her second loan. The loan amounts is KES 15,000, and she is planning to use it to add stock to her kiosk as well as repair the business structure. 

Riziki wishes to use the anticipated profit from the loan to continue expanding the business. She also hopes to buy a plot of land so that she can later own a well-established hotel. Her dream is to ensure that her family is healthy and her children are well-educated.

loans.use: to help sustain and grow a food kiosk

loans.name: C4609 Twikebuke Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine, 33 and married, is the leader of a five-member group called Twikebuke. Alphonsine owns a small shop which sells a variety of products including basic foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, flour, etc. She has five years of experience and her shop is open from 6 a.m to 6 p.m. everyday.

. Alphonsine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell, including sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
From Kitale town in western Kenya, 36-year-old Joseph C. has been farming for seven years. A married father of four school-aged children who all attend school, he produces on his mixed farm milk, maize and beans, all of which are sold locally. He is also a casual worker at Kenya Seed Company in Kitale town.

Joseph is requesting this loan of 65,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle. He says that the income obtained from this added source of income will make life more comfortable because he will be able to afford the basic needs of his family and some small luxury. He hopes to purchase another motorcycle in the future to enable him to take a contract for transporting the milk of those farmers in the interior region of Kitale.

Joseph says that his biggest challenge arises during the rainy season when the roads are sometimes very poor, causing him to lose business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of 18 members living in Veal Kandal village, Kandal province. This village selected Mrs. Horn R., a 38-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. With the loans, they hope to increase their incomes to improve the living conditions of their families. 

Mrs. Horn R. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she also earns her living through selling Khmer cakes. Her husband, Mr. Nay Sophal, 43 years old, works as plumber and can earn a little income to support his family.

For the family living situation, Mrs. Horn R. would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a kitchen for cooking.   

This couple has a child who is a student and also helps the mother with Khmer cake selling.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a kitchen for cooking

loans.name: Jane Njeri

texts.en:
Jane Njeri W. is a 28 years old single lady, she supports a family of four brothers and sisters. She runs a clothes selling business in Eldama Ravine town that she started six years ago and she gets an average income of Kshs 30,000 per month.

Jane has borrowed a loan of Kshs in the past. This 60,000 requests being her second loan with Kadet Ltd. She intends to use Kshs 35,000 to purchase new clothes and Kshs 25,000 for Second hand cloths.
 
She anticipates in using the profits from the business to build her plot and buy a farm. She dreams to have a family and be able to provide for her children and also give them the best education possible.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase stock

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy K. is a 28 year-old married woman with three children. She operates a green grocery which has been in existence for the past two years now. The business is situated at the airport in Malindi town. 

Nancy was introduced to KADET LIMITED by another client of the company, and this will be her third loan from the company. The loan is KES 40,000, and she plans to use it to add stock to her grocery as well as repair the business structure. 

Nancy wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue expanding the business and purchase more stock. Her dream is to see her family healthy and make sure her children are well-educated.

loans.use: to sustain and grow the client's grocery business

loans.name: Liola Ole

texts.en:
Liola ole N. is 29 years old. He is married to Sintei Ene Tanyai and the father of four children. 

Liola has a transportation business, in which he drives his motorbike within town to transport goods (for other businessmen) and people. He has had his business for five years.

Liola learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet-registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his motorbike. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of his job, he plans to purchase a new motorbike and employ a helping hand.

He is a hardworking man who is focused on meeting his goals.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Olparari Ole

texts.en:
Olparari Ole M. is 38 years old. He is married to Kiteleki Mukenye and the father of two school-aged children. 

Olparari is a businessman who has bought and sold young bulls for the past six years.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he plans to use to purchase young bulls for fattening and resale. With the profit he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent land for farming.
 
His dream is to become a commercial businessman and succeed in agriculture.

Despite his age, Olparari believes he is hard-working and will achieve his goals.

loans.use: To purchase young bulls for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Ma. Elizabeth

texts.en: Ma. Elizabeth C. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Ma. Elizabeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Elizabeth owns & operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Ma. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ma. Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Habib

texts.ar:
حبيب في عمر 56 سنة يعمل في النجارة فهو له في مصلحته حوالي 40 سنة متزوج وله ولد
يحب عائلته ويريد تأمين حياة كريمة لهم فهو دائم البحث عن التطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى
دفع الاقساط المدرسية لأبنه فهو المعيل الوحيد للعائلة يسعى جاهدا الى دعم ابنه وعائلته تاريخه مع المجموعة جيد
ويلقى دعم كامل من عائلته وزبائنه هم جيرانه ومحبيه
texts.en: Habib is a 56-year-old husband and father who tries hard to secure a dignified life for his family and who in turn is greatly supported by them. Habib has four decades of experience working in carpentry, with his neighbors and loved ones providing patronage. Given his good credit history with Al Majmoua, Habib is now asking for a loan to help pay his son’s school tuition, which is particularly crucial since Habib is the only breadwinner in the family.

loans.use: To pay his son's school tuition
