loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a power saw

loans.name: James Njogu

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years. He is 54 years old, and married to Nancy Wambui with four children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our credit officers. This will be his fourth loan. He has repaid all his previous loans on time. He plans to buy a dairy cow with the loan.

In the future, he plans to buy more cows and a large farm for large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elmurod

texts.ru: Бердиев Элмурод житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование средне - техническое, шафер. По специальности работает более 4 лет. Он в основном предоставляет услугу, такси. Кроме того Элмурод арендует небольшой земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. В этой области уже 6 лет. Целью кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений и аренда трактора.
texts.en: Elmurod B. is a resident of Tursun-zoda.  He is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He has a vocational education as a driver.  He has been working as a driver for more than four years. He primarily drives a taxi.  Additionally, Elmurod rents a small plot of land where he sows wheat and grows vegetables.  He has been doing this for six years.  He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and to rent a tractor.

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers and renting a tractor

loans.name: Hagobe

texts.ar:
هاكوب  اعزب يعمل حدادة وبويا السيارات له في مصلحته اكثر من 5 سنوات هاكوب عمره 
32 سنة طموح ويتميز في محيطه بالعمل الجيد والسمعة الكريمة فهو دائم العمل والتطور له تاريخ مشجع مع المجموعة
وقد استفاد كثيرا من القرض السابق حيث وسع المصلحة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة
وشراء سيارة قديمة لللتجارة بها زبائنه هم من جيرانه واصدقائه
texts.en: Hagobe is a 32-year-old single man with more than five years experience working in an automotive bodyshop, his customers coming from friends and neighbors. He is always busy working and pushing himself to improve. Hagobe has an encouraging history with Al Majmoua, and he very much benefited from a previous loan which allowed him to expand his business. He is now seeking another loan to purchase new equipment as well as a used car which he can resell.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and a used car

loans.name: Pakris

texts.en: Pakris, who is 66 years old, married to Serian Pakris and the father of three children, has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan with which he will buy five cows to rear and later sell at a profit.  In the future, Pakris hopes to have a big farm to raise his animals on.

loans.use: To buy five cows to later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.ar:
عدنان في عمر 50 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل شركة يحب عائلته ويريد دائما
التطور له ولعائلته فهو يعيل 3 اولاد في تعليمهم وغيره يريد ان يؤمن لهم العيش الكريم والمستقبل الجيد عدنان
له سمعة جيدة مع المجموعة يلقى دائما الدعم من محيطه فهو طموح وجدي في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من
المجموعة الى دفع الاقساط المدرسية لأولاده بسبب اقتراب دفع الاقساط ولا يريد ان يضطر الى تخلي اولاده عن التعليم بسبب
نقص في المادة
texts.en: Adnan is a 50-year-old husband and father who loves his family and is always trying to provide a good education for his three children. Adnan receives a lot of support from his community. He is very driven and earnest in his work. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua from a previous loan, Adnan is now seeking another loan to help pay the tuition bills of his children, the deadline for which are fast approaching. He very much does not want to have to tell them that they cannot keep studying just because of a lack of money.

loans.use: To pay his children's school tuition

loans.name: James Omwansa

texts.en:
James Omwansa N. is 30 years old, married to Regina Karemi, and a father of two wonderful children. He buys clothes and shoes in bulk and sells them to customers in Kitale Town. James has been in this business for three years now and he gets a monthly income of 26,000 KES.

This will be James's first loan from KADET. He plans to buy more clothes and shoes to increase his inventory since it is the busiest shopping month in Kitale. With the extra income, he plans to pay school fees for his two children and purchase more inventory. 

In the future James wants to own a shop of his own. Currently he sells clothes in a field. He also wants to increase his inventory to 100,000 KES.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth Tentere

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last two years.  She also extracts stone to sell from a quarry site.  She is 26 years old and married to Lemunyeru Mumtasoi. They have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 goats and 10 sheep, which she will raise and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to open a restaurant in Naivasha town, which will supplement her other income.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy all the requirements of his general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her store with various food products to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Luka Kiptanui

texts.en:
Luka Kiptanui K. is a man of twenty eight years.  He is married to Philloh Cherutich.  They have three children who are between seven and three years old. They live in Kipkabus in Eldoret Town.   

Luka sells cattle in the same area and gets a monthly income of two thousand shillings.  He has been in this business for three years now.

This will be Luka's first loan from KADET.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy more cattle so that he can increase his stock.  With the income he will get, he plans to diversify his business and plough his farm and also plant maize for resale after the harvest.

In the future, he wants to raise the family's standards of living, educate his children to the highest level, and provide them with basic human needs.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Paul Kamau

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  He is 43 years old, married to Esther Watetu, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy fertiliser and potato seedlings, and pay for labour to plant potatoes.

In the future, Paul plans to buy more land so that he can practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and potato seedlings, and pay for labour

loans.name: Muhammadmurod

texts.ru: Беков Мухаммадмурод проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 28 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. В селе Хилоли имеет продуктовый магазин. Продукты привозит с города Курган-Тюбе. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. В продвижении его деятельности ему помогает отец. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Muhammadmurod B. lives in Khuroson.  He is 28 years old, married, and has one child.  He has a high school education.  He has a grocery shop in the village of Hiloli.  He brings in goods from the city of Qurgan-Tube.  He has been doing this work for more than five years.  His father has helped him with his business.  He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
T. Murodjon is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. 

In spite of his difficult economic situation and after much time, Murodjon has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed them on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Murodjon comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for developing business

loans.name: Olga B. A.s.

texts.fr: Mariée, Olga est mère D. 2 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle est dans sa 36ème année. Les charges du foyer reviennent au couple. Dotée d'une expérience D. 4 ans dans son domaine, Olga vend des boissons, des produits cosmétiques et des pagnes dans une boutique dans la ville D. Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Son fonds D. commerce est bien situé dans la ville D. Cotonou. Ses clients sont constitués des habitants D. sa zone et D. ses environs. Elle s'approvisionne sur place à Cotonou dans les dépôts pour les boissons et au Nigeria et au Togo, deux pays limitrophes au Bénin pour les  produits cosmétiques. Pour renforcer son fonds D. commerce D. diverses marchandises, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV dans le but D. mieux satisfaire ses clients qui lui sont toujours fidèles. Elle est a son 1er crédit à FINADEV. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit lui permettra D. se prendre en charge et d'aider son mari dans les charges du loyer, notamment la scolarité et la santé des enfants. Olga est la responsable du groupe. Sur la photo, elle est dans un ensemble à fond blanc avec des fleurs bleues. Elle souhaiterait étendre son activité par l'ouverture d'une seconD. boutique. Elle est la caution solidaire D. EKLOUE Sylvie, qui se trouve à ses côtés dans la photo. Olga et Sylvie sont des amies D. vieilles dates. Pour bénéficier D. ce prêt, elles se sont mises ensembles, s'offrant ainsi garantie mutuelle pour le prêt.
texts.en:
Olga is married and the mother of 2 children, both of whom go to school. She is 36 years old. She and her husband both take care of the family's expenses. 

With 5 years of experience in her field, Olga sells drinks, beauty products and African cloth in a store in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She enjoys a good location in the city. Her customers are residents of the neighborhood and the surrounding areas. She obtains her supplies in warehouses for the drinks, and in Nigeria and Togo, countries that border Benin, for beauty products. 

To increase her working capital of various products, she has requested and received a micro-loan from FINADEV in order to better satisfy her customers, who are always loyal to her. This is her first loan from FINADEV. The extra income generated from this micro loan will allow her to meet her own needs and to help her husband with the family's expenses, such as schooling and healthcare for the children. 

Olga is the group's leader. In the photo, she is wearing an outfit with a  white background and blue flowers. She would like to expand her activity and open a second store. She is the co-guarantor for Sylvie Ekloue, who is besiD. Olga in the photo. They have been friends for a long time. To obtain the loan, they grouped together and became mutual guarantors.

loans.use: To buy African cloth, beauty products and canned juices to stock her store and meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Donakhon

texts.en: A. Donakhon is 29 years old. She is married with three children. For 12 years, Donakhon has worked as a market vendor. She is selling the plates and dishes of the oriental style in the central local market. This kind of goods is of popular demand among the population. This kind of china is widely used for the dowry of the girls and also for the family celebrations. The love for her children is the biggest reason for Donakhon to make an effort to provide what they need. Now Donakhon is planning to enlarge the range of goods. With this purpose, she requests 10,000 Somoni. Donakhon has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2006. Her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans. Donakhon and her children are sincerely grateful for your support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a being key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing plates and dishes of the oriental style in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother and father. Esther has a business sewing sponges. She has been in this business for 4 years, and works 7 days a week. She sells her products  from home. 

Esther has requested a loan of 600000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, to buy raw materials to make more sponges. Her main business challenges are transportation and defaulters. Her goal for her business is to own permanent business premises. She lives in a home that she rents, and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make sponges

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is married with four children and lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. She sells groceries — a business she started with the help of her husband 10 years ago. She has built up a good clientele. Sharifa is requesting a 8800 Somoni loan to purchase foodstuffs for her grocery store. She is hoping to see her business expand and grow consistently. Sharifa has a cheerful personality which is always a positive factor in working with customers. She is willing to work really hard to see her business flourish in the future. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuff to increase the range of goods offered

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
V. Anvar has a minivan and provides transportation services. In the business for 10 years he has gained much experience. Initially he rented the car, but after saving up, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main income for Anvar’s family and has improved their living conditions. Currently Anvar wants to expand his business and needs a loan of 10000 Somoni to purchase another minivan. Anvar thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase a new minivan to expand the business

loans.name: Kevork

texts.ar:
كيفورك له من العمر 54 سنة يعمل في حدادة البويا للسيارات له في عمله اكثر من 30 سنة 
يحب عمله ويريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجوعة الى شراء معدات جديدة وماكنة لرش البويا له تاريخ ممتاز مع المجموعة
يلقى الدعم الدائم من عائلته له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يتميز عمله بالدقة والنشاط والصدق في المعاملة لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة لدعم مصلحته لكي تتطور ومن خلالها يطور نفسه واولاده
texts.en: Kevork is a 54-year-old who has three decades experience working in automotive body repair and painting. He is very passionate about his work, to which he brings a lot of thoroughness and enthusiasm. He is very upfront and honest in dealing with his customers, who come from his neighbors and wider community. Kevork has an excellent credit history with Al Majmoua and would like to once again request a loan to purchase a spray painter and other new equipment. He wants to build up his business to be able to advance his children, who are of great support to him.

loans.use: To purchase a spray painter and other equipment for automotive bodyshop

loans.name: Saodatkhon

texts.ru: Гултораева Саодатхон проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ей 47 лет. Вдова, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке города. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает национальные сундуки, которые покупают на свадьбу. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 5 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов сундуков. То есть она намерена увеличить ассортимент товара, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль и расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Saodatkhon G. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube.  She is 47 years old.  She is a widow and has one child.  She has a high school education.  She works in the central market of the city.  She has a shop where she sells traditional bridal chests. She has been doing this work for more than five years.  She is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of chests.  She intends to increase her inventory to make a good profit and to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying new tyoes of chests

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is an active member and secretary of Ngeet Group in Kitale town, western Kenya, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables which he sells locally. He is also a matatu (public service vehicle) driver.

He has requested this loan of 62,400KES through Juhudi to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him take care of his family and also invest in other income-generating ventures. He hopes that his milk productivity will double in the next five years and that he will start zero grazing. His major challenges have been high cost of dairy feed and the low price of milk.

Peter is 25 years old and married with two children aged two months and four years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar:
حسن فس عمر 40 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والاستهلاكية (ميني ماركت) حسن متزوج ليس له اولاد له في الميني ماركت حوالي 10 سنوات استطاع حسن بجده ونشاطه ان يجعل المحل له فهو يريد دائما التطور والمثابرة في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد غذائية جديدة وبضائع متنوعة للميني ماركت
له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة ومشجع انه يلقى دعم دائم من محيطه زبائنه من جيرانه ومحيطه
texts.en: Hassan, 40, is married with no children. He has been working at a mini-market selling foodstuffs and other consumables for 10 years. With his hard work and perseverance, Hassan managed to buy the mini-market. In his work, Hassan is resolute, with a passion for development. Hassan wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new foodstuffs and sundry goods for his mini-market. Hassan has a good, promising credit history with Al Majmoua. He always enjoys the support of his clients, who are mainly his neighbours and other people he knows.

loans.use: Buy foodstuffs and various goods for his mini-market

loans.name: Hotel Lane Traders Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Hotel Lander Traders” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isatu K. is the leader of this group. The thirty-five-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children. Isatu has been a businesswoman for three years now, selling ready-to-wear-clothes. With her share of this loan she will be able to expand her business by buying more clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock. This will help her increase her business sales and profitability. 

The inserted photo is of a group member who was not able to be present.

loans.use: Buy ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar:
علي في عمر 59 سنة يعمل في تصليح وبيع الأدوات الكهربائية والعاب والاقراص المدمجة
له في عمله 30 سنة متزوج وله ولدان له تاريخ مع المجموعة حيث كان يلقى الدعم من العائلة واستطاع القرض ان يحسن
من وضع عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء العاب جديدة واقرص مدمجة وأدوات كهربائية يحب عائلته ويطمح دائما الى زيادة مدخوله حيث يصبح قادر على متابعة الحياة الاقتصادية الصعبة
texts.en: Ali is a 59-year-old husband and father of two who loves his very supportive family. He possesses three decades of experience repairing electronic appliances and selling them along with video games and CDs, and he is perpetually driven to find ways to increase revenues so that he can keep up with these difficult economic times. Ali’s previous loan from Al Majmoua helped to improve his business. He is now seeking another loan to purchase new electronic appliances, video games, and CDs.

loans.use: Purchase electronic appliances, video games, and CDs for shop

loans.name: Marta Rafael

texts.pt:
Marta Rafael L. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique. E casada mãe de 4 filhos de 18 aos 26 anos de idade. Os três  mais velhos são empregados somente a mais nova é que estuda. Fez somente 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu neto que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, depois de seus estudos ela consegue arranjar um emprego no Registo Civil da Namaacha e trabalha como brigadista nas localidades do  mesmo Distrito durante 5 anos. Quando recebeu a transferência para trabalhar no centro do pais o seu esposo inpede­a de ir trabalhar alegando que era distante. Mais tarde consegue arranjar um emprego no Hotel Xisaka como pasteleira onde trabalha a mais de 15 anos auferindo mensalmente um valor de 4.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar na sua conta bancaria, pois conta com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha como docente.
Este é o quinto empréstimo de Marta na Hluvuku e segundo com kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, chapas e outros) para continuar com a ampliação da sua casa.
Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo e pedir um novo empréstimo para a manuntenção e pintura da sua obra.
texts.en:
Marta Rafael L. was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is married and has 4 children whose ages range from 18 to 26. The three older children are working and the youngest is in school. Marta only studied through 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and helps support a grandson who lives with them.

Marta still lives in Namaacha. After finishing school she was able to get a job with the Civil Registry, and worked in towns in Namaacha for 5 years. She had the opportunity to continue this work in central Mozambique, but her husband kept her from taking the job transfer because it was too far away. After that, Marta got a job as a pastry chef at the Hotel Xisaka. She's worked there for 15 years and has a monthly salary of 4000 Meticais, which she uses to cover household expenses. With the help of her husband and the salary he earns as a teacher, she is also able to save some in her bank account. 

This is Marta's 5th loan with Hluvuku [the Kiva field partner] and her 2nd funded through Kiva. She is asking for 15,000 Meticais to buy construction materials (cement, stone, metal plates and other items) in order to continue working on a home expansion project. 

She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan ahead of schedule and take out a new loan later in order to pay for the upkeep and painting of the new portion of her home.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stone, doors and other items)

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet M. is a 36-year-old married lady with three children. She operates a food kiosk which has been in existence for the past two years. The business is situated at Mjanaheri in Malindi town.

Annet was introduced to KADET LTD by another client who is a registered member of the company. This is her first loan from KADET. The loan amounts to Kshs. 10,000. She is planning to use it to add more stock to the kiosk as well as repair the business structure.

Annet wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue expanding the business and to buy a plot so that she may later be able to own a well-established hotel.  She wants to progress and see her family healthy and her children well-educated.

loans.use: To add more stock, and repair business premises

loans.name: Ruzi

texts.en:
Ruzi, who is married and has three children, makes his living selling foodstuffs at his grocery store. His location is very good and he serves many customers because he is willing to work late. In this business for 16 years, he knows a good deal about it. Ruzi is also a very punctual and detail-oriented person, character traits that help him in his business. Ruzi can always figure out how many supplies he needs to ensure they are always fresh and of sufficient quantity to meet customer needs. Ruzi has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
B. Bahodir is a very responsible and optimistic person, and he has 4 children and a wife whom he has to support. Bahodir wishes to develop his business. This business consists of raising sheep and selling them in his village. Bahodir is helped by his elder sons. Bahodir is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing, and accordingly their expenses are growing too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities and services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small sheep for developing business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy fish, palm-oil, bananas and used clothes for her business

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne A. is 35 years old. She is from the Kondele area and is married to Samuel. They have three children, Teddy, 12 years; Hermsh, seven years; and Nicole, three years old.

Everlyne sells second-hand clothes and has been doing so for 10 years. She is applying for her first loan from Kadet Ltd after being introduced to Kadet by a friend who has benefited from the loans. Everlyne intends to use the money to buy more bales of clothes to add to her stock. The profits made from her business will be used to cater to the family’s needs and also pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to see her business grow from retail to wholesale.

loans.use: Buy more bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus has been in the farming business for the last nine years. He has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya which produces eggs, milk and tomatoes. He sells all his products to the local market. He also earns income from his butchery business in the same location. His biggest challenge has been poultry diseases.

He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 60,000KES and has requested this loan of 60,000KES to expand his poultry project. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. In the next 5 years, he wishes to have 1000 chickens and supply eggs to the local market.  

Justus is 49 years old. He is married with 7 children who are between the ages of 2 and 22.

loans.use: To expand his poultry business.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat lives in Kanibadam, Tajikistan, with her husband and four children. Bashorat is a entrepreneur who has been in the grocery business for three years. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to use as capital and generate additional profit. Bashorat hopes to see her business expand she is planning to buy at least one more grocery site at her market. Bashorat is very good with finances and knows how to manage money and investments. Her current loan request will allow her to maintain good product selection and continue to earn an adequate income to support herself and her family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Yiasi Ene

texts.en:
Yiasi has been raising animals for sale in Naivasha town for the past five years. She is 42 years old, and is married to R. Ole Tuuko. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy goats that she will rear and sell later for a profit.

In the future, Yiasi hopes to start selling animal skin and hide in large quantities to skin-processing firms.

loans.use: To buy goats that she will raise and sell for a profit.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman with one daughter who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

Florence operates a clothing business and she sells clothes from her home and also door to door to neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the change of seasons. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to help boost her business. Florence is requesting a loan of 25,000 KES to purchase a bale of clothing, including shirts and baby dresses. In the future, she hopes to establish a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 53 years old and married with nine adult children, one of whom is currently attending school. For over ten years, he has been practicing mixed farming. His farm is located in Kisii town, western Kenya, and he produces tea, milk, and eggs which he sells to the local market. Henry mainly depends on the income from his farm to provide for the needs of his family. His major challenge is the lack of reliable markets for his products.

Henry has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo and has successfully repaid a previous loan of 45,000 KES. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. The loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow to improve milk production and provide enough milk for both domestic consumption and sale. Henry hopes to expand his farming activities and increase his productivity.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 57 years old. He is married to Agnes, who is a businesswoman. They have been blessed with three children. He has been a farmer for the past 20 years. He manages to earn a monthly income of Kshs 30,000/= (Kenyan shillings). 

He plans to use the loan to purchase a water pump, which will enable him produce crops through irrigation, even during the dry season, making him likely to shine even more. He was introduced to Kadet by friends and this is his first loan. He plans to use the anticipated profits to venture into cattle-rearing.

loans.use: Purchase water pump

loans.name: Zaryl

texts.en:
Zaryl K. is 51 years old. She lives in Kochkor village in the north of Kyrgyzstan and has four grown children. Zaryl graduated from college and worked as a cook in the local area for 20 years. She is characterized by her colleagues as a responsible, precise and open-hearted person. Now she is engaged in cattle breeding and makes every effort to provide some savings for old age. 

Zaryl used her starting capital of 2,000 KGS to buy livestock for fattening and reselling. Thanks to her persistent and hard-working personality, she managed to enlarge the number of livestock and earns about 3,000 KGS monthly. With the revenues from livestock reselling, Zaryl was able to build up a barn. 

Zaryl plans to use this loan of 130,000 KGS to buy six bull calves. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden out her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen K. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a mother and father).  Maureen has a business of African clothing. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Maureen sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail.  

Esther has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of African clothing. She also generates additional income through selling locally made ghee (butter fat made out of milk). The main business challenge(s) for Maureen include rainy season and ever increasing prices of African clothing. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a permanent business premises and also to build her own house and to educate her children up to university.  Maureen lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy rolls of African clothing

loans.name: Ali Mulwa

texts.en: Ali Mulwa N. is a 55 year old man. He is married to Joecy Ali, who is a housewife, and they are blessed with five children. Ali has been a retail shop owner for the past year. This is his sixth loan from KADET. He plans to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and soap. From the anticipated profits, he plans to add cereals to his business.  He hopes to expand to a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and soap

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.ru: Тагоев Хикмат житель района Хуросон. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Живет вместе с женой и детьми. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хикмат имеет средне - специальное образование, водитель. По специальности работает 25 лет. Кроме того Хикмат разводит крупнорогатый скот. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количества.
texts.en: Hikmat T. is a resident of Khuroson.  He is married and has four children.  He lives with his wife and children.  His wife is a housewife.  Hikmat has a vocational education as a driver.  He has worked in his speciality for 25 years.  Additionally, Hikmat raises cattle.  He principally raises cattle for resale. He has been doing this for more than 20 years.  He is taking out a loan to buy more cattle.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Orieta

texts.es:
Orieta forma parte del banco comunal “Brindando Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella vende ropa, perfumes (para adultos y niños) y joyas, desde hace 12 años, a domicilio y en algunas instituciones como por ejemplo bancos, el colegio de su hijo y la iglesia en la cual participa. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, papeles y cintas de regalo para prepararse para la época navideña. Ella viaja una vez al mes a Santiago a comprar sus productos. Cuenta con el apoyo de su marido con quien tiene 2 hijos, uno de 4 y otro de 9 años. 
El sueño de Orieta  es tener una boutique.
A Orieta le han sido muy útiles las enseñanzas que le han entregado en las reuniones de Fondo Esperanza, sobre cómo administrar su negocio, además que le es muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Orieta is a member of the “Brindando Esperanza” (Giving Hope) community bank, in the city of Concepción.  She has been selling clothes, perfumes (for adults and children) and jewelry for 12 years.  She sells her products from her home and in some institutions such as, for example, banks, her son's school and her church.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise, gift wrap and ribbons to get ready for the Christmas period.  Orieta travels once a month to Santiago to buy her products.  She has the support of her husband with whom she has 2 children: one aged 4 and one aged 9.

Orieta's dream is to own her own store.

Orieta has found the training given in Fondo Esperanza's meetings on how to run her business to be very useful.  She is also very pleased to be sharing with her fellow group members.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the River Biobío, one of the biggest rivers in the country, in the south of Chile, in Biobío region.  Historically it has a very important place in our history.  It was the site of important battles and notable settlement, especially during the War of Arauco as it was right on the border of Mapuche territory.  Currently the city is well developed both economically and demographically.  It is now considered one of the most important demographic, administrative, financial and commercial urban centers in Chile after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: clothes, perfume, gift wrap and ribbons

loans.name: Julia Kenga

texts.en:
Julia Kenga M. is a 45-year-old woman from Mtwapa. She is a single mother of two children. Julia has been in the retail business for the past three years and runs a retail shop in Mtwapa. Her business is doing well. 

This is her second loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her shop. Julia has directed the anticipated profits to her children’s education. Her hope and dream is to own a horticultural business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a single lady aged 46 and a mother of three children aged 25,16, and 10 years. She has been supplying construction material for the last 13 years, a business which earns her Kshs 18,000 monthly. She intents to use the loan to expand her stock so as to boost her income. She was introduced to Kadet by a friend who benefited and this is her first loan. She plans to use the expected profits to expand the business even further. She hopes to own her  own house in future.

loans.use: Expansion of construction supplies inventory

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Maman de 50ans, diplômée sans emploi est en activité depuis 20 ans, elle vend du bois de chauffe de 15000f a 30.000frs par jour .par jour. Avant le premier prêt, elle a améliorée ses ventes, a pu rembourser sans difficultés et a fait d'énormes comme jamais elle l'a fait. 

Elle s’approvisionne auprès des camions qui livrent du bois ruelle par ruelle, elle achète à 150f le fagot qu’elle revend à 250f, le prêt lui a permit d'avoir la capacité de 1000 fagots par mois.

Le prochain prêt lui permettra  d’augmenter de plus belle son stock de bois, faire la vente en gros et détails.
Elle compte augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en épargnant de plus en plus pour changer d’activité plu tard.
Elle  veut emmener ses enfants à faire des longues études universitaires.
texts.en:
A 50 year old mother and an unemployed graduate has been working for 20 years selling firewood from 15000f to 30 000frs a day. Since the first loan, she has improved her sales and was able to reimbourse it without difficulties. She has been more successful than ever.

She is supplied by trucks which deliver the wood alley by alley. She buys bundles at 150f which she re-sells at 250f. The loan allowed her to have the capacity of 150 bundles per month. 

The next loan will allow her to increase her stock of wood even more and sell both wholesale and retail. She plans to increase her turnover by saving more and more in order to change her activities later. She wants to enable her children to do long university studies.

loans.use: Sale of firewood and carbon

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman with one child, who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and house rent. 

She has operated a pharmacy shop for the last three years, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. Florence faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her pharmacy inventory in the future. 

With the Kshs 60,000 loan, she wants to purchase packets of medicine, a glass mirror and building materials to renovate her pharmacy. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase medicine, a glass mirror and building materials to renovate her pharmacy.

loans.name: Sinclair

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 30ans, tient une alimentation cela bientôt 2 ans. Il avait acheté au premier prêt des pains en gros et détails , saucissons, jambon,boite de margarine, sardines, et différents boite de conserves .
Le premier  prêt était venu renforcer son commerce et il a fait des bénéfices qui l’ont permis de rembourser.
C’est sa  première expérience dans le système des micro-finances et il se bat pour l’amélioration de ses conditions de travail.

Avec le deuxième prêt, il va renforcer son commerce et générer  plus de bénéfices en renforçant ce qui existe déjà et élargir son étalage.
Ses recettes sont passées de 30.0000f a 50.000 fr par  jour. Tres ambitieux , il se bat pour atteindre son objectif , ouvrir un grand restaurant a la longue
texts.en:
This young 30-year-old man has been running a grocery store for almost two years. He used his first loan to buy wholesale and retail bread, sausages, ham, containers of margarine, sardines, and various canned goods.

The first loan strengthened his business, and his profits allowed him to repay it.

This is his first experience with micro-finance, and he is fighting to improve his working conditions.

With this second loan, he will bolster his business and increase his profits by strengthening what is already there and expanding his display.

His revenue grew from 30,000 to 50,000 francs per day. Very ambitious, he strives to reach his goal of opening a large restaurant in the long run.

loans.use: Buy milk cartons, margarine, sardines, tomatoes, canned goods

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina M. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child who is in school.  Madina has a business as a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Madina sells her products in her shop at retail prices.     

Madina has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids. The main business challenge(s) for Madina include the rainy season and the ever increasing prices of cosmetics. Her goals and aspirations for her business is to own bridal salon and also to build her own house.   

Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics, braids and hair relaxers

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Thirty-three year old Martin is married and has 4 school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from the town of Kitale, in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 7 years and employs three farmhands. His farm currently produces eggs and milk which he sells locally. He also runs a shop in the same location which supplements his income. 

Martin has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farm. He says that the proceeds from this loan will assist in the eduction of his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his farming and venture into dairy farming. He says poultry diseases is a major problem which sometimes leads to death and a financial loss to him as a farmer. 

He appreciates the flexibility of the repayment terms with Juhudi, i.e the monthly repayment.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Judyciane

texts.fr:
Femme de 35ans gérante d'un kiosque d’alimentation, elle est célibataire et mère de 2 enfants.

Le premier prêt , l’avait permis de faire le stock de son kiosque en achetant les produits de premiers nécessités tels que poudre de lessive,conserves  savons de Marseille, paquets de bonbons, carton de biscuits, boite de conserves...
Ses revenus journaliers ont augmenté,  Chez elle, les gens du quartier peut maintenant trouver un peux de tout, pour cela avec le prochain prêt, elle va ajouter ce qui manque dans son kiosque : tomate en boite, les boîtes de (sardines,  pâté, porcs corne beef, lait, café, chocolat, sucre, sel…)
Pour la prospérité de son commerce,  elle veut transformée son kiosque en une grande alimentation et satisfaire ses clients car la demande est forte dans sa zone.
texts.en:
This 35-year-old woman is the manager of a food stall. She is a single mother of two children.

She used her first loan to stock her booth with basic staple goods such as laundry detergent, canned goods, Marseille soaps, candy, cartons of cookies, etc. Her daily income increased. 

The locals come to her to find a bit of everything, and she intends to use her next loan to add a few items currently missing from her inventory: canned tomatoes, sardines, pate, pork, corned beef, milk, coffee, chocolate, sugar, salt, etc.

In order to boost profitability, she wants to convert her food stall into a large shop to better meet customer demand, which is very high in her area.

loans.use: Buying boxes of soap, canned goods, laundry powder, cartons of milk

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has six children, all of whom are in school.  Prossy has a food stall business. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Prossy sells her products at the market. Prossy has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, avocados and tomatoes, and bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Prossy include the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to start going directly to farmers for her business and also to build her own house. Prossy lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes, tomatoes, avocados and bananas

loans.name: Anipa

texts.en:
Anipa B. is 57 years old and widowed.  She was born in a large family of farmers and from early childhood was engaged in looking after cattle. She finished school and because of the limited income of her family she couldn’t continue her studies.  Nuruypa got married and worked with her husband as a stock keeper in the local area.  Unfortunately, in 1992 her husband died because of cancer and she became the only bread-winner for her family.

In order to find additional means of income, she decided to begin her business of cattle breeding.  Due to her vast experience in this activity, Anipa managed to maintain the farm and was able to reconstruct one of the rooms in her house into a small shop with groceries.

Now Anipa is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy two cows and sheep.  With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by opening a bigger grocery store.  Anipa is an optimistic woman and believes that her tireless efforts will lead her family to a more prosperous life. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan.  As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the needs of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of her father.  

Halima has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for 4 years and she works 7 days of every week. Halima sells her products in a retail shop. Halima has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more cream hair relaxers, weaves and braids. The main business challenges for Halima include seasonality and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked salon and also to build her own house. Halima lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Glorius

texts.en:
Glorius M. is a 30-year-old married lady with two children. She operates a food kiosk which has been in existence for the past two years now. The business is situated at Shella in Malindi town. Glorius was introduced to KADET Ltd by another client who is already registered with KADET and this is her third loan from KADET. The loan amounts to Kshs. 80,000 and M. is planning to use it to add stock for her kiosk as well as repair the business structure. 

Glorius wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to plough back into the business to grow it,  so as to be able to start up a greengrocer business. Also her deeper desire is to see her family healthy and give the best education to her children.

loans.use: buy foodstuffs like rice and wheat flour and repair the business premises

loans.name: Quimey Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Quimey” se conforma por 20 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Villarrica. 
María Cristina es la secretaria de este grupo y en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, en 3º lugar de izquierda a derecha. Ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y carteras, a domicilio y en su casa, desde hace 2 meses. Antes de este negocio trabajaba como cajera en una empresa de buses. 
Con este préstamo comprará perfumes. Su meta es aumentar sus ingresos al doble, para ir creciendo en su negocio. Vive con su marido y su única hija de 8 años. 
A María Cristina le ha servido mucho este préstamo de Fondo Esperanza, para continuar con su negocio. Además se ha sentido muy bien con los temas de confianza y solidaridad que han compartido durante las reuniones de grupo junto a su asesora.
Villarrica es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios D. área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Pucón. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
The “Quimey” community bank has 20 members who live in the city of Villarrica.

María Cristina is the group's secretary.  In the photo she is in the back row, third from the left.  She sells perfumes and purses both door-to-door and from her home.  She has been doing this for 2 months.  Before she started her business, she worked as a cashier in a bus company.

María Cristina will use this loan to buy perfume.  Her goal is to double her income so that she can grow in her business.  She lives with her husband and her only child, an 8 year-old daughter.

María Cristina has found this loan from Fondo Esperanza to be very useful in helping her continue with her business.  She is also happy with the trust and solidarity which the group members have shared during their group meetings together with their advisor.

Villarrica is a city in southern Chile which is located in La Araucanía region.  It is a small city but has every basic service and tourist service as it is one of the main service centers of the Andean region and the main tourist center of the region, together with Pucón.  During the summer months, there are many cultural, artistic and sporting activities and events.  There is also a lot of ecotourism, adventure tourism and ethnotourism.

loans.use: To buy perfume

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, five of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).   She lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.  

Rosemary runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days a week. She also generates additional income through tailoring.  She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt ,boxes of soap, and cooking oil for her shop. The main business challenges for Rosemary are seasonality and defaulters . Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children through to university, and also to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 48 years old. He is married with 4 children who are between the ages of 4 and 16. Three of his children are currently attending school.

Philip has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya, that produces maize, milk, beans and vegetables. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 15 years and has employed one farmhand. He is also a primary school teacher. 

Philip has requested this loan of 41,600 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him provide for the basic needs of his family and invest in other projects. He says that the dairy industry is lucrative at the moment and he hopes to own good quality animals that will give him enough income to sustain his family and meet other needs. His biggest challenges have been the high cost of dairy feeds and fluctuations in the prices of milk.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Daniel Katilit

texts.en:
Daniel Katilit R. is a man of thirty years, married to Everlyne and a father of seven children. They live in Ortum in Kitale where he does his transportation as a primary business and also sells timber. He has been in this business for thirteen years now and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. 

This will be Daniel's second loan through KADET and he plans to use the entire loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle and buy an electric blade for his timber business as well as buying cereals for resale. In future he wants to buy a plot of land and build a house for his family and ensure better education for his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle, an electrical blade for his timber business, and cereals for resale

loans.name: Joyas Del Pacífico Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Joyas del Pacífico” se conforma por 18 emprendedoras y un emprendedor, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. Sus negocios son principalmente venta de ropa, lencería, mariscos, bebidas con y sin alcohol, huevos, productos Avon, empanadas, pan amasado y almacenes. 
Jacqueline trabaja en peluquería, haciendo cortes de pelo, tinturas, masajes, visos y peinados. Atiende generalmente a domicilio y algunas veces en un espacio que adapta para la ocasión en el living de su casa. Este trabajo lo realiza todos los fines de semana, ya que además durante la semana vende comida rápida, en la casa de una hermana, junto a su hija mayor, quien también forma parte del grupo, y otra compañera. El trabajo de peluquería lo realiza desde hace 1 año y medio, luego de terminar un curso del tema. 
Con este préstamo Jacqueline comprará una máquina desvelladora (sirve para las terminaciones de los cortes de pelo), un delantal de peluquera, agua oxigenada, tinturas y cremas de pelo, entre otros insumos  y lo que quede del dinero será para comprar alimentos para su otro negocio. 
A Jacqueline le han sido un importante apoyo los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, al igual que los talleres de administración de negocios, ya que ahora puede llevar un orden de lo que gasta y de lo que gana en sus negocios. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
The “Joyas del Pacífico” (Jewels of the Pacific) community bank has 18 female entrepreneurs and 1 male entrepreneur.  It is located in the city of Valparaíso.  The members businesses include selling clothes, underwear, seafood, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, eggs, Avon products, empanadas, 'pan amasado' (a type of Chilean bread), and running stores.

Jacqueline is a hairdresser.  She cuts and colors hair, provides massages, facials and hairdos.  She generally works in other people's homes but also sometimes in a space which she adapted for this purpose in her living room.  She does her work every weekend because during the week she sells fast food in one of her sister's houses, together with her older sister, who is also a member of the group, and another friend.  She has been doing the hairdressing work for one and a half years after she finished a course on the topic.

Jacqueline will use this loan to buy clippers (which are used to finish off hair cuts), a hairdressing cape, hydrogen peroxide, dyes and hair creams, amongst other supplies.  What she has left over she will use to buy food for her other business.

Fondo Esperanza's loans have been an important source of support for Jacqeline, as have the business management workshops, since she can now keep records of what she spends and what she makes in her business.

Valparaíso is 120 kilometers north-west of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and also the seat of the country's legislative power.  It is the most important port in the nation and offers a large variety of beautiful and picturesque places such as, for example, the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: To buy hair clippers and food

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne, forma parte del banco comunal “Newen” (en mapudungun significa “energía vital o fortaleza”), de la comuna de Maipú. Ella tiene un bazar-librería en su casa, desde hace 6 años. Atiende de lunes a sábado y los domingos de fechas importantes o de muchas actividades de su barrio. Vive sola con su perrita llamada Quimey, que en mapudungun significa hermosa. Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, pensando en regalos para Navidad, como por ejemplo muñecas, camiones de juguete, adornos para el hogar, etc. También hace para vender algunos artículos de madera y papel, como lapiceros, porta vinos y bolsas de papel para regalos entre otras cosas. Su sueño es reparar su negocio, ya que producto del terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero, se le derrumbó el estuco de las paredes, además perdió mucha mercadería y también le gustaría cambiar el portón de su negocio, el cual, desde que tiene el negoico, le es muy incomodo, ya que se abre hacía adentro, puesto que antes era un garaje. 
A  Ivonne le ha sido de mucho apoyo y animo que le han dado  su grupo y asesora de Fondo Esperanza, 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a member of the “Newen” community bank (in Mapudungun, 'newen' means 'dynamic energy or strength').  It is located in Maipú.

Ivonne has had a stationery store / book store in her home for 6 years.  She serves there from Monday to Saturday and also Sundays if it is an important date or there is a lot of activity in her neighborhood.  Ivonne lives alone with her dog called Quimey which means 'beautiful' in Mapundungun.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise, in particular Christmas gifts such as, for example, dolls, toy trucks, decorations for the home, etc.  She would also like to buy some wood and paper products such as pencil sharpeners, wine racks and paper gift bags, amongst other things.

Ivonne's dream is to repair her business as the plaster came off her walls following the earthquake on February 27th and she lost a lot of merchandise.  She would also like to change the door of her business.  It has been very annoying since she started in her business because it opens inwards (her store used to be a garage).

Ivonne has received a lot of support and encouragement from her group and her Fondo Esperanza advisor.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the River Biobío, one of the biggest rivers in the country, in the south of Chile, in Biobío region.  Historically it has a very important place in our history.  It was the site of important battles and notable settlement, especially during the War of Arauco as it was right on the border of the land of the Mapuche.  Currently the city is well developed both economically and demographically.  It is now considered one of the most important demographic, administrative, financial and commercial urban centers of Chile after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, mainly toys

loans.name: Eugene

texts.fr: Eugene R. est marié, et il a 5 enfants entre 10 ans et 13 ans.  Il est un membre de l’armee Patriotique Rwandais. Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pierres, ciments, des portes, des fenêtres et du sable pour renouveler sa maison.  Il voudrait avoir une vie plus aisée, développer son pays et arriver à avoir une usine du lait.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait nourrir bien les enfants et leur mère, et aussi l’éducation pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Eugene R. is married and has five children, from 10 to 13 years of age. He is a member of Rwandan Patriotic Army. Four of his children go to school. He would like to use his loan to purchase stones, cement, doors, windows and sand in order to repair his house. He would like to improve his quality of life, to cultivate his land and eventually to have a milk factory. As to his family, he would like to provide well for the children and their mother, and for the children’s education as well.

loans.use: Purchasing stones, cement, doors, windows and sand

loans.name: Constant

texts.fr:
Homme marié, âgé de 32ans, père de 3enfants. Il a un cafeteria en plein quartier  ou il  offre ses services aux clients.
Il vend du matin au soir en changeant des mets.ses ventes ont augmentes de 8000 f a 35.000f
Avec le prêt passé, il avait fait un stock important ce qui lui a permis de rembourser et épargner sans faille.
Il avait acheté les produits tels que : 1bidon d’huile, 1carton de spaghetti, 1carton de lait en poudre, 1 sac de sucre, des palettes d’œufs, des boîtes de margarine chocolat, café, pâté et pâte d’arachides.

Le deuxième prêt serai utiliser de la même manière que le précédent, il va améliorer les conditions de ses services en ajoutant des chaises et tables en plastiques ,de cartons  de sardines, de mayonnaise,  de vinaigre, les boites de macédoines et petits pois et prendre un abonnement dans une boulangerie pour une livraison de pains a domicile chaque matin.
Ses objectifs sont tels qu’il veut agrandir son activité et ouvrir une espace plus grande afin de recevoir beaucoup de clients.
texts.en:
A married man, 32 years of age, the father of three. He has a cafeteria in the middle of his neighborhood, in which he servers his clients.

He sells from morning to night and changes the dishes offered. His sales have grown from 8,000 to 35,000 West African Francs. With his previous loan, he was able to have a   large stock, which allowed him to repay his loan without issues and to save money. He purchased groceries such as 1 jug of oil, 1 box of spaghetti, 1 box of milk powder, 1 bag of sugar, a pallet of eggs, boxes of margarine, chocolate, coffee, spreads and peanut butter. 

The second loan will be used in the same way as the previous one. He would like to improve his cafeteria by adding plastic chairs and tables, boxes of sardines, mayonnaise, vinegar, boxes of mixed fruit, peas, and also to make an agreement with a bakery for daily delivery of fresh bread. His goal is to expand his business and to open a larger cafeteria in order to be able to serve many customers.

loans.use: Purchasing cartons of milk powder,, butter,  meats,  eggs, non-alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Evariste

texts.fr: Évariste N. a 52 ans, il est marié, et il a 4 enfants entre 5 ans et 15 ans.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Evariste est comptable dans une entreprise de construction, et il est choriste dans son église. Il va utiliser son prêt pour le paiement de son loyer pour 3 mois. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner beaucoup pour la construction de sa propre maison d’habitat.  Il voudrait avoir une maison, et éduquer les enfants.
texts.en: Évariste N. is 52 years old. He is married and is the father of four children, from 5 to 15 years of age. All his children go to school. Evariste is a bookkeeper in a construction firm. He is also a choir member in his church. He would like to use his loan to pay his rent for three month. His business strategy is to grow his savings in order to have his own house built. He would like to have a house and educate his children.

loans.use: Paying rent for three months

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Rafael. 
Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación ParA., con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  3º con sus 14 integrantes.  

Todas las integrantes del comité están muy agradecidas con la Fundación ParA. por el valioso apoyo que les brinda para poder mejorar sus condiciones financieras en la sociedad.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rossana trabaja como empleada domestica en un casa de familia y le gusta mucho formar parte de comité ya que aprende mucho de las demás integrantes.
Ella es muy trabajadora y desea continuar con el grupo hasta conseguir armar para su propio negocio.
Actualmente los créditos que ella solicita son para la compra de artículos que utilizan en la casa.
texts.en:
The women of this committee come from the neighbourhood of San Rafael. The ladies are very satisfied with the economic support that the [field partner] Fundación ParA. is bringing them. With this capital the ladies are enlarging their small businesses as well as their incomes for a better quality of living. The ladies are in cycle number 3 with their 14 members.

All the members of the commitee are very grateful to the Fundación ParA. for the valuable support that it brings them to be able to improve their financial conditions in society.

One of the members is Ms. Rossana who works as a domestic employee in a family's house. She is very happy to be a part of the committee as she learns a lot from the other members. She is very hard-working and wants to continue with the group until she manages to put together her own business. The loans which she is currently requesting are for the purchase of items that they use in the house.

loans.use: To buy household items

loans.name: Karembo Mtava

texts.en:
Karembo Mtava D. is  30 years old. She is a single mother of one child and she supports three people. Karembo has been in the salon business for the last two years.

This marks her second loan from KADET, and she plans to purchase a new dryer and add more stock, e.g., chemicals, shampoos, etc. to her business inventory. From the anticipated profits, she plans to start a hotel business. Karembo’s dream is to expand her business and cater for her family’s needs.

loans.use: purchase a new dryer and add more stock in the business

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “LA PAZ” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas.
