Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de comida y fundición de fierros y metales, viajera con mercadería de uso doméstico, venta de papa, servicio de decoraciones de salón para eventos, venta de mochilas, venta de productos de belleza y juguetes.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora Maria Luisa  tiene un hogar conformado por su esposo y 6 hijos, aprendió el negocio de fundición de metales de una amiga y el de comida fue comenzado por iniciativa propia desde hace un tiempo, realiza sus ventas en la cancha de la zona en la que vive.  Le colaboran en su trabajo sus hijos.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el tipo de ahorro, la atención en el consultorio y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “La Paz” community bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer in the Senkata Community Center. La Paz is comprised of eight members. The board is formed by a president, treasurer and secretary. The businesses represented by its members vary: food sales, metal casting, door-to-door sales of household goods, event decorating, backpack sales, beauty products and toy sales. 

In the case of the president, Maria Luisa lives in a household comprised of her husband and six children. She learned the metal casting business from a friend and has been self-employed for some time. She conducts sales in the main square of the area where she lives. She works with her children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria says that she likes the savings capabilities, and access to consulting and training.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food preparation and metals to cast

loans.name: Fanny Flor

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanny Flor; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella presta servicio de movilidad llevando a niños y niñas de un colegio, la socia también hace manualidades para la época navideña, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender las manualidades. 
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fanny Flor is a member of the “Liderando Las Palmeras” Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province, Cusco department.

Fanny Flor is 44 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her transportation business.  She transports children from a school.  She also makes handicrafts for the Christmas season.  She wants to have a store in order to sell her handicrafts.

She is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: To buy materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and married to Haron, a lecturer. They have been blessed with five children. She has been selling clothes for the last nine years, whereby she makes an income of Kshs 6,000 per month. She is likely to succeed because her husband is in a stable job, thus meeting most of their expenses, and this paves the way for Mary's business to grow. 

The loan will be used to purchase more clothing stock, especially to sell during the December peak season. She was introduced to Kadet by a friend, and this is her first loan. Her future dream is to grow the business to be a stable source of income.

loans.use: Clothing stock

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr:
Âgée de 47ans, mariée mère de 3 enfants et propriétaire d’un restaurant à l’entrée d’un marché qu’elle tient  depuis 7ans.
 Le prêt passé lui a été très bénéfique dans la mesure où elle a su connaître qu’est ce  que la gestion de stock, le journal de caisse et autre stratégie de gestion d’une activité génératrice des revenus.
Elle achète toujours les vivre frais pour éviter de perdre sa marchandise avec le manque d’électricité. Sa clientèle est diversifiée, des vendeurs du marché, des chauffeurs de taxi, des passants qui s’arrête souvent à son restaurant.
Hormis le renforcement de son activité, elle a aussi améliorée ses prestations.
Le prochain prêt sera pour les achats tels que : 1panier de poissons fumés, 1carton de poissons salés, 1bidon d’huile de palme, 1bidon d’huile d’arachides, 1carton de boîtes de tomates, 1filet d’oignons. Les autres denrées seront achetées au fur et à mesure que l’activité évolue.
Ses revenus sont passés de 20000f à 45000f par jour et veut devenir une grande restauratrice afin d’embaucher les jeunes filles mères.
texts.en:
47 years of age, married with three children and the owner of an eatery at the market entrance, which she has been running for seven years. The previous loan proved very beneficial for her since she was able to learn how to manage stock, keep a cash register and other business strategies.
She continues to buy her groceries fresh in order to avoid spoilage of goods due to electricity failures. Her customer base is diversified: market vendors, taxi drivers, passersby who like to stop by at her place.
In addition to strengthening her business, she also increased her income. 

The next loan will be used for purchase such items as one basket of smoked fish, one box of salted fish, one jug of palm oil, one jug of peanut oil, one box of canned tomatoes, one onion braid. 
Her revenues increased from 20,000 to 45,000 West African francs per day, and eventually she would like to have a big food-serving business and employ young unmarried mothers.

loans.use: Purchasing smoked and salted fish, fresh staple foods, oil jog , onion braids, bags of green beans etc

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 30 years old and married with 7 children. Five of her children are currently attending school.

Florence is a farmer from Kisii town, in western Kenya, where she has been farming for eight years. Her farm produces maize, milk, tea, coffee and sugarcane, which she sells locally. She depends mainly on the income from her farm to meet her family’s needs. 

She has requested this loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s living conditions and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she aspires to increase her number of dairy cows from the current 2 to 5, and to start a posho mill business. However, she faces the challenge of lack of financing to buy farm implements like fertilizers, which affects her production.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Cecilia Flores

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cecilia; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es separada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella presta servicio de movilidad escolar y también realiza manualidades para la navidad todo haciendo pedido de las diferentes personas o D. público en general, la socia quiere mejorar el servicio de movilidad escolar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales navideños para hacer los trabajos. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the “Liderando Las Palmeras” Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province, Cusco department.

Cecilia is 48 years old, separated, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her transportation business; she provides school transportation service.  She also makes handicrafts for Christmas.  She makes everything by order from different people or the general public.

She wants to improve her school transportation service.  She is requesting the loan to buy Christmas materials to make her handicrafts.

She is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: To buy Christmas materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Edwin Rene

texts.es: El señor Edwin Rene C. C.:  esta solicitando un refinanciamiento de crédito para poder seguir compramdo y fabricando muebles para una mueblería que tiene ubicada en su casa ya tiene  ubicado en un buen punto de venta  porque esta en la orilla de la carretera donde muchas personas lo visitan  para ver que tipo de  muebles  tiene, quiere emplear el capital que le otorguen  para poder colocar variedad de muebles    ya que en estos meses son mas constantes la venta  por fin de año y asi mismo poder sacar unos pedidos de muebles que le han hecho sus clientes. Sus sueños es poder tener otra venta propia de muebles en otro lugar y tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Edwin Rene C. C. is requesting a loan renewal in order to continue buying and making furniture for a furniture business that he has at his house.   He has a good sales location because he is on the edge of the road where a lot of people go to see what type of furniture he has.

He wants to use the loan to be able to invest in a variety of furniture.  Sales are steadier during these months that are at the end of the year.  He will also be able to fill some furniture orders that his customers have made.

His dreams are to be able to have another location of his own for selling furniture and to have more income.

loans.use: To buy and make furniture

loans.name: Chrisler

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 23ans, commerçant depuis 10ans vend les produits pharmaceutiques, Il est célibataire et père d’un enfant de 2ans.
Il fait venir ses produits de Kinshasa  pour vendre à un prix raisonnable.
Le prêt passé était pour lui une bonne expérience en ce qui concerne la gestion des crédits et les épargnes.
Sa stratégie était d’ajouter son stock des médicaments les plus usuels et de faire plus de bénéfices.
Il avait acheté les produits tels que : 1carton des solutions salées, 1carton des solutions sucrées, 1carton des seringues, 10 boite de paracétamol, 10 boites de quinine, 10 cartons des flacons d’alcool, 1carton de flacons de Bétadine, des sachets de coton, des rouleaux de bandes adhésives.
Ses recettes journalières sont de  50.000 fr à 125.000f.
Avec le prochain, il va augmenter sa marchandise et faire l’extension de son activité en ajoutant un autre coin de vente.
Il veut avoir plus de revenus afin d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et  de  prendre soin de sa fille de 2ans.
texts.en:
This young, 23-year-old man has been a merchant for ten years. He sells pharmaceuticals. He is single and has a 2-year-old child. He gets his merchandise shipped from Kinshasa to resell at a reasonable price.

The previous loan was a good experience as regards credit management and savings. His strategy was to increase his stocks of the most common drugs and earn more profits. He purchased products such as one carton of saline solution, one carton of glucose solution, one box of syringes, ten boxes of paracetamol, ten boxes of quinine, ten cartons of bottles of alcohol, ten cartons of Betadine, some cotton, and some adhesive tape. 

His daily revenue varies from 50,000 to 125,000F.

With the next loan, he plans to increase his stocks and expand his business by adding another sales outlet. He wants to boost his income to improve his living conditions and take care of his 2-year-old daughter.

loans.use: Buy products such as alcohol, saline, glucose solution, Betadine, paracetamol

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Guadalupe; ella tiene 46 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. hospedaje, la socia trabaja como administradora, ella trabaja desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m  y también se dedica a la venta D. uso D. cremas son productos cosméticos y también productos naturales, la socia quiere mejorar su hospedaje. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el hospedaje.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy Guadalupe is a member of the “Liderando Las Palmeras” Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province, Cusco department.

Nancy Guadalupe is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of providing lodging.  She works as the manager from 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 p.m.  She also sells creams, which are cosmetic products, and natural products.  

She wants to improve her boarding-house, and she is requesting the loan to help her boarding-house.

She is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: To improve her boarding-house

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children who all attend school. Justine has a shop. She has been in this business for 4 years and works 7 days a week. Justine has requested a loan of 300000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. 

She generates additional income by renting rooms. The main business challenges for Justine include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to build more rental rooms. She lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Rosalía  de Tobati. 

Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  1º con sus 13 integrantes. 

Una de las integrantes es la señora Liduvina quien  se dedica  a la atención  de su despensa.
Ella posee un negocio hace un buen tiempo, y desea continuar con el negocio ya que le ayuda mucho a su familia, especialmente para la alimentación de la familia.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con el grupo ya que encuentra mucho apoyo. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa, fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, y otros.
texts.en:
The members of the comunal bank are from the Santa Rosalía de Tobati neighborhood.

The women are very pleased with the economic support that is being provided to them from the Fundación Paraguaya.  With this loan the women are expanding their small businesses.  They are also increasing their incomes in order to have a better quality of life.  The women are in their first cycle, and there are 13 members.

Liduvina is one of the members.  She works in her grocery store, which she has had for a good amount of time.  She wishes to continue with the business because it helps her family a lot.  It especially helps to feed the family.

She is very pleased with the group because it is very supportive.  She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store.  She will buy things like noodles, rice, sugar, oil, and other things.

loans.use: To buy products like noodles, flour, sugar, rice, oil, and others

loans.name: Amigas De Corazón Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “AMIGAS DE CORAZÓN” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta la señora Rosa, tesorera la señora Ana y secretaria de actas la señora Leonor. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados de comercio, servicio y también producción.
En el caso de la presidenta, señora  Rosa tiene un hogar conformado por su esposo y 2 hijos.  El negocio de la señora Rosa ha sido y es el de venta de comida, en el tiempo ha cambiando de plato, primero vendía tostado de haba y chicharron de llama,  actualmente vende chicharrón de pollo.   También tiene proyectado impulsar con el crédito de este ciclo el negocio de empastado de cuadernos.  Le colabora en su trabajo sus hija de 23 años.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el consultorio.
Es importante hacer notar que varias socias asumen la estrategia de tener dos negocios, para contar con ingresos de manera contínua, si un negocio decae, el otro la sostiene.
texts.en:
The 'Amigas de Corazón' community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, in the Senkata regional office.  The bank has eight members.  Its board is made up of the president, Rosa, the treasurer, Ana, and the secretary, Leonor.  The businesses that the women have are varied and include commerce, services and also production.

The bank's president, Rosa, lives with her husband and 2 children.  Her business is selling meals.  Over time she has changed the dishes she sells.  She used to sell toasted beans and crispy fried llama meat.  She currently sells crispy fried chicken.  Rosa plans to use this loan to drive her book binding business in which she is helped by her 23 year-old daughter.

When we asked Rosa what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the doctor's office.

It is important to note here that several group members have a two business strategy so that they can make money continuously; if one business doesn't do well, the other one supports it.

loans.use: To buy chicken and sheets of paper

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de consultorio dental, ella trabaja junto con su esposo que atienden el consultorio dental, la socia también trabaja en una tienda que vende productos naturales, la socia quiere mejorar el consultorio dental. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el consultorio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Bernardina is a member of the “Liderando Las Palmeras” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Bernardina is 34 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her dental office where she works together with her husband.  She also works in a store that sells natural products but would like to use this loan to supply her dental office.

Bernardina is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To supply her dental office

loans.name: Dukore Group

texts.en:
Alphonse is 32 years old and is married. Alphonse is the leader of a five-member group loan. Each member runs a different business. He is 32 years old and is married. His wife does not work.

Alphonse sells different kinds of clothes. The hours of his business are from six in the morning until six in the evening. This is his third successful year in his clothes selling business.

Alphonse and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses by purchasing a variety of clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es:
ZOILA ISABEL G. M..
La señora Zoila Isabel G. M. inicio su negocio desde hace 20 años, solicita un refinanciamiento de crédito, para volver a invertir en la compra de cerdos para la temporada navideña que hay muchas personas que preparan comidas navideñas como por ejemplo  tamales  de cerdo, piernas de cerdo muchos más, como ya tiene de nuevo pedidos carne  que muchas señoras venden para el tiempo navideño  y también necesita el crédito para la compra de algunos adornos navideños para poder vender en su casa, y así mismo poder generar más ganancia. Su meta ahora es poder compra mas cerdos para poder engórdalos y poder venderlos en  la Feria Patronal del Pueblo donde vive, y así mismo no invertir mucho en compra de la misma.
texts.en: Zoila Isabel G. M. has been in her business for 20 years.  She is requesting a loan renewal so that she can invest in buying pigs for the Christmas period.  She needs this investment as there are a lot of people who are preparing Christmas meals such as, for example, pork tamales, legs of pork, etc.  She already has orders for meat that a lot of women sell during the Christmas period.  She also needs the loan to buy some Christmas decorations that she can sell in her home and thereby make more profits.  Her goal right now is to be able to buy more pigs so that she can fatten them and then sell them in the local town market.

loans.use: To buy pigs and Christmas decorations

loans.name: Nancy Estamilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Estamilda; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de snack cafetería, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9.00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de snack cafetería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar implementos para el snack. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy Estamilda is a member of the “Liderando Las Palmeras” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Nancy Estamilda is 46 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her snack bar / café business.  She works from 8.00am to 9.00pm.  Through this business she is getting her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand and improve her snack bar / café business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her snack bar.

Nancy Estamilda is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her snack bar

loans.name: Claudio Miguel

texts.es: El señor Claudio dedicado al servicio de taxi desde muy temprano inicia su trabajo recorriendo todo el radio periurbano durante toda la jornada, este trabajo lo realiza para otorgar una mejor vida a sus pequeños hijos y a su querida esposa con la que usualmente trabajan por las noches, ella le hace  compañía para mayor seguridad del conductor, ahora desean el crédito para la compra de un motor nuevo que necesita su vehículo, ya que el motor esta presentando fallas y no permite realizar un buen trabajo, y quiere su auto en buen estado ya que estas fiestas de fin de año tendrá mucha clientela, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Claudio works as a taxi driver.  He starts work very early in the morning and works the whole peri-urban area throughout the whole day.  He is doing this work to provide his small children and his beloved wife with a better life.

Claudio's wife usually works with him at night.  She keeps him company and provides him with more safety as a driver.  He would like this loan to buy a new engine for his vehicle as his current one isn't working properly and doesn't allow him to do his work well.  He would like his car to be in a good state of repair since he will have a lot of customers in this end-of-year festive period.  Claudio is a responsible and very hard-working person.  He is very grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his vehicle

loans.name: Jeremie

texts.en:
Jeremie is 36 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 4. This is his eighth successful month running a restaurant and he is open from 5 am until 10 pm every day.

Jeremie sells various foodstuffs in his restaurant such as potatoes, rice, cassava flour, bread, maize flour, bread, fish, beef, etc.

Jeremie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more foodstuffs for his restaurant and more supplies such as plates, spoons, etc.  With this loan, Jeremie believes he will gain more profit, which he will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more food and supplies for restaurant

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (relatives).  

Faith has a business selling second hand clothing.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Faith sells her products at the market by means of retail.

Faith   has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.   She also generates additional income through supplying fruits and vegetables to nearby supermarkets every morning.

The main business challenges for Faith include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second hand clothes herself and also to build rental rooms.   

Faith lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosalina es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, se dedica a la elaboración de postres como ser gelatinas, flanes, y tortas de yogurt desde hace dos años y medio. Tiene tres hijos y dos de ellos en edad escolar. Ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la zona de villa Liitoral que esta ubicada a treinta minutos del centro de la cuidad. Cada día rosa se despierta muy temprano por las mañanas y sale a vender los postres a las tiendas y colegios de las zonas cercanas. La madre de Rosalina   la Sra. Alina, es quien ayuda en la preparación de los postres y las tortas y además tiene buen conocimiento de la preparación de masitas como ser empanadas y rollos de queso. Rosa junto a su madre quieren ampliar su negocio e incrementar su producción con la venta de masitas y es por lo que quieren comprar un horno de 6 latas y una maquina sobadora de masa.
texts.en:
Rosalina is very hard-working young person.  She makes desserts such as jellies (jell-o), flans and yogurt cakes.  She has been doing this for two and a half years.  Rosalina has three children, two of whom are school age.  She lives with her husband and children in Villa Litoral district which is thirty minutes from the city center.

Every day, Rosalina gets up very early in the morning and goes out to sell her desserts to stores and schools in neighboring districts.  Rosalina's mother, Alina, helps her make her desserts and cakes and also has a good knowledge of how to prepare pastries such as empanadas and cheese rolls.  Together with her mother, Rosalina would like to expand the business and increase her production and sale of pastries.  For this reason, she would like to buy a 6 compartment oven and a kneading machine for dough.

loans.use: To buy an oven and a kneading machine for dough

loans.name: Manassé Plus Group

texts.en:
Bibi B. is the leader of a community bank named “Manassé Plus”, made up of 10 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Bibi sells shikwanges (a kind of bread made of manioc flour), which is Kinshasa’s main food. She also sells peanuts, cakes, handbags, and miscellaneous items.  She sells in a market located in the northeastern part of Kinshasa.  She has been in business since 1985. She has borrowed eight loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and has fully repaid them. 

With the next loan, Bibi will be able to meet her customer demand and generate additional profits. Her business makes US$50 of profit per week. One of Bibi’s strategies to keep her clients is that she tells them in advance about any change that can occur in business. Her ambition is to open a shikwanges facility in her area. 

Bibi is 53 years old, married, and has two children. All of them attend school.

loans.use: To increase inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Motih Mariana Awah

texts.en:
Motih Mariana A.  was born in 1960. She is married and blessed with five children. She shares four rooms with her five children in Nchulam, a quarter in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon.

Mariana has faced many difficulties in her life, ranging from ill-health, to the inability to meet her daily needs, to failure to attain quality education, to sickness in  her seedlings. Among other challenges, she also has had difficulties with inadequate capital to start up a business of her own. 

With this loan, she plans to buy a motorcycle which she will use for transportation. She also thinks her business will succeed because in the area where she resides, there are no motor-able roads, but motorcycles can access the area smoothly with little or no stress. She will also use it to bring farm products from the interior to the markets. She will also regularly undertake contracts to transport farm products to homes within her locality. Her activities will help her community because they will be able to transport their farm produce with relative ease from farm to market, and transport supplies from market to farm.

She will use a fraction of her profit to carry out maintenance and fuel the motorcycle. She will use the remaining proceeds to upgrade her family standard of living and pay for her children's education. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up, and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Abiyunze (Alexie) Group

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 26 years old and is married. He is the president of a group called “Abiyunze” and is the last person on the right in the picture above. This group is commonly known to be in the business of selling clothes.  Jean Claude has been in this business for about four years and he currently employs one person.  His business is open from 8am until 8pm every day of the week.

Jean Claude has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to upgrade his business and help his family.  Jean Claude plans to use any profits to reinvest in his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Estrellas De Tarapaca Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ESTRELLAS DE TARAPACA” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta la señora Evangelina, tesorera la señora Zenobia y secretaria de actas la señora Ruth. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan tienen relación con el comercio, servicio y también producción.
En el caso de la presidenta, señora  Evangelina tiene un hogar conformado por su esposo y 4 hijos.  El negocio de la señora Evangelina fue la venta de repuestos de auto y venta de fierro en un puesto,  con la venta de su puesto de venta, ahora ella ha decidido iniciar un nuevo negocio.  Comprará con su crédito un máquina de tejer y lana,  para producir  tejidos de diferentes tipos, chompas y otros y venderá por docena en la Ceja de El Alto.
Le colabora en su trabajo su esposo.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The 'Estrellas de Tarapaca' (Stars of Tarapaca) community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, in the Senkata regional office.  The group has eight members.  The board consists of the president, Evangelina, the treasurer, Zenobia, and the secretary, Ruth.  The women's businesses are in commerce, services and also production.

The bank's president, Evangelina, lives with her husband and four children.  Her business was selling spare parts for cars and iron from a stall.  However, she sold her stall and has decided to set up a new business.  She will use her loan to buy a knitting machine and wool so that she can knit sweaters and other items and sell them by the dozen in La Ceja de El Alto.  Evangelina's husband helps her with her work.

When we asked Evangelina what she liked about Pro Mujer she that she likes being able to save.

loans.use: To buy a knitting machine and wool

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  Catherine has a business selling green bananas.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. 

Catherine sells her products at the market by means of retail. Catherine has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of green bananas. 

The main business challenges for Catherine include transportation, thieves, and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to own a delivery van.  

Catherine lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy green bananas to sell

loans.name: Alma Pablo

texts.es: Alma Pablo Q.: tiene 25 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos menores de edad ellos estudian su nivel primario vive con su esposo y se dedica a la venta de sueteres y trajesitos para bebe en su tiempo libre ella elavora güipiles tipicos y fajas, y los vende en diferentes tiendas de su comunidad ella le da gracias a Dios por el credito que a ella le dieron en kiva por medio de fape poque le a ayudado en mucho en su negocio ahora ella solicita un credito mas a kiva para envertir mas en ropa. Como sueteres,trajes para bebe, y elavoracion de güipiles.
texts.en:
Alma Pablo Q. is 25 years old.  She is married and has 3 dependent children who are in elementary school.  She lives with her husband and sells sweaters and baby outfits.  In her spare time she makes 'guipiles' (traditional blouses) and sashes.  She sells these in different stores in her community.

Alma thanks God for the last loan that Kiva gave her through Fape because it helped her a lot in her business.  Now she is requesting a new Kiva loan to invest in buying more clothes such as sweaters and baby outfits and making her 'guipiles'.

loans.use: To buy clothes such as sweaters and baby outfits.  To make 'guipiles' (traditional blouses)

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario Vive en alquiler, Es separado de su esposa tiene 5 hijos, el vive con la hija menor quien le ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Don mario trabaja como contratista hace 30 años le va muy bien ya que tiene contratos con arquitectos y siempre tiene trabajoy es por eso que se dirigio a nuestra institucion ya que necesita el dinero para terminar de construir su cuarto que sera destinado para la compra de material de construccion y herramientas ya que el mismo realizara la construccion, El cliente quedo muy satisfecho y a la vez agradecido por la confianza que se deposito en el  y la facilidad que se le otorgo el credito, es un apersona muy amable siempre con una sonrisa en el rostro a pesar de las adversidades.
texts.en:
Mario lives in a rented house.  He is separated from his wife and has 5 children.  He lives with his youngest daughter who helps him with his household expenses.  Mario has been working as a contractor for 30 years and his business is going very well since he has contracts with architects and he always has work.

Mario is approaching our institution because he needs money to finish building a room in his house.  The money will be used to buy building materials and tools since he will do the work himself.  Mario is very satisfied and grateful for the trust which has been placed in him and the ease with which he achieved his loan.  He is a very kind person who always has a smile on his face in spite of life's adversities.

loans.use: To buy building materials and tools

loans.name: Monzoto Plus Group

texts.en:
Monzoto Plus is a group of 7 owners of small businesses, chaired by Baruani.  Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Baruani, single, aged 40, operates a general store while taking care of one younger brother. He began his business in 1998. Baruani has used four Hope loans (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) to finance the expanding of his inventory. Due to the high demand in his community, he intends with the next loan to buy more goods for resale in order to meet client demands and generate additional profit. This will help him to achieve his plans to grow the business.  His business brings in a profit of US$110 per week. Baruani’s ambition is to expand his store. He is engaged.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hostensia

texts.en:
Hostensia S. is a single mother with five children. Faced with the challenges of being a single mother, she finds it difficult to take care of her children,  especially sponsoring their education. In addition she sustained a serious accident which had put her in abject poverty. 

Faced with her low level of education she could not secure a good job for herself, thus she embarked on farming.  Unfortunately for her, she did not knows what farming methods to use to improve on her output.  Becoming a member of GHAPE, she was fortunate to have acquired some farming knowledge which has helped her improve on her farming techniques.

She has proven successful with her previous loans, which she had repaid with the progress she made buying and selling shoes. Given a new loan, she plans to invest it in farming and the selling of shoes.

Her activities will help her community in that she will be able to supply the market with basic foodstuffs.  She will also provide the community with footware. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farming, and shoes to resell

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.en:
Yamileth is a 42-year-old mother of 2 who lives with her husband and 2 children in San Jose, in the central valley of Costa Rica. Yamileth is involved with various productive activities which permit her to provide for her family. Her main occupation is a transportation service for school children. 

Monday to Friday from 5:30 AM to 4:00 PM, Yamileth collects and drops off children in a mini school bus (more like a van) from 3 different schools. As a side job, she carries various types of merchandise in her van, which she sells to various clients she meets throughout the day.  Teachers, parents, and acquaintances purchase items such as tennis shoes, perfumes, and electronic equipment from Yamileth. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in additional merchandise (perfumes, tennis shoes, and others) in order to sell during the holiday season. In general, Yamileth prefers not to use loans, only when necessary. She says a main obstacle in her life is the high cost of maintaining her van.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Twizamure Group

texts.en:
Gerardine is 27 years old, and is married with four children who are between two and five years old.  She is the presidente of a group called “Twizamure” is a third person in the left hand  and she owns a beauty salon. She has been in this business for about four years. She works from 7 in the morning every day of the week and she currently employs six people. 

Gerardine and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for her salon and upgrade her facilities. With the use of this loan, Gerardine hopes to earn more profit and reinvest it back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase salon products and improve facilities

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan; El socio es casado y tiene  4 hijos el socio es maestro constructor y también ayuda a su esposa en su negocio, el socio los domingos ayuda a su económica familiar con prestar el servicio de tricitaxi, el tiene un triciclo armado con una moto y lleva pasajeros y también carga pesada, el socio es una persona muy optimista y colaborador aquí lo vemos llevando hasta la puerta de la casa de su pasajera el costal de papas que trajo en el trici taxi; el socio en esta ocasión desea el crédito  para apoyar en el negocio a su esposa ella tiene un stand de venta de granos, el invertirá en la compra de productos para la siguiente temporada. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos. 

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juan belongs to the “Sr. de Tayancani” community bank which is located in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Juan is married and has four children.  He is a master builder and also helps his wife in her business.  Every Sunday he helps his family's finances by providing a 'tricitaxi' service (he has a motorbike with a cabin in back for carrying passengers and heavy cargo).  Juan is a very optimistic and helpful person.  Here we see him carrying a sack of potatoes which he has transported in his 'tricitaxi' to his passenger's house.

On this occasion, Juan would like to take a loan to support his wife's business.  She has a stall from which she sells grains.  He will invest in buying products for the coming season.  He is requesting this loan to buy grains.

Juan is grateful for his loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To invest in buying grains

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.fr:
Niveau universitaire, âgé de 29ans célibataire avec 1 enfant, ce  jeune homme a développé l’activité de vente des cartes prépayées et cabine téléphonique.
Il a commencé en 2006 avec un capital de 90.000f, après le premier prêt, il a renforcé avec l’achat des cartes Sim et cartes téléphoniques.

Ses ventes sont passées de 50.000f à75.000f jour. Le deuxième prêt va   lui permettre de s’abonner  aux différents réseaux nationaux tels que MTN, AIRTEL, WARID, AZUR, CONGO TELECOM.
Il  compte ouvrir une cabine plus moderne avec papeteries  et ventes des articles scolaires.
 Très ambitieux, il veut prendre soin de sa famille en améliorant leurs  conditions.
texts.en:
This single man with a university degree is 29 years old and has one child.  He has developed a business selling prepaid cards from his telephone kiosk.  He began in 2006 with a working capital of 90,000 francs.  After getting a first loan, he expanded with the purchase of SIM and phone cards.
His sales increased from 50,000 to 75,000 francs per day. The second loan will enable him to subscribe to the different national networks such as MTN, AIRTEL, WARID, AZUR, and CONGO TELECOM.  He plans to open a more modern kiosk with stationary and school supplies for sale.  He is a very ambitious man who wants to take care of his family while improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable telephone cards

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy milk, touchlights, matches, sardines, sugar, soap, etc. to resell

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: El Sr. Juan de Dios casado con 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposa la Sra. Daniela,  vive en Limones a una comunidad a 20 km de El Torno hacia el oeste , se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, arroz, maní también saca madera para las carpinterías para hacer muebles. Pero viendo que hay arboles que sola sirve para hacer carbón, es una persona muy trabajadora siempre dedicándose a lo que se puede cuando no es época de siembra, su esposa le ayuda en la comercialización de sus productos, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una Motosierra ya que esta le facilitara en trabajo, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan de Dios is married with three school-aged children. His wife is called Sra. Daniela. He lives in Limones, a community 20km to the west of El Torno.

Juan earns his living by growing maize, rice, and peanuts. He also cuts wood for carpenters who use it to make furniture (some trees are only used to make charcoal).

He is a hardworking person always busying himself with other jobs when there is little to do in his fields. His wife helps him sell the produce. Juan plans to use the loan to buy a chainsaw as this would help him in his work. He is very grateful to the institution for the assistance it provides.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old.  He is married with six children between the ages 3 and 13 years old, and has two adopted orphans.

Emmanuel has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He gets up at 6 am and works until 11 pm everyday to transport people to their work places. He needs to pay $6 per day to the owner of the motorbike in order to use it.

Emmanuel has requested a loan worth 500,000 Rwf to buy his own motorbike taxi.  His goal is to send all his children to school, build a house for the family, and save for his future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Tabrey

texts.en:
Tabrey B. is married to a polygamist.  They are blessed with six children, all are going to school.  The fact that she was unable to acquire a basic education because she did not go to school has made life very difficult for her .  She was unable to assist her husband to cater for the family. Worst of all is the fact that her children are unable to study freely because of the fees.  They are also unable to have three square meals a day. 

With this loan she plans to buy drugs, chemicals, and planting seeds. She knows her business is going to succeed because she had acquired some basic trainings in finance management and in how to choose a good business from GHAPE.  

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her husband who became a GHAPE member in 2001. Since then she has successfully borrowed and repaid loans seven times. The profit from these loans helped her pay her children school fees and provide some basic needs like food for the family.
	

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase drugs, chemicals, and planting seeds

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; La socia tiene 4 hijos, la socia es casada, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de granos la socia vende todo tipo de granos, de vez en cuando su esposo la ayuda en el traslado en su trici taxi y la acomodación de su stand, la socia vende desde, habas, frejoles, pallares, lentejas, papas, secas, moraya, chuño, maíz de variedades (morado, amarillo, blancos, chulpis), la socia desea el crédito para comprar granos y de este modo abastecer su negocio de productos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Paulina is a member of the Sr. de Tayancani Community Bank which is located in the district of Ocongate, in Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cusco.

Paulina is married and has four children. To earn a living she buys and sells all kinds of grains. Sometimes her husband helps her transport them in his motocycle taxi and then helps her set up her stand. She sells broad beans, beans, butter beans, lentils, potatoes, dried potatoes, chuño, and various types of corn (purple, yellow, white, chulpis). Paulina is seeking a loan to buy more grains and thus increase the stock she has available. 

She is grateful for the loan which is so valuable to her and promises to make the repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy more grains and increase her stock

loans.name: Abiyunze Group

texts.en:
Venantie is 33 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 10 and 12.  She is the representative of a group which is called Abiyunze in the local language. She is the second person from the right in the photo above.

Venantie owns a small shop which sells green bananas.  She has five years of experience in this business. She employs one person in her business as a helper. Her store is open from 7.30 in the morning and closes at 6 in the evening, every day.

Venantie and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses for the purpose of earning more profits. With the profits, they expect to improve their businesses. Venantie, particularly, needs a fridge which will allow her to create a new business selling cold soft drinks. She also hopes to be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy fridge to sell soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy charcoal, palm oil, seasoning, salt, pepper, etc. to resell

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia L. G.: se dedica a la venta de alimnetos y compra de pollos ella vende en el mercado de forma ambulante ella solicita este credito para compra de productos comestibles, y compra de pollos, ya que en esta epoca es cuando mas ella vende su producto, y asi poder agrandar en poco mas su venta y poder tener un lugar mas estable para vender le da gracias a Dios por darle la oportunidad que fape le ayude con el prestamo solicitado. su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio tener mas productos que ofrecerle a su clientes.
texts.en: Marta Alicia L. G. sells food and also buys chickens which she sells in the market as a street trader.  She is requesting a loan to buy food products and chickens since this is the time of year when she sells a lot of her products.  In this way, she will be able to increase her sales a little and have a more stable place from which to sell.  She thanks God for giving her the opportunity to receive a loan from Fape.  Her dream is to expand her business some more and have more products to offer her customers.

loans.use: To buy food products and chicken

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lida; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de snack cafetería, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9.00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de snack cafetería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar implementos para el snack.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lida is a member of the 'Liderando Las Palmeras' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Lida is 46 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her snack bar / café business.  She works from 8.00am to 9.00pm.  Through her business, Lida is managing to get her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand and improve her snack bar / café business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her snack bar.

Lida is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her snack bar

loans.name: Nanki

texts.en:
Nanki R. was born in 1970. She is married and the couple is blessed with three children, all under 15 years old.  She lives in a small house with three rooms with her family on Foncha Street, in a quarter in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon.

R. has faced some challenges in life: the inability to meet the basic necessities of her family -- like clothing, food, and transportation, the inability to educate herself and her children, and difficulties in raising capital to start up a small business.   

To sustain herself and her family, she plans to invest this loan into a phone booth business.  With this loan she is going to buy two phones and transfer the credit and related bonus in the two phones which she sells to her customers. She believes the business will succeed because the previous loan she took was repaid by the income raised from an old phone of hers.  Therefore, she concludes that she is sure the business will succeed. She is certain that this business will succeed because the services she renders are in high demand in the market. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford food ingredients.

R. will plough part of the profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children’s school fees and cater for the family. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy two phones and phone credits for business

loans.name: Thimothe

texts.fr:
Marié  père de 4 enfants qui sont encore sur le banc de l’école, monsieur Timothée s’est lancé dans la vente en gros du pétrole et des cartes prépayées.
 Il vendait 20000f par jour avant le premier prêt qui lui a permis de renforcé son activité, il avait acheté : 
2000 litres  de pétrole, les cartes MTN et ZAIN et  un abonnement a CONGO TELECOM  cela lui a permis de générer   plus revenus pour épargner et rembourser le prêt sans problèmes.

Avec le prochain prêt il va continuer avec le même élan en achetant encore 3000l de pétrole lampant  et agrandir son entreprise en achetant les cartes de recharges de différents réseaux de télécommunication .
L’avenir de ses enfants lui tient à cœur , il se bat à les soutenir dans leurs différents option car il y a un qui veut devenir prêtre.
Très rigoureux en gestion, monsieur Timothée veut prospérer au travers de notre organisme.
texts.en:
Mr. Thimothe is a married father of four children who still attend school. He is a wholesaler of kerosene and prepaid telephone cards.

His daily revenue amounted to 20,000F prior to his first loan, which allowed him to strengthen his activity. He bought 2000 liters of kerosene, MTN and ZAIN cards, and a subscription to CONGO TELECOM. This enabled him to generate more income, boost his savings, and repay the loan without problems.

With the next loan, he plans to keep the momentum by adding 3000 liters of kerosene to his stock, and expand his business by purchasing telephone recharge cards from various telecommunication  networks.

He takes his children’s future to heart, striving to support them in their various options. One of them wishes to become a priest.

A rigorous manager, Mr. Thimothe hopes to prosper through our organization.

loans.use: Buying recharge cards and a small kerosene station

loans.name: Maria Mariana

texts.es: María Mariana López A. tiene sus hijos pequeños están en edad escolar trabaja todo los días vendiendo en su local que es propio vende productos de comestibles, aparte de eso en su casa tiene una crianza de pollos para engorde ella agradece a Fape por la ayuda brindada solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos de comestibles y también con la ampliación de su local y asi poder ofrecer mas mercadería  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Mariana López A. has young, school-age children.  She works every day selling food products from her own premises.  She also has a chicken raising business in her home where she fattens chickens.

She is grateful to Fape for the support she has received and is requesting this loan to buy food products and also to expand her premises.  In this way, she will be able to offer more merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Olivier Fabrice

texts.fr:
OLIVIER FABRICE B.


Coiffeur homme, âgé de 29ans célibataire 2 enfants en bas âges qui a commencé avec cette activité depuis 2003.

Son but était après le premier prêt de renforcer  son activité en achetant  les accessoires de coiffures tels que : 2 tondeuses électriques, 1 paquet des peignes, des paires de ciseaux, des lames de rasoirs et des produits cosmétiques.

Pour le prochain prêt, il va améliorer son lieu d’activité et veut  ouvrir un autre salon  pour faire générer plus de revenus.

Pour garantir les conditions de vie de sa famille, il veut construire une maison pour eux.
texts.en: Olivier Fabrice B. is 29-years old, unmarried with 2 young children, and a barber who started his business in 2003.  His goal after the first loan was to strengthen his business by buying hair salon accessories such as 2 electric clippers, 1 package of combs, a few pairs of scissors, razor blades and cosmetics.  For the next loan, he is going to improve his place of business and wants to open another hair salon to earn more income.  To ensure the living conditions of his family, he wants to build a house for them.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 electric clippers, razors, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Osman Guillermo

texts.es: Osman tiene 3 hijos él es un padre luchador y responsable. Su actividad es una pulpería, el tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, porque ha sido  ingreso necesario para su hogar. El dio inicio a su negocio hace 7 años, pues siempre le ha gustado sacar adelante a su familia. Tiene cierta experiencia con los créditos y con su negocio, pues ha sido muy gratificante para el obtener un medio de vida. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y grano básicos.
texts.en:
Osman has three children and is a hardworking and responsible father. His business is a general store. His has been working with Fundación León for some time, as he has needed funds for his home. 

Osman started his business seven years ago, as he has always wanted to help his family get ahead. He has significant experience with business loans and with business, and it has been very gratifying to make a living this way.

This loan will be used to buy cookies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, and basic staples for the store.

loans.use: Cookies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, and basic staples for general store.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana Del Carmen  vive en su casa que es propia juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 6 años que tiene este negocio como es la venta de ropa en general. Se dedico a vender mercadería en general, ya que es una mujer muy emprendedora  y cuando tuvo sus hijos vio una buena oportunidad para establecer este negocio, que tantos logros le ha otorgado. Es el quinto crédito y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Ana tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales al por mayor pues no logra abastecer a sus clientes que le piden mayor variedad. Ya que se acerca una buena temporada y quiere aprovecharlo.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own home. She strives every day to get ahead. For the past 6 years she has been selling clothes. A very entrepreneurial woman, she works selling general merchandise. When she had her children she saw a good opportunity to establish her business, which has led her to many accomplishments. 

This is Ana’s fifth loan and she commits to making timely payments; she does not want to displease the lenders that made it possible for her to continue working to get ahead. Ana plans to invest the loan in the bulk purchase of merchandise so that she can offer her customers more variety. A good sales season is approaching and she would like to take advantage of this period.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marcos Tomas

texts.es: Marcos Tomas tiene 37 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de chatarra. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este medio de vida. Este hombre hábil y emprendedor; trabajaba en esta labor que le genera  dinero. Su oficio lo inicio desde hace 2 años. Hoy posee su propio negocio, siendo sus principales fuente de ingresos los que gracias a su dedicación y creatividad, le generan ganancias necesarias para su hogar. Ahora desea invertir en la compra de chatarra que será para su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcos Tomas is 37 years old and has a business buying and selling scrap. He has operated this business for more than two years. He is an able and enterprising man who now has his own business. Thanks to his dedication and creativity, the business is now his main source of income, covering the needs of his household.

This loan will be used to invest in scrap for the business.

loans.use: Buy scrap for scrap business.

loans.name: Pablo Evenor

texts.es: Pablo Evenor tiene 22 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de bolsas plásticas. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar. Quien inicio este negocio fue su Mama ya que anteriormente era él quien se hacía cargo de esta actividad con el paso del tiempo Pablo fue quien se hizo cargo. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de baldes, vasos, pajillas, bolsas entre otras. Sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Pablo Evenor is 22 years old and his activity has been buying and selling plastic bags.  For more than 4 years he has had this business and Pablo is always looking for ways to generate more income for his household.  Pablo's mother started the business and with the passage of time, he took charge of the enterprise.  

His motive for this financing is to purchase pails, glasses, straw hats, and plastic bags, among other items.  His dream is to increase his working capital.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE STRAW HATS, GLASSES, PAILS, AND PLASTIC BAGS TO SELL

loans.name: Elma Beatriz

texts.es: Elma Beatriz S. L.: trabaja todos los dias Vendiendo en su local carne de res en su carniceria todo los dias menos sabado, tiene que aprovechar en si las fetibidades para vender aparte de eso vende chorizos, y longanizas y pollo destazado, cuenta con el apollo de su familia ya que ella se quedo viuda oproximadamente hace dos años ella lucha por sus hijos todos los dias para llegar a su negocio, ella solicita el credito para comprar un molino de carne y compra de mas bariedad de carne para su carniceria, agradece a fape por la ayuda brindada sueña con agrandar mas su negocio y asi ahorrar un poco mas para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elma Beatriz works every day except Saturday selling beef in her butcher stall.  She tries to take advantage of festival days.  She also sells sausage (chorrizo and longaniza) and cut-up chicken.  Elma can count on the help of her family, since she has been widowed for approximately 2 years.  She comes to her business daily to struggle for her children.

Elma is soliciting a loan to buy a meat grinder and to purchase a greater variety of meat for her butcher shop.  She is grateful to FAPE for offering help and she dreams of enlarging her business and, thus, saving a little bit more to advance her children.

loans.use: TO BUY A MEAT GRINDER AND SELL MEAT

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria de 43 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los diferentes productos que ofrece. Este es el segundo crédito ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en: Maria is 43 years old and is a cheerful, hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their 2 young children to whom they wish to give the best quality of life.  She runs a small grocery store and what she likes most about her job is advising her customers on the different products that she offers.  This is her second loan.  She was very punctual with her payments and hopes to do the same this time.  She will use the loan to purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents and basic grains.

loans.use: To purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents and basic grains

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio Pérez Madrigal, tiene la edad de 42 años, está en unión Libre y tiene 2 hijos que es su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar los alimentos para el mantenimiento de unos animales de cría y mantenerlos un tiempo más, mientras el precio de la venta del ganado suba un poco más. El siempre se ha dedicado a  esta actividad y le ido muy bien, por lo cual él quiere aguantar la venta de sus animales pues actualmente el precio del ganado esta muy mal pagado. También él piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y pretende generar un poquito más de ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida Familiar.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio Pérez Madrigal is 42 years old and lives with his common-law partner.  He has 2 children that are his main priority.  He wants to buy feed for the animals that he raises.  He would like to keep them a bit longer while cattle prices increase a little more because currently, livestock prices are very low.  He has always done this for a living and it has gone well for him.   He is also thinking of his children's future and wants to generate a bit more income to provide a better quality of life for his family. 

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had any previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with easy terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his livestock

loans.name: Magalie

texts.fr:
Marié, âgée de 27ans mère de 2enfants, Magalie est coiffeuse et propriétaire d’un salon  pour femme.
Elle a gérer son premier prêt avec succès, elle s’était fixée un but, celui de remonter l’activité qu’elle a démarré en 2004.
Le premier prêt  lui a permis d’acheter, des défrisants, des démêlants, des bigoudis des gèles coiffants, des shampooings, des filets…
Sa stratégie était   de faire du bon travail avec des prix promotionnels.
Avec le nouveau crédit, elle va améliorer son salon de coiffure et acheter les produits de  gammes cosmétiques de marques : revlon, olive, flashions faire, skin success et  des bidons 5litres (démêlant, shampoing) , 2gros pots de (dé frisants, gèle coiffants, pommade et crème nourrissant ,huile pour bain) , des mèches et tissages de différente qualités.
Pragmatique, elle aime son travail et veut devenir coiffeuse professionnelle et a la longue ouvrir une ecole pour jeune fille mère
texts.en:
Magalie is married and the mother of two children. She is a hairdresser and owns a woman’s salon.

She has successfully managed her first loan. She had a goal; to revive the business she started in 2004. The first loan enabled her to buy hair straightener, conditioner, hair curler, hair gel, shampoo, and hairnets… Her strategy was to do a good job at special prices.

With the new loan she will improve her hairdressing salon and buy brand name cosmetic products: Revlon, Olive, Fashion Fair, Skin Success. She will buy 5-liter drums (conditioner, shampoo), 2 large tubs of straightener, hair gel, pomade, nourishing lotion and bath oil, some hair extensions and hair weaves of various quality.

She is pragmatic; she loves her work and would like to become a professional hairdresser. In the long run she would like to open a school for young single mothers.

loans.use: Achat produits cosmetiques,demelants, creme pour corps, visage, produits de manicure et pedicure

loans.name: Martha Yojendy

texts.es:
La Joven G. de 22 años de edad es ama de casa vive con su hijo menor de edad en el municipio de Tecolostote recibe remesas de su esposo Celestino Antonio Davila  Solano que vive fuera del Pais, ella es una persona muy responsable a pesar de ser joven piensa en su hijo por el cual se esfuerza y lucha a diario en mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

por lo que  solicita el apoyo de Kiva con su primer credito y de esta manera poder ponerle piso y arreglar paredes de su casa para su mayor comodidad.  

Su sueño es que su hijo sea un buen profesional.
texts.en: Ms. G. is a 22 year old young woman who is a housewife.  She lives with her young son in the town of Tecolostote and receives remittances from her husband Celestino Antonio Davila Solano who lives outside the country.  She is a very responsible person in spite of being young and strives daily to improve living conditions for her son. For this reason she is requesting her first loan from Kiva.  She will use the money to install a floor and to fix the walls in her house to make it more comfortable.  Her dream is for her son to become a professional.

loans.use: To install a floor and fix the walls in her house

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir M. is a married, 54-year-old man. He lives in the village of Sarkhanli in the region of Imishli. Sabir has two sons and one daughter. He started his cattle-breeding business in 2004 with the help of his wife. 

This is the first loan Sabir received from Aqroinvest and KİVA. He plans to use this loan of 2000 AZN to purchase one cow and build a stable for the three cows he now owns. He sells dairy and meat produced in his cattle-breeding business in the Imishli bazaar. This is his only source of income. 

Sabir is a hard-working and honest man. After repaying this loan Sabir plans to expand his business by taking out another loan and buying eight more cows.

loans.use: to buy one cow and to build a stable

loans.name: Presentacion Jesus

texts.es: Presentación Jesús tiene 46 años. Su actividad económica es el destace y la venta de cerdo. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues han sido muy provechosos. El inicio hace más de siete años, ya que su Mama tenía problemas de salud fue así con el paso del tiempo que él se hizo cargo del negocio. La meta que tiene para su negocio es seguir adelante y mejorar la calidad de sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos.
texts.en: Presentación Jesús is 46 years old.  His business is slaughtering pigs and selling their meat.  This is not the first time that he has had a loan and the previous ones have been very beneficial to him.  He started this business more than seven years ago because his mom had health problems.  Over time, he took over the business.  His goal for his business is to keep going and improve the quality of his products.  He is requesting this loan to buy pigs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sabit

texts.en: Sabit M. is a single 28-year-old man who owns a little food-stuffs store in the city of Imishli. He started his business in 2008 and his brother helps him in it. He now sells a variety of goods. This is the Sabit’s first loan from Aqroinvest and KIVA. He used the 1000 AZN loan to purchase inventory for his store. After repaying this loan, Sabit plans to expand his business by opening another store with the help of another loan.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his store

loans.name: Natividad Del Jesus

texts.es:
Natividad de 35 años, ha trabajado como costurera muchos años para poder mantener a sus hijos y poder ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su primera costura fue cuando empezó a trabajar haciendo almohadas en un taller de costura pero como tenía que trabajar todo el día y su sueldo era muy bajo. Decidió con sus ahorros comprar una máquina de coser y promocionar sus costuras a sus vecinos y amigos.   

Viviendo con su esposo y dos hijos de 12 y 13 años ha convertido una parte de la casa en su taller de costura y confección. Se levanta a las 06h00am hacer los pedidos de ropa que tiene pendiente del día siguiente. Ella hace camisas, pantalones, blusas de hombres, mujeres o niños.

Para seguir operando con su máquina de coser ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas e hilos para su taller. En el futuro quiere tener su taller bien espacioso para darles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Natividad, age 35, has worked as a seamstress for several years in order to support her children and help her husband with the household expenses. Her first sewing job involved making pillows at a sewing workshop, but her she had to work all day and her salary was very low. With her savings, she decided to buy a sewing machine and sell her creations to neighbors and friends.

Natividad lives with her husband and two children, ages 12 and 13. She converted part of her house into a sewing and dressmaking shop. Natividad wakes up at 6am in order to complete the clothing orders that are due the following day. She makes women’s blouses, men’s and children’s shirts, and trousers.

In order to keep her sewing workshop in operation, Natividad wants to use this loan to buy fabrics and thread. In the future, she wants to have a spacious workshop so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Christine has a business selling charcoal.  She changed her business enterprise from a bakery to charcoal selling.  She has been in this business for two months, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Christine sells her products at the market by means of retail. Christine has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling firewood.

The main business challenges for Christine include seasonality and thieves.  Her goal/aspiration for her business is to start selling wholesale only. Christine lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zuniga Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Z. está conformado por Maria Estela y Rosa Idalia. Ambas se dedican a la misma actividad económica, por lo que no ha sido fácil ya que tiene bastante competencia, pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado salir adelante junto a su amiga Rosa se han unido para realizar este financiamiento que será para la compra de materia prima necesaria. El sueño de estas dos personas es salir adelante con sus negocios y ampliar cada día más su inventario.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Z.” consists of Maria Estela and Rosa Idalia. Both of them engage in the same type of business, but it has not been easy because there is plenty of competition. Over time they have been able to get ahead. Maria and her friend Rosa have joined together to apply for a loan in order to buy basic necessities.

Their dream is to succeed in their businesses and expand their inventory every day.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more inventory

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
