La socia es la Sra. Mariza; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurant que junto con su hermana sacan adelante este negocio, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar panetones para vender en el restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariza is a member of the Communal Bank “Liderando Las Palmeras” (Leading the Palms) which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Mariza divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling food. She has a restaurant that she has successfully managed with her sister. Mariza works from 9am until 6pm. She wants to expand and improve her restaurant business, so she is requesting a loan to buy panettones to sell in her restaurant.

Mariza is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase panettone (Christmas bread) to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil M. is a 34-year-old man living in Nurulu village, Imishli region. He is married and has two sons. Ismayil has been engaged in the cattle-breeding business for the last two years. He now has two cows and with the help of this 1000 AZN loan he purchased three more cows. Ismayil sells meat and dairy he produces at the Imishli central bazaar.  His wife helps him in his business. 

This is the first loan Ismayil has received from Aqroinvest and KIVA. After repaying this loan he plans to take out another loan to open a farm.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, es socia del Bancomunal Imperios, tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 12 y 7 años.
Faustina tiene una ferretería, aprendió de éste negocio de una amiga, junto un capital inicial de S/.300.00 y comenzó a vender en la calle en el Jr. Grau. Ahora tiene un local alquilado en Enace, hace un tiempo sufrió un robo, pero poco a poco se está recuperando.El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para surtir su ferretería.
A Faustina le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar, su sueño es comprarse un carro para poder distribuir sus materiales de construcción y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the Communal Bank “Imperios” (Empires). She is 38 years old, married, and has three children (ages 16, 12, and 7).

Faustina manages a hardware store. She learned about this business from a friend. With initial capital of 300 PEN, she began selling on the street in Jr. Grau. She is now in a rented location in Enace. On one occasion she was robbed, but she has been recovering little by little. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials to restock her hardware store.

Faustina enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she is able to save. Her dreams include buying a car so that she can deliver construction materials and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase materials, bricks, and cement to sell at her hardware store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima T. lives in the Katanga neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of an additional family member (brother). 

Prima has a beauty salon business.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Prima sells her products in a shop by means of retail.   Prima has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. 

The main business challenges for Prima include the ever increasing prices of cosmetics, and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon, and to buy a plot and build her own house.   

Prima lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, es socia del Bancomunal Imperio, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de 18, 16 y 4 años.
Faustina tiene una tienda de abarrotes.Decidió abrir un tienda de abarrotes, porque en el lugar donde vive no había tiendas, le va bien en su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, pollo, carne, huevo, aguas gaseosas, jabones, detergente.
Le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede acceder a los créditos y puede ahorrar, le enseñan y practican los valores. Su sueño es poder construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the Communal Bank “Imperio” (Empire). She is a single mother with three children (ages 18, 16, and 4).

Susana manages a grocery store. She decided to start this business because the area where she lives does not have any stores, and is doing well in this venture. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, chicken, meat, eggs, water, sodas, soap, and detergents.

Susana enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she is able to access loans and accumulate savings. She is also able to teach and practice the values. Her dreams include building a home and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. David; el tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ganadería, el se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, el cría las vacas en el distrito de Cotabambas,el tiene un pequeño terreno, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de ganados. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. David is a member of the Communal Bank “Ricchary Cusco” which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

He is 43 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. David divides his time between his daily activities and his ranching business. He buys and sells livestock. David raises cows in the district of Cotabambas where he has a small plot of land. He wants to improve his business of selling livestock and is requesting a loan to buy cattle.

David is grateful to those who have helped fulfill his dream and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, butter, beans, etc. to resell

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif F. is a married 52-year-old man who lives in Saatli region with his family. He has  two sons and two daughters. 

Akif started his own foodstuffs store in 2004. It is the main source of income for his family. This is his first loan from Aqroinvest and KIVA. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to stock the shelves of his store.

 He is grateful for the support provided to him because it allows him to grow his business. After Akif repays this loan he plans to take out another loan to expand his store to sell a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: La señora Blanca Estela tiene 61 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, como pantalones, camisas, vestidos entre otros, pues le gusta ofrecer una gran variedad de productos. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y ha sido una persona responsable. La señora Blanca utilizara el crédito para la compra de mercadería y así poder tener su negocio bien surtido para la época de navidad y así poder mejorar sus ventas. Las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, Blanca es una señora de edad y esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Estela is 61 years old and sells used clothing such as trousers, shirts, dresses, and other items. She enjoys offering a wide variety of products. Blanca has been working with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time and demonstrated that she is a responsible person.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise so that her business will be well-stocked for the Christmas season. This will help improve her sales. The profits she earns are needed to cover her household expenses. Blanca is an older woman and this business is her only source of income.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Judith Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariza; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa importada, la socia vende en forma independiente llevando a las diferentes instituciones y al público en general, por navidad ella venderá diferentes ropas americanas como pantalones, camisas, polos y chompas, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Judith is a member of the Communal Bank “Liderando Las Palmeras” (Leading the Palms) which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 30 years old and single. Judith divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling imported clothing. She sells as an independent merchant and offers her products to different institutions and to the general public. For Christmas she will sell different types of American clothing such as trousers, shirts, polo shirts, and sweaters. She has a store where she sells clothing and is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in bulk.

Judith is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del bancomunal Nacer, tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Justina se dedica a la venta de comida, aguas gaseosas y bebidas, trabaja desde que tiene 18 años, antes se dedicaba la venta de frutas y lo cambio por la venta de alimentos para estar más cerca de sus hijos, los sábados y domingos prepara las comidas típicas de la Región, como: Mondongo, Puca Picante y Adobo. Está contenta porque le va bien.
El prestamo que solicita lo invertirá para la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, verduras, cereales, papas, carnes, entre otros para la preparación de alimentos, compra de aguas gaseosas.
A justina le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque puede ahorrar y acceder a los créditos. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca más y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Communal Bank “Nacer” (To Be Born). She is 50 years old, married, and has four chidlren.

Justina sells food, water, sodas, and other beverages. She has been working since she was 18 years old. Justina previously sold fruit and then switched to selling meals so that she could be closer to her children. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells traditional regional dishes such as “mondongo” (vegetable and tripe soup), “puca picante” (a stew containing pork, potatoes, peanuts, and hot peppers), and “adobo”. She is pleased because her business is doing well.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as rice, sugar, vegetables, grain, potatoes, meat, and other ingredients for preparing meals. She will also buy water and sodas.

Justina enjoys her Communal Bank meetings because she is able to save and access loans. Her dreams include expanding her business even more and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase various ingredients, water, and sodas

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca K. lives in the Katanga neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  Rebecca has a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.

 Rebecca sells her products in a shop, retail. Rebecca has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Rebecca include ever increasing prices of cosmetics and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

 Rebecca lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Es una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy responsable. Pues siempre le ha gustado busca la manera de sacar a su familia adelante. el motivo de su crédito es para la compra de sabanas, adornos, ropa en general, perfumes entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora has a business selling general merchandise. She has been this business for more than three years and has been working with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time. Maria is an enterprising woman who has always demonstrated that she is a very responsible woman. She is always looking for ways for her family to get ahead.

The reason for this loan is to buy bed sheets, decorations, clothing, perfumes, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara por la mañanas desayunos y ceviches (es un plato a base de pescado) y en las noches prepara salchipapas (es un plato a base de salchichas fritas y papas fritas),la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el pL. establecido.
texts.en:
Dolores belongs to the “Liderando las Palmeras” Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and  department of Cusco.

Dolores  is 55 years old, single, and has 6 children.  She alternates her daily activities according to her restaurant business.  Mornings, she prepares breakfasts and ceviches (a fish plate), and at night she prepares salchipapas (a plate based on fried sausages and fried potatoes).  Dolores works from 9:00am until 11:00pm.  She wants to improve her restaurant business.  Dolores is requesting a loan to expand the restaurant.

Dolores is grateful to those who form a part of her dream by this means, and she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO EXPAND HER RESTAURANT

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Nacer, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos.
Margarita se dedica a la confección de faldas, fustes, inaguas. Se dedica a la confección desde muy joven, comenzó confeccionándose ella misma sus prendas de las faldas de su mama, desataba las costuras y las adecuaba a su gusto, poco a poco fue comprando sus cosas necesarias para confeccionar, ahora los trabajos que hace los distribuye en los puestos de mercado y a atiende los contratos que le hacen. El prestamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, blondas.
A Margarita le gusta las reuniones de sy Banco comunal porque le dan préstamos y puede ahorrar, cuando se reúne con sus compañeras de banco aprenden mucho de las capacitaciones que reciben de su promotora.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Margarita, 47, is a member of the “Nacer” (To Be Born) communal bank.  She has two children.  

Margarita manufactures skirts, underskirts, traditional blouses.  She has been a dressmaker since very young; she started out making her own clothes out of her mother’s skirts.  She’d undo the stitches and remake them to her liking.  She gradually bought the dressmaking supplies she needed.  Now, she sells her items in stands in the market and fills orders she gets.  The loan will be used to buy fabric, thread and lace trim.

Margarita enjoys the meetings of her communal bank because she gets loans and can have savings.  When she gets together with her fellow bank members she learns a lot at the training sessions they get from their advisor.

Her dream is that her children become professionals and have businesses of their own.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and lace trim.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Esther; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cosméticos en forma independiente, ella lleva a diferentes instituciones o público en general, ella quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender los cosméticos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cosméticos al por mayor como lápiz labiales, perfumes y esmaltes para uñas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Esther, 37, is a member of the “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS” (Leading the Palm Trees) communal bank which is located in Cusco district that is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She’s married and has two children.  She combines her daily chores with an independent cosmetics sales business.  She sells to various institutions and to the general public.  She’d like to have a store where she can sell her cosmetics.  She’s asking for a loan to buy cosmetics like lipsticks, perfumes and nail polish at wholesale.

He thanks all those who share her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics like lip sticks, perfumes and nail polish at wholesale.

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es: Auxiliadora tiene 60 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Ella tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad .Trabaja todos los días desde la 6 mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, nos cuenta que su tienda la tiene ya hace 5 años y que empezó por la necesidad ya que tenía que sacar a sus hijos adelante a pesar de estar sola. Los productos de su tienda las compran en el mercado y también recibe en su local ciertos productos. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora, 60, is a grocer.  She has a store where she sells basic needs items.  She is open for business every day from 6am until 9pm.  She tells us that her store has been in operation for 5 years already and that it started because she had to support her children despite being alone.

She buys the items for her store in the market and also gets some of the items delivered to the store.

The reason for the loan is to buy stock items like sweets, beverages and basic grains among others.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Lurgia

texts.es:
Lurgia es socia del Banco Comunal Nacer, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos de 11 y 3 años.
Lurgia tiene una bodega, la cual decidio abrir para ayudarse con  los gastos de la casa. El prestamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías surtidas como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos , aguas gaseosas y bebidas alcohólicas.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco comunal porque puede ahorrar y acceder a los créditos y también las capacitaciones aprendió sobre el negocio y familia. Su sueño es poder ampliar su casa y ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lurgia is a member of the 'Nacer' community bank.  She is 33 years old and has 2 children aged 11 and 3.

Lurgia has a small grocery store which she opened so that she could help with her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise to stock her store such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, soda and alcoholic drinks.

Lurgia likes her community bank's meetings because she can save, access loans and also attend training sessions where she has learned about business and family.  Her dream is to extend her home and save for her children's studies.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil and drinks

loans.name: Chimalpain Group

texts.es:
Ellos son “Chimalpain”, eligieron ese nombre ya que así se llama la comunidad en donde ellos viven, a las orillas de San Miguel Xico. Está conformado por trece integrantes que día a día trabajan para salir adelante y poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus familias. Los integrantes son: Minerva V. (Bordado de Bolsas), Patricia D. (Venta de Cosméticos), Bianca M. (Venta de Cosméticos), María Guillermina T. (Bordado de Servilletas), Dora Nelly C. (Venta de Zapatos), Eugenia Graciela (Costura de Ropa), Arturo B. (Herrería), Jorge Alberto A. (Tienda Artesanal), Patricia Esmeralda T. (Venta de Antojitos), Irene R. (Bordado de Manteles),  Marisela Adriana M. (Venta de Manualidades), Dayana C.  (Venta de Comida) y Juan Javier S. (Bisutería).

Guillermina T. es integrante del grupo, tiene 47 años de edad, su familia esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijas las cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta de Servilletas Bordadas desde hace diez años, ya que se vio en la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y así tener un mayor ingreso, Guillermina asiste a tomar algunas clases para aprender diferentes bordados e ir innovando su mercancía para tener una mayor venta, día de las madres y en temporada navideña es cuando más vende, y durante el año la gente que ya la conoce va hasta su hogar y hace sus pedidos. También ha iniciado con la venta de cosméticos por catalogo y espera tener buenos resultados de sus dos actividades y seguir trabajando. Con el crédito que le ha sido brindado, comprara material como: hilos, agujas, manteles, servilletas, estambre, etc. Sus planes de Guillermina es poder poner una recaudería y también aprovecharía para exhibir bien sus manteles y servilletas para incrementar sus ganancias.

Chimalpain está muy contento de ser parte de Kiva ya que eso les beneficia mucho.
texts.en:
This is the 'Chimalpain' group.  Its members chose this name because it is the name of the community where they all live, on the outskirts of San Miguel Xico.  The group has thirteen members who work hard every day to get ahead in life and provide a better future for their families.  The members are: Minerva V. (bag embroidery), Patricia D. (cosmetics sales), Bianca M. (cosmetics sales), María Guillermina T. (napkin embroidery), Dora Nelly C. (shoe sales), Eugenia Graciela (dressmaking), Arturo B. (blacksmith), Jorge Alberto A. (handicrafts store), Patricia Esmeralda T. ('antojitos' sales – traditional Mexican snacks), Irene R. (tablecloth embroidery), Marisela Adriana M. (handicrafts sales), Dayana C. (food sales) and Juan Javier S. (jewelry sales).

Guillermina T. is a member of the group.  She is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two school-age daughters.  Guillermina sells embroidered napkins.  She has been doing this for ten years and started her business because she needed to help with her household expenses and have more income.  Guillermina takes classes to learn different embroideries so that she can keep being innovative in the designs of her goods and thereby make more sales.  She sells a lot of her products on Mothers' Day and over the Christmas period.  During the year, people who already know her go to her house and make their orders.  Guillermina has also started selling cosmetics through a catalog.  She hopes to be successful in her two business activities and to continue working.

Guillermina will use her loan to buy materials such as threads, needles, tablecloths, napkins, worsted yarn, etc.  Her plans are to set up a fruit and veg store and also take advantage to display her tablecloths and napkins well so that she can increase her profits.

Chimalpain are very happy to be part of Kiva since it will benefit them greatly.

loans.use: To buy napkins, threads, needles, hoops, cosmetics, etc.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Magaly Del Socorro

texts.es: Magaly del Socorro tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de su negocio Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa se dedica al comercio, empezó gracias a la ayuda de una amiga que la impulso a que empiece en este negocio. el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, toallas, sabanas y otras cosas en general.
texts.en: Magaly del Socorro is 45 years old.  She sells general goods.  She has had this business for more than 6 years.  She is a very enterprising woman and she enjoys her business.  As well as being a great housewife, she is also a saleswoman.  She started in her business thanks to the help of a friend who motivated her to start.  She will use her loan to buy footwear, cosmetics, towels, sheets and other things in general.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es: Martha Beatriz da inicio debido a la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes productos tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella tiene experiencia en los diferentes créditos que ha realizado, la motivación que tiene para con su negocio es muy reconocida. Con el crédito comprara ropa, sabanas, toallas, ropa en general y calzado ya que se acerca una temporada muy buena.
texts.en:
Martha Beatriz started out because she needed to help her husband.  Her activity is general merchandise sales.  Most of the customers request different products.  She has three minor children in her care.

She has experience with the various loans she’s negotiated.  Her motivation for her business is very well known.

She will use the loan to buy clothes, sheets, towels and footwear because a very good season is approaching.

loans.use: To buy clothes, sheets, towels and footwear.

loans.name: Nubia Maria

texts.es: Nubia Maria tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, este negocio lo inicio aprendiendo por su familia ya que ellos le habían enseñado la forma de ganarse el pan de cada día. Es una joven que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, a pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta como los problemas de salud, pues tiene que realizar muchas cosas en el mismo tiempo. El financiamiento es para la compra de mantequilla, huevo, queso, harina, cazuelas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Nubia María, 23, is a pastry chef.  She has had this business for over three years.  She started out learning from her family because they taught her the way to earn a living.

This young woman very much wants to get ahead in life.  Despite the challenges, like health problems, she faces she has to do many things at the same time.

The loan is to buy butter, eggs, cheese, flour and baking pans, among others.

loans.use: To buy butter, eggs, cheese, flour and baking pans, among others.

loans.name: Jicayan Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama “Jicayan”, es el nombre D. la localidad donD. habitan L. que integran a este grupo, pertenece al municipio D. San Pedro Jicayan, que esta situado a 50 minutos D. Pinotepa nacional del lado norte, esta población es totalmente habitada por indígenas mixtecos, conservan sus vestimentas originales así como sus usos y costumbres, en esta población se pueD. apreciar la creación D. diversos telares que visten D. colores propios a la gente que aquí habita, otra característica D. esta población es que aquí se encuentran muchos músicos y personas que se dedican a la creación D. artesanías talladas en madera, jícara y telares, haciendo D. este un lugar único, el grupo se conforma D. 11 miembros, en su totalidad mujeres, el nombre D. la representante es Rosa H. M., pero en especifico hablaremos D. una integrante D. este grupo quien es la señora Albina D. Dionicio. 
Ella es una ama D. casa, D. 29 años D. edad, esposa D. un campesino llamado Rodolfo D. 29 años también, es madre D. 2 niños, uno llamado Juan D. 6 años y una bebita D. 11 meses D. nacida llamada Idalia.
Albina, se caso a L. 13 años D. edad y su trabajo es la elaboración D. telares para vestimenta tradicional conocida como naguas y huipiles, actualmente consideradas como artesanías, este oficio lo aprendió desD. L. 10 años D. edad, es por enD. que las niñas D. la comunidad deben D. aprender, para cuando lleguen al matrimonio puedan elaborar su vestimenta, albina vive en una casa pequeña hecha D. adobe y barro crudo, su techo es D. tejas y lamina D. cartón y no tiene piso firme D. cemento, este tipo D. vivienda es normal verlas en esta zona donD. impera  la pobreza y la falta D. infraestructura D. comunicación básica como carreteras pavimentadas y la ampliación D. la red eléctrica.
Albina se integro un grupo D. crédito que se formo cerca D. su domicilio, esto por  su necesidad D. recursos para la compra D. material que se utiliza en la elaboración D. las naguas, ella utilizo el recurso para la compra D. hiL. como son; hilo D. algodón, en color blanco, hilo en color púrpura, morado guinda, L. hiL. como D. color púrpura es un hilo que se produce internamente se tiñen con caracol marino conocido como caracol púrpura, también compro hilo D. colores como el hilo vela, hilo D. madeja en colores distintos, que utiliza para elaborar servilletas, renovó algunas piezas D. su instrumento D. telar.
Albina sueña con que sus niños crezcan sanos y vallan a la escuela, aspira a mejorar su casa con materiales D. mejor calidad, así como el mejorar su condición D. vida, ella quisiera que sus artesanías la conozcan mas gente y que se las paguen al precio justo y no se aprovechen D. lo situación D. L. que menos tienen al comprarlas a un precio bastantemente por debajo del precio justo.
Las integrantes D. este grupo son mujeres sencillas, humildes, que añoran salir adelante cambiar su panorama D. pobreza por el D. una mejor vida, ellas con comprometidas con sus sueños y creen el la benevolencia D. muchos, es gente que estudió lo necesario para saber leer algunas cosas o para escribir su nombre o que incluso jamás pisaron una escuela. 
Albina  con una sonrisa le agradeces a Fundacion realidad, a kiva y la gente que integra la realización  D. L. sueños D. L. más pobres, gracias por ayudar a L. indígenas D. la costa D. Oaxaca, les envía un  fraternal abrazo.
Aquí se dan a conocer L. nombres D. las mujeres que integran al grupo “Jicayan” y su actividad D. trabajo D. cada una D. ellas.  

Albina D. Dionicio. – Elaboración D. telares artesanales
Sabina Bruna D. Hernández.- Elaboración D. telares artesanales
Fidencia H. M..- Bordado artesanal 
Rosa H. M..- Venta D. antojitos
Juana Jiménez Gómez.- Abarrotes
Sofía Gómez Jiménez.- Venta D. antojitos
María Magdalena Jiménez D..- Abarrotes
Irlanda T. Guzmán.- Venta D. antojitos
Josefina A. Hernández.- Venta D. antojitos
Araceli C. A..- Venta D.  refrescos
Elena Epifania M. D. L. S..- Elaboración D. telares artesanales
texts.en:
The following group is called “Jicayan” which is the name of the location where the group members live.  It’s part of San Pedro Jicayan municipality and is located 50 minutes north of Pinotepa Nacional.  This town is inhabited in its totality by Mixteca indigenous people.  They preserve their traditional dress as well as their traditional customs and behaviors.  In this population one can admire the creation of various textiles that display the colors particular to the people who live here.  Another characteristic of this population is that one can find many musicians here as well as artisans who make crafts from wood, gourds and textiles making this a unique place.  The group has 11 members, all women.  The name of the group representative is Rosa H. M. but the group member we will feature is Mrs. Albina Damián Dionicio.

She is a 29 year old housewife, married to a 29 year old farmer named Rodolfo.  She is mother of two children, Juan, 6, and Idalia, 11 months.

Albina was married at the age of 13 and her work consists of weaving traditional costumes known as “naguas” and “huipiles” which are currently considered artesanal handicrafts.  She learned this skill when she was 10 years old; it is something little girls in this community must learn so that when they get married they can make their clothes.

Albina lives in a small house maD. of adobe and raw mud.  The roof is roofing tile and cardboard sheets.  It does not have a firm cement floor.  This type of dwelling is typical of the area where poverty reigns and the lack of basic communication infrastructure, like paved highways and widespread supply of electricity, is the norm.

Albina joined this credit group that formed near her place of residence because she needed resources to buy the materials she uses to make the “naguas.’’ She used the resource to buy cotton thread in white, purple, maroon.  Some of the thread, like the purple one, is produced internally.  They dye the threads using a marine snail known as Purple Snail.  She also bought other kinds of embroidery thread like “hilo vela” and “hilo Madeja” in assorted colors that she used to make napkins.  She also replaced some parts on her loom.

Albina dreams that her children will grow healthy and go to school.  She aspires to improve her house with better quality materials as well as to improve her living conditions.  She’d like it if her crafts were known among more people and that she be paid a fair price for them; that they don’t take advantage of the situation those who have little are in to buy at prices below what is fair.

The members of this group are unassuming, humble women who only wish to get ahead and change the panorama of poverty for one of a better life.  They are committed to their dreams and believe in the goodness of others.  They are people who studied enough to be able to read a few things or to be able to write their names or perhaps never even stepped foot insiD. a school.

Albina, smiling, thanks Fundación Realidad, Kiva and all those people who help the dreams of poor people come true.  Thanks for helping indigenous people from the Oaxaca coast.  They send a sisterly hug.

Following are the names and activities of each of the other members of the “Jicayan” group:

Albina Damián Dionicio. – Manufactures Artesanal Textiles

Sabina Bruna Damián Hernández.- Manufactures Artesanal Textiles

Fidencia H. M..- Artesanal Embroidery 

Rosa H. M.. - Fast Food Sales

Juana Jiménez Gómez.- Groceries

Sofía Gómez Jiménez. - Fast Food Sales

María Magdalena Jiménez Damián.- Groceries

Irlanda T. Guzmán. - Fast Food Sales

Josefina A. Hernández - Fast Food Sales

Araceli C. A. - Sale of Beverages

Elena Epifania M. D. L. S..- Manufactures Artesanal Textiles

loans.use: To buy cotton thread used in making napkins and tablecloths, skirts for traditional costumes, traditional blouses.  This material is known as Madeja Crystal cotton thread in red, green, blue and orange.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia E. is a single parent having one child. Emelia is a baker at Abura, which has been her business for ten years. She uses her income to see to the general upkeep of the home. Emelia will add the loan to her initial income to expand her bakery business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emelia plans save towards the education of her child.

At the time this picture was taken, Emelia had dispatched a large portion of what she had baked for the morning. She had only a few loaves to show.

loans.use: to expand her bakery business

loans.name: Hector Gustavo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Hector Gustavo; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de cuyes en el distrito de Quiquijana, el los cría y después los vende en las diferentes ferias que hay en la ciudad de Cusco, el socio también se dedica al turismo, el socio quiere implementar el negocio de crianza de cuyes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar comida y vitaminas para los cuyes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hector Gustavo is a member of the 'Ricchary Cusco' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Hector Gustavo is 24 years old and single.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business raising guinea pigs in Quiquijana district.  He raises the animals and then sells them in the different markets in the city of Cusco.  He is also in the tourism business.  He would like to supply his guinea pig business and is requesting this loan to buy feed and vitamins for the guinea pigs.

Hector Gustavo is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for his guinea pigs

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Luisa Del Carmen, por lo que su actividad es una pulpería y venta de verduras, hace mas de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos. Siempre le ha gustado buscar la forma de mejorar su condición de vida pues tenía 3 hijos de los cuales tenía que brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de frutas, verduras y para la pulpería. Se siente muy contenta por obtener esta forma de mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Luisa Del Carmen runs a neighborhood store and fruit stand; she has owned these businesses for over 5 years. This is not her first time requesting a loan. She has always enjoyed finding was to improve her quality of life, as she had 3 children to put through school. The motive for her loan request is to purchase fruits and vegetables, and for her neighborhood store. She is very happy to have access to this venue to improve her income.

loans.use: Work Capital (to purchase fruits and vegetables, and for her neighborhood store).

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Manuel de 37 años, quien es zapatero y de sus 3 pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se despierta muy temprano para empezar con la atención en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y especerías que tiene en un mercado de su zona. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 13 años y el tiempo le permitió captar buenos clientes, quienes acuden a su establecimiento para comprar los productos básicos que ofrece, entre ellos los no perecibles, pues son ofrecidos pues saben que son frescos y de buen precio. Lo que no le gusta de su labor es que desatiende sus labores del hogar, porque pasa la mayor parte del día en el mercado, ya que  debe vender gran cantidad para asegurar sus ganancias. Sin embargo, sabe que el esfuerzo tiene su recompensa pues ayuda a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lidia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en abarrotes y otros productos de primera necesidad, pues desea abastecer mejor su puesto  para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Lidia, 35 years old, lives in her own house together with her husband Manuel, 37, who is a cobbler, and their 3 small children. Together they work hard to improve their circumstances. This entrepreneurial woman wakes up very early to attend her business, selling groceries and spices in a market in her zone. Lidia has been doing this for 13 years, and time has allowed her to capture good customers who frequent her business to purchase the basic products she offers, including perishable items, as people know that they are fresh and are sold at a good price. What Lidia doesn't like about her job is that she neglects her household tasks, because she passes a large part of the day in the market as she must sell a large quantity of goods to assure her earnings. Without doubt, Lidia knows that her efforts are rewarded as she helps her husband with the regular household costs. As she is an entrepreneurial woman, in the future Lidia plans to expand her business's facilities to offer the best to her customers. This is the second loan she has had from MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually as she doesn't want to have a bad relationship with the people that made the loan possible, as this loan will allow her to continue working in search of progress. Lidia plans to invest the loan in purchasing inventory - namely groceries - and other necessary products, as she wants to stock her business better to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Purchase items to stock her shop

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty E. is married and has one child. Gifty is a hairdresser at Akotokyir near Abura. Her husband works with Ameen Sangari (a soap-making company in Cape Coast, Ghana).  Gifty uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Gifty will use the loan to purchase more hair creams and other hair products to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gifty plans to build a shop.

loans.use: purchase more hair creams and other hair products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase oil, potatoes and other perishable products to prepare food.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; La socia tiene 2 hijos ella es conviviente, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene su puesto de venta de frutas, la socia compra al por mayor de los proveedores y ella vende al por menor la fruta en la calle, la socia desea a corto plazo tener un buen capital para comprar más frutas a medida que se le acabe las que tiene y de este modo poder ahorrar con todos los ingresos que genere la venta de frutas para construir el terreno que tiene con su conyugue y poder darles mejor comodidad a sus menores hijos, la socia trabaja todos los días incluyendo los fines de semana, ella está por las mañanas hasta la hora de almuerzo vendiendo sus frutas, ella deja todo listo muy temprano antes de salir a su negocio para que sus hijos puedan almorzar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el capital para comprar frutas al por mayor para abastecerse.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Sr. De Tayancani”.  The bank is located in the Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Nancy.  She has two children and lives with her partner.  She has a retail stand where she sells fruit.  She buys wholesale from suppliers and sells the fruit on the street.  She would like to have capital to buy more fruit in the short run when she sells what she has, and thus be able to save the earnings from the sales.  She wants to build a house on the land that she and her partner have and give her children a more comfortable life.  She sells fruit every day, including weekends, from morning to lunch time.  She leaves everything ready in her house before she goes out so that her children can have lunch.  She is requesting a loan for capital to buy fruit wholesale to supply her business.

She appreciates and values the loan offered her this way and promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan for working capital to buy fruit wholesale to supply her business.

loans.name: Juliana Anamoa

texts.en: Juliana Anamoa M. sells soft drinks at Akotokyir, near Abura. She is married and has been in this business for five years now. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to reinvest the additional income as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Geronima Esperanza

texts.es: Geronima Esperanza tiene 64 años su actividad es la venta de tortillas. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento. Es una mujer muy agradecida y se siente feliz por tener este medio de vida ya que es muy difícil obtener trabajo a su edad. El motivo del financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de leña, maíz, cal entre otros productos que son necesarios. Sueña con seguir mejorando cada día su negocio.
texts.en: Geronima Esperanza is 64 years old and has a business selling tortillas.  This is not the first time she is requesting a loan.  She is a very grateful woman and happy to have her way of life as it is very difficult to get a job at her age.  The reason she is requesting a loan is to purchase wood, corn, lime, and other products that are needed.  She dreams of improving her business every day.

loans.use: Working capital for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es: Eulogio, D. 32 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado D. su esposa Janeth D. 30 años y D. sus 3 pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Hace más D. 4 años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica al trabajo en su  taller D. mecánica D. reparación D. motocarros, aunque el local es alquilado, comparte los gastos con un socio, el cual ofrece aceites lubricantes. Esta muy satisfecho con su labor, pues el tiempo le ha permitido hacerse bien conocido por L. zona, lo que le ha generado gran cantidad D. clientes que prefieren ir a su taller por los buenos precios que ofrece. Se desempeña en su negocio D. lunes a sábado durante todo el día, y pueD. quedarse hasta altas horas D. L. noche, si tiene algún trabajo pendiente. Y esta muy satisfecho, pues las ganancias le permiten brindarle a su familia una buena calidad D. vida. Como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda D. comestibles en su casa, para que su esposa L. atienda, D. esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Eulogio tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en el refaccionamiento D. un motocarro que espera brindar en alquiler para después revenderlo; así espera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eulogio, 32 years old, lives in his own house that is next to his wife Janeth, 30 years old, and their 3 small children.  Together, they strive to succeed every day.  For more than 4 years, this enterprising man has worked in his auto shop repairing motorcycle taxis.  Even though the place is rented, he shares the costs with a partner, who provides the motor oils.  He is very satisfied with his work because through the years he has become well-known in the area, which has generated a lot of customers who prefer to go to his shop for its good prices.

He works at his business from Monday to Saturday all day, and can stay up late at night if he has some work to do.  He is very happy, as profits allow him to give his family a good quality of life.  An an entrepreneur for the future, he plans to install a grocery store at home that his wife can attend to, in order to improve their profits.  

This is his first loan with MFP and promises to pay his dues on time because he does not want to give a bad impression to the people who maD. this contribution possible.  This will allow him to continue working toward progress.  Eulogio plans to invest the loan requested in the repair of a motorcycle taxi that he hopes to rent and later sell, in expectation of increasing their income.

loans.use: To repair a motorcycle taxi in order to resell it.

loans.name: Jeanine's Group

texts.en:
Jeanine owns a business that sells tailored clothes.   She is 38 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of five and nineteen.  Her husband is a garden cleaner.  Jeanine is a group leader of the borrowing group called Icyizere in Kinyarwanda, The Hope in English. 

Jeanine has been selling tailored clothes for 18 years.  Her loan will be used to buy more threads and cloths. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an automated sewing machine. In the future, she would like to have more than one sewing machine.  In the picture, Jeanine is in the middle holding a blue note book.

loans.use: To buy more threads and cloths

loans.name: Vilma Vicenta

texts.es: Vilma Vicenta tiene mucho tiempo de obtener este medio de vida que es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 30 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora ha demostrado que puede sacar a su familia adelante ante cualquier circunstancia. Sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos se siente contenta porque además de vender sus productos se da cuenta de lo que más le gusta a sus clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como faldas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas de vestir entre otros.
texts.en:
Vilma Vicenta has been in this business as a way of earning her living for over 30 years.  She’s sold clothes all this time and as a tenacious and enterprising woman she has shown that she is capable of moving her family ahead in any circumstance.

She goes out daily to sell her products happy because besides selling her items she finds out what her customers like best.

The reason for this loan is to buy raw materials like skirts, pants, dresses, dress shirts, among others.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Lisseth

texts.es: Lisseth, de 26 años, vive en casa de su madre, en compañía de ella y de sus 2 pequeños hijos; y juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año esta emprendedora joven se dedica a la fabricación de toda clase de bojouteria con pedrería de colores. Esta muy satisfecha con esta labor pues mientras trabaja puede a la vez educar a sus hijos; y solo ocupa  largos ratos durante todo el día, además  vende al por mayor y también por unidad sus preciados accesorios. Con el tiempo ha logrado adquirir gran cantidad de clientes que le compran con regular frecuencia, pues saben  de los buenos precios y de la buena calidad de sus accesorios. Es por esta razón que esta muy contenta con su labor, además con las ganancias ayuda a su madre en los constantes gastos del hogar; también  tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de aumentar la cantidad de su producción en bijouteria e instalar un puesto de venta de accesorios. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lisseth tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en pedrería (variedades y colores) para aumentar su producción y ganancias.
texts.en:
Lisseth, 26, lives in her mother’s house with her and her two small sons.  Together they struggle each day to get ahead.  For the last year this enterprising young woman has been making all kinds of costume multicolored stone jewelry.  She is very satisfied with her work because she can educate her children while she works; she only needs long moments during the day.  She sells her attractive accessories at wholesale and by the piece.

In time she has managed to secure a regular clientele that buys from her frequently because they know of the good prices and high quality of her accessories.  For this reason, she is happy with her work.  Besides, she is able to use profits to help her mother cover household expenses.  In addition, she has many plans for the future like increasing the amount of her costume jewelry production and setting up a sales stand for her wares.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to repay in a timely fashion because she does not want to disappoint the people who have made this contribution possible that will allow her to keep working seeking progress.

Lisseth plans to use the requested funds to buy an amount of assorted stone merchandise in several colors to increase production and profits.

loans.use: To buy jewelry stones.

loans.name: Idulvina

texts.es: B. Idulvina tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos y enchiladas. Desde hace 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado buscar la forma de generar ingresos a su hogar. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues han sido de gran provecho para su negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar sus diferentes productos que son muy ricos ya que siempre se esfuerza por mejorar la calidad de sus productos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima ya que la temporada navideña se acerca y quiere ofrecer de todo.
texts.en: B. Idulvina is 38 years old.  Her business is selling soft drinks and enchiladas.  She has had this business for 11 years.  She has always liked looking for ways to make money for her household.  This isn't the first time that she has requested a loan and her previous loans have been very beneficial for her business.  Most of her customers come to buy her different products which are very rich since she is always working hard to improve their quality.  She would like this loan to buy supplies since the Christmas period is approaching and she would like to offer everything.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Los Claveles De Nepantla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Los Claveles de Nepantla, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Nepantla de Sor Juana Inés de la Cruz, Tepetlixpa, Estado de México, este grupo está conformado por 6 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas las integrantes son la señora **Juliana V. D. va a comprar con su préstamo sabanas, colchas, almohadas, edredones para la venta; ** la señora María Martínez Rodríguez va a comprar papas fritas, azúcar, aceite, leche, sopa, galletas para surtir su negocio; ** la señora Sandra A. Martínez va a comprar maíz para revenderlo e invertir en chicharrones y flanes; ** la señora Yolanda Godínez E. va a comprar pantalones de mezclilla, blusas, camisas, suéteres para la venta e iniciar su negocio; **la señora Asela V. C. va a comprar refacciones para su taxi; **la señora Yolanda Sánchez va a comprar productos naturistas (herbalife, tés, complementos alimenticios y zapatos para la venta. 
Asela  tiene 48 años de edad estudio hasta el 6º. año de primaria, ella es soltera y tiene 1 hijo se  llama Gerardo y tiene 22 años de edad es casado y trabaja, ella tiene un taxi y solicitó su préstamo para comprar refacciones para su taxi le va a dar el servicio de afinación le va a cambiar bujías, filtro de aceite, filtro de aire, filtro de gasolina y va a comprar llantas.
Ella es taxista, ofrece sus servicios al público en general, trabaja en la ruta "Emiliano Zapata", desde hace 8 años inicio con su negocio. Primero aprendió a manejar y después ya se dedico al negocio de dar servicio de taxi al público en general, le animaron unos amigos y le gusta su trabajo, le fascina!!!
Antes de este negocio trabajaba de checadora de taxis, también trabajó en una carpintería, en una plomería, y en el extranjero trabajo en una panadería. Después de todos éstos trabajos decidió adquirir un taxi.
Su base está en Nepantla de Sor Juana Inés de la Cruz, estado de México, y para ella es  importante porque va a todos lados y le gusta manejar, ella recuerda que cuando fue checadora veía pasar a sus compañeros y ella quería ser igual que ellos y se fue al extranjero a trabajar para comprar el taxi, sus clientes son todas las personas mujeres, señores, estudiantes, personas de la tercera edad, muchachas y muchachos, atiende de 50 a 60 clientes por día en un horario de 6 de la mañana a las 8 pm. 
Los desafíos que enfrenta son costos elevados en refacciones y llantas, también tiene mucha competencia hay muchos taxistas, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza en gastos de la casa, gastos personales y para ahorrar para las refacciones y para los pagos del préstamo, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio quiere comprar otro coche y darlo a trabajar y lo piensa lograr trabajando y terminando de pagar su crédito además de solicitar otro crédito. 
Nepantla de Sor Juana Inés de la Cruz es tranquilo es un pueblo donde nació Sor Juana Inés de la Cruz, llegan muchos turistas a visitar el museo de Sor Juana Inés de la Cruz, hay bastantes arboles, el clima es frio. Este negocio le ha ayudado a su familia a su mama le ayuda económicamente, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda es agrandarla ponerle fachada y hacer un cuarto mas, sus planes y esperanzas son terminar de pagar su préstamo y ya no trabajar mucho quiere dar a trabajar el taxi, la señora Asela está emocionada con el préstamo que le hicieron por que va a poder hacerle a su taxi el servicio de afinación y conservarlo en buenas condiciones para dar un servicio mejor a los clientes, las mejoras que desea lograr para sus hijos son dejarle su negocio a sus nietos y su hijo, las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad gracias muchas gracias por los prestamos que nos dieron y que sigan ayudando a más personas con sus préstamos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called 'Los Claveles de Nepantla' (The Carnations of Nepantla).  It is located in Nepantla de Sor Juana Inés de la Cruz, in Tepetlixpa, in the State of Mexico.  This group has 6 female members who know each other and are neighbors.  The members are Mrs Juliana V. D. who will use her loan to buy sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases and comforters to sell, Mrs María Martínez Rodríguez who will buy chips, sugar, oil, milk, soup and cookies to stock her business, Mrs Sandra A. Martínez who will buy corn to resell and also invest in fried pork crackling and crème caramels, Mrs Yolanda Godínez E. who will buy denim pants, blouses, shirts and sweaters to sell and to start her business, Mrs Asela V. C. who will buy spare parts for her taxi and Mrs Yolanda Sánchez who will buy natural products (Herbalife, teas, food supplements and shoes to sell).

Asela is 48 years old.  She studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She is single and has one son called Gerardo who is 22 years old, married and works.  Asela has a taxi and she is requesting her loan to buy spare parts for it, have it tuned, change the spark plugs, oil filter, air filter, gas filter and buy tires.

Asela is a taxi driver.  She offers her services to the general public and works on the “Emiliano Zapata” route.  She started her business 8 years ago.  First she learned to drive then she started her business providing a taxi service to the general public.  Some friends encouraged her and she likes her work.  She adores it!!

The challenges that she faces are the high costs of spare parts and tires and also the fact that she has a lot of competition as there are a lot of taxi drivers.  She uses her profits to cover her household expenses and personal expenses, and she also saves for spare parts and to make her loan repayments.  She is planning to expand her business.  She would like to buy another car and hire it out for work.  She is planning to achieve this through working and finishing making repayments on her loan, as well as asking for another loan.
 
Nepantla de Sor Juana Inés de la Cruz is very quiet.  It is the town where Sister Juana Inés de la Cruz was born.  Many tourists come to visit the Sister Juana Inés de la Cruz museum.  There are a lot of trees and the climate is cold.  This business has helped Asela's family.  She also helps her mom financially.  She would like to make some improvements to her home such as extend it, do some cosmetic work on the outside of the house and add an extra room.  Her plans and hopes are to finish paying off her loan and not work so much.  She would like to hire the taxi out for somebody else to work in.  Asela is very happy with the loan that she is being given because she will be able to have her taxi tuned and keep it in good conditions so that she can provide a better service to her customers.  The improvements that she would like to achieve for her children are to leave her business to her grandchildren and her son.

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “Thank you.  Thank you very much for the loans which you have given us and we hope you continue helping more people with your loans”.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her taxi, tuning, spark plugs, oil filter, air filter and gas filter

loans.name: Marvin Aristides

texts.es: Marvin Arístides de 36 años, es una persona la cual debe trabajar muy duro para sostener a su extensa familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa y seis hijos, todos menores de edad. Marvin tiene la venta de abarroteria en general Este negocio es muy importante para Marvin como para su familia, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual obtenga el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio todo esto con el deseo de aumentar su producción y así mismo de mejorar sus ventas, el mayor deseo de Marvin es de poder solventar todas las necesidades de sus hijos, por lo cual lucha día con día por salir adelante y darles todo lo mejor a ellos y su esposa.
texts.en: Marvin Arístides is 36 years old.  He is a person who has to work very hard to support his large family which is made up of his wife and six dependent children.  Marvin sells general groceries.  His business is very important to him as well as his family as it is the only source of income that they have.  Marvin is requesting a loan which will provide him with the money he needs to invest in his business so that he can increase his production and also improve his sales.  Marvin's biggest wish is to be able to cover all his children's needs.  To achieve this, he works hard every day to get ahead in life and provide the very best for his children and his wife.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gestrudes; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de picantería (es como un restaurant pero más tradicional),ella prepara comida y también ven de cerveza y chicha (bebida a base de maíz),la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia prepara diferentes platos de comida que son tradicionales de la ciudad de Cusco como chicharrones, cuy al horno, lechón y entre otros platos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne y verduras.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de ropa, restaurant, locutorio, transporte y venta de cosméticos.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “PROGRESO” (Progress) communal bank which is located in Cusco district belonging to Cusco province, Cusco department.

Gertrudis, 56, is single and has three children.  She has a “picantería” (like a restaurant only more traditional).  She prepares food and sells beer and chicha (a beverage made from corn).  She works from 10am until 8pm.  She prepares different dishes that are traditional to the city of Cusco like chicharrones (fried pork), cuy al horno (roasted guinea pig), and lechón (roasted piglet), among others.  She wants to improve the business and is asking for funds to buy ingredients, like meat and vegetables, to cook.

The other group members sell clothes, run restaurants, run public telephone booths and sell cosmetics.

She is grateful to all those people who share her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients, like meat and vegetables, to cook.

loans.name: Rosa Blanca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Rosa blanca", esta ubicado en el municipio de las vigas guerrero, decidieron ponerle este nombre por que dicen los integrantes, que para ellas las rosas blancas significan paz y armonía, es por eso que optaron por este nombre, la historia es acerca de la señora Silvia C. G., ya que es la presidenta del grupo ella tiene 21 años, esta casada con el señor Enrique, tienen 2 hijos, Luis y Antonio de 6 y 4 años de edad, los dos están estudiando el mas pequeño el segundo año de preescolar y el otro el primer año de primaria, ella tiene una dulcería y también vende refrescos.

Silvia decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que un familiar le comento que era una muy buena fuente de ingresos, también por que esto le ayudaría para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, al igual que para  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella invirtirá su préstamo en la compra de mas mercancía como son: paletas, chicles, frituras (chicharrones y palomitas), refrescos, jugos y aguas, para tener un poco mas surtida su tienda. 

Ella esta muy contenta por que dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas han incrementado bastante al igual que sus clientes, y por lo mismo sus ingresos también han incrementado satisfactoriamente, tanto que hasta se compro una plancha.

La meta que tiene doña Silvia es la de continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional y así tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mas su pequeño negocio, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas el lugar en donde tiene su tienda para así tener mas variedad de productos, y mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen de hace algún tiempo y son muy responsables con sus pagos, ya que no quieren defraudar la confianza y apoyo que le están brindando.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios de kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a eso ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia al igual que continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.
Y estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada uno de los integrantes del grupo rosa blanca.
Humbelina R. G.-dulcería
Agraciana G.
texts.en:
This group is called “Rosa Blanca” (White Rose) located in Las Vigas, Guerrero.  They named it thus because the members say that white roses represent peace and harmony for them and that’s why they chose that name.  The story is about Mrs. Silvia C. G. who is the group President. She is 21 years old and married to Enrique.  They have two sons, Luis and Antonio, who are 6 and 4 years of age.  Both are in school, the youngest in second year of preschool and the oldest in first grade.  She has a candy store and also sells beverages.

Silvia decided to start this business because a family member commented that it was a good source of income and also because it would help her help her husband meet household expenses and to pay for the education of their children.  It would also help improve the family’s quality of life.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like: popsicles, chewing gum, snacks (chicharrones and popcorn), soft drinks, juices and water in order to have the store a little better stocked.

She is very happy because she says she’s been doing very well with her store; her sales have increased as well as her customer base which has led to her income also rising satisfactorily, so much so that she bought herself an iron.

Silvia’s goal is to continue supporting her children with their schooling so that they will complete a professional career and thus have a better future. She also wants her small business to grow because she wants to expand the space where she has the store in order to have a wider variety of products and increase and improve her profits.

She comments that she works very well in her group because all the members have known each other for a long time and are very responsible with their payments because they don’t want to disappoint those who have trusted them and helped them.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva lenders for the unconditional help they are giving because thanks to it her quality of life and that of her family has improved as well as she’s been able to continue investing in her business.

These are the names and activities of each of the members of Rosa Blanca:

Humbelina R. G.-candy store

Agraciana G.

loans.use: To buy more beverages, water and juice.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Manuel de 61 años, que es estibador y de sus 3 hijos que son menores; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 18 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de golosinas y raspadillas.  Cada mañana alista su carretilla con diversidad de golosinas, gaseosas y raspadillas; empieza a vender, de manera ambulatoria, afuera de un colegio desde las 8 de la mañana. Luego al mediodía  se dirige a otra institución educativa y comercializa en ése lugar hasta las 4 de la tarde; dice que esta muy satisfecha porque con la venta de sus comestibles, de manera ambulatoria, obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo saldrá adelante, pues el desempeño durante este tiempo le ha permitido comprarse su casa propia; y ya tiene planes futuros para terminarla de construir de material noble e instalar ahí una tienda de comestibles para empezar a vender en un lugar más estable. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Alicia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de sacos de azúcar y escencias y otros ingredientes que le servirán para preparar sus raspadillas durante este verano, de esta manera espera aumentar sus ganancias y seguir adelante.
texts.en: Alicia, 41, lives alongside her 61-year old husband Manuel, who is a longshoreman, and their three children. Every day they work hard to improve their life. For 18 years, this self-starter has worked selling snack foods and snow cones. Every morning she prepares her cart with treats, soda, and snow cones. She starts selling her wares outside of a high school starting at 8 o'clock. After noon she moves to another school and makes sales there until four in the afternoon. She says that she is satisfied with her job as an ambulatory food saleswoman because she makes regular profits that allow her to help her husband cover their household expenses. She knows that hard work pays off because their hard work during this time has allowed them to buy their own house, and she has plans to finish building the house with better materials and to install a snack shop there so she can sell her goods from a stable location. This is will be Alicia's second loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments punctually because she does not want to let down the people who have supported her and allowed her to continue working towards her own success. She is planning on using the loan to purchase sugar, flavors, and other ingredients that she will use to prepare snow cones during the summer. This way she hopes to increase her profits.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar and other ingredients to prepar snow cones.

loans.name: Piedra Grande Group

texts.es:
La señora Alicia Sánchez M., vive en la localidad de: "Piedra Grande" municipio de coapilla estado de Chiapas México, es casada con tres hijo que aun están a su cargo, la primera es Daniela  Yazmín de once años, el otro es Antonio de ocho años de edad, Freddy de cuatro y el mas pequeño es Rafael de dos años.

         Éste ya es el tercer présatamo que pide a Fundación Realidad y los dos préstamos anteriores los ha invertido en la compra y venta de pollos y en la carpintería que trabaja su esposo, comenta  que con esta actividad le ha ido bien ya que les a dado buenos ingresos en su hogar.

        Se inspiró en esta actividad de venta de pollos por que también quiría ayudar con los gastos que se generan en su familia y así su esposo se sienta apoyado con más ánimo de salir adelante.

        Con la ganancia que va obteniendo, lo invierte en la compra de más pollos y madera para su carpintería que también los ha poyado mucho con el gasto que se mantiene del diario.

       Su  sueño más grande es que  logre ahorrar y apoyar a su esposo con sus ingresos y puedan salir adelante juntos como familia.

       En el programa se integro por los avisos que FRAC hizo en su localidad, en donde se vio muy interesada y busco otras personas mas para poder formar un grupo y fue así como formaron el grupo de nombre "Piedra Grande" por llamarse así el lugar en donde ellos viven.

     Las personas que integran el grupo son tres y son las siguientes:

    Alicia Sánchez M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos para venderlo aliñado, como tambien en la compra de pinturas y madera para su carpintería.
    Jesús M. Rodríguez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos para luego venderlo aliñados (destazados), como tambien en la venta de tacos dorados.
    Eladia M. Rodríguez: compra pollos para venderlo aliñado (destazado).
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia Sánchez M. lives in the village of Piedra Grande, in the municipality of Coapilla, Chiapas, Mexico. She is married with four children that are still under her roof. The eldest is Daniela Yazmin (11) followed by Antonio (8), Freddy (4) and the youngest Rafael (2).         

This will be her third loan from the Reality Foundation, and she invested the two previous loans in the purchase of chickens for resale and in her husband's carpentry business. She says that these business have been going well and that are providing an income for their household.

She started selling chickens because she wanted to help cover her family's expenses and she wanted her husband to feel supported and thus inspired to keep working hard.   

She is using her profits to purchase more chickens and wood for her husband's carpentry, which has also been a great help towards covering their expenses. 

Her dream is to be able to save money and support her husband, so that they can succeed together as a family.

She joined the group after reading FRAC advertisements posted in her neighborhood. She sought out other interested people, and they formed a group named Piedra Grande after the community they live in.

The three members of the group are as follows:
Alicia Sánchez M.: She will use the loan money to purchase chickens to sell them butchered and seasoned, as well as the purchase of wood and paintings for a separate carpentry business.

Jesús M. Rodríguez: He will use the money to purchase chickens, which he will butcher and season for resale. He also sells tacos dorados or flautas.

Eladia M. Rodríguez: She will use the money to purchase chickens, which she will butcher and season for resale.

loans.use: la compra de pollos, como tambien comprar madera y pinturas para su carpinteria.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia; La socia tiene 2 hijos ella se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia trabaja criando animales menores, ella compra cuyes al por mayor, también tiene chanchos y aves de corral (gallinas, pollos, gallos), las gallina sle dan huevos a diario y los pollos cuando alcanza la madurez los vende a otros compradores, las gallinas también en su debido tiempo y los gallos para reproducción, la socia realiza todo un negocio con la venta de estos animales y al momento de reproducirse ella los va vendiendo también, la socia hace lo mismo con los cuyes; La socia tuvo una perdida con sus cuyes por el mal clima se enfermaron y murieron, ahora después de recuperarse y de limpiar las jaulas y el espacio está dispuesta a comenzar de nuevo. La socia invertirá el dinero en la compra de cuyes, para comenzar una nueva camada y de este modo incrementar sus ventas y su economía.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores (cuyes).

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia belongs to the Sr. de Tayacani Community Bank. This bank is located in the district of Ocongate, province of Quispichachis, department of Cusco.

She has two children who work retailing goods, and she works raising animals for sale. She buys guinea pigs wholesale, and she also owns pigs, hens, chickens, and roosters. Her hens provide her with eggs every day, and when the chickens are fully grown she sells them to various buyers. She also sells hens and roosters for reproduction. She has a full enterprise with selling these animals and their offspring.
