Jesús desea adquirir ganado de mayor producción y alimento balanceado para poder aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio y adquirir más ingresos por sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 52 year-old father who lives with his wife in La Clake, a rural area in Reque district.  The main business activities in this area are agriculture and animal husbandry.  It is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Jesús has been raising animals since he was young.  He has some cows which he raises in a pen near his home.  He sells the milk which they produce every day.  He also fattens his young bulls to sell as meat.  This is his main source of income and, thanks to it, he has been able to get his family ahead in life.

Jesús would like to acquire better-producing cattle and balanced feed so that he can improve the profitability of his business and make more profits on his sales.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy cattle and balanced feed to improve his business

loans.name: María Yacqueline

texts.es:
María Yacqueline es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío El Garbanzal del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes. Adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde ha instalado maracuyá, la cual extrae con cierta frecuencia y la vende a los acopiadores de la zona.

Los ingresos que ella obtiene de estas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. María desea seguir creciendo como empresaria, por ello ha decidido ampliar su bodega con la compra de más productos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Yacqueline is a 37 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the village of El Garbanzal, in Olmos district, a farming region in Lambayeque province, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

María Yacqueline has a small grocery store in her home where she offers her customers different household products as well as essentials and groceries.  Her business is very popular because of the good quality of the products which she offers and the good service which she provides to her customers.  She also has a small plot of land where she grows passion fruit which she frequently picks and sells to traders in the area.

The profits that she makes from these business activities allow her to help her husband to support their family financially.  María would like to continue growing as a businesswoman.  For this reason, she has decided to expand her grocery store by purchasing more products.  She is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy products to expand the small grocery store which she has in her home

loans.name: Esteban Rene

texts.es:
Esteban es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Campiña El Cerrito del distrito de Paiján, la localidad es una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes. Adicionalmente cuenta con un equipo de sonido que alquila para amenizar actividades sociales, fiestas, etc.

Los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades le sirven para sostener la economía de su familia. Esteban desea seguir creciendo como empresario, por ello ha decidido ampliar su bodega con la compra de más productos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Esteban is a 43 year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in Campiña El Cerrito, in Paiján district.  It is an agricultural area of Ascope province, in La Libertad region, more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Esteban has a small grocery store in his home where he offers his customers different household products, essentials and groceries.  His business is very popular because of the good quality of the products that he offers and the good service which he provides to his customers.  He also has a sound system which he hires out for social events, parties, etc.

The profits that Esteban makes from these business activities help him to support his family financially.  He would like to continue growing as a businessman and would like to expand his grocery store by purchasing more products.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To buy products to expand the small grocery store in his home

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa en Puerto Malabrigo, una zona situada en el distrito de Rázuri, provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte). El brinda este servicio en su localidad y en las zonas aledañas. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia. Su esposa cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda.

Manuel desea brindar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, debido a que esta esta empezando a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas producto del excesivo uso y del mal estado de los caminos de la zona. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 62 year-old father who lives with his wife in Puerto Malabrigo, in Rázuri district, in Ascope province, in La Libertad region, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Manuel provides transport services for cargo and passengers in a 'mototaxi' (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a cabin behind which can be used for transporting goods and passengers).  Manuel provides this service in his town and in neighboring areas.  He uses the profits from this business to get his family ahead.  His wife has a small grocery store in their home.

Manuel would like to have his vehicle serviced as it is beginning to suffer mechanical failures owing to its excessive use and the bad state of the area's roads.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help achieve his goal.

loans.use: To pay to have his vehicle serviced and repaired

location.town: Puerto Malabrigo - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y al menor de sus hijos en el sector Santa Isabel del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica junto a su esposa a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El suele criar cabras en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio y su esposa cría aves de corral , especialmente patos y gallinas. Cuando estos animales ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrecen en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde viven. Con los ingresos que les brinda esta actividad ellos se encargan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Mariano desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar el negocio familiar, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en los corrales, para lograr su meta ha creído  conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Mariano is 67 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and the youngest of his children in Santa Isabel sector of Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Mariano and his wife raise and sell young animals.  He usually raises goats in pens near his home and his wife raises poultry, especially ducks and chickens.  When these animals have reached a good level of development they offer them for sale to the traders who visit their area.  They use the profits they make from this business activity to help their family finances.

Mariano would like to acquire balanced feed so that he can improve the family business.  He would also like to make some improvements to his pens.  He is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed to improve his business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PODEMOS; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Xiomara; la socia tiene 36; ella es casada y tiene 3 Hijos; la socia vive en San Sebastián;  La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo frutas, ella se abastece de los proveedores que traen la fruta del valle y va hasta la parada de buses a comprar al por mayor y luego ella vende al por menor; la socia trabaja es este tipo de comercio desde hace 13 años. La socia desea poder tener un capital para esta temporada y ella está terminando su mercadería y también debe a un proveedor un saldo pendiente para que pueda adquirir nueva mercadería de frutas. La socia pagará un saldo pendiente y se abastecerá de un nuevo requerimiento de frutas de la estación. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar y saldar una deuda con su proveedor.

Los otros socios  se dedican la compra y venta de ropa, de juguetes, de frutas, venta de alimentos, venta de quesos y todos ellos solicitan el préstamo para hacer de este un capital para este mes de diciembre y poder tener mercadería nueva.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The 'Juntos Podemos' (Together We Can) community bank is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

One of the group's members is 36 year-old Xiomara.  She is married and has 3 children.  She lives in San Sebastián and works buying and selling fruit.  She stocks her business from the suppliers who bring fruit from the valley and goes to the bus stop to buy her produce wholesale.  She then sells her produce retail.  She has been in this business for 13 years.  Xiomara would like to have some capital for this season.  Her produce is running out and she also owes a supplier an outstanding balance if she is to acquire more fruit.  She will pay her outstanding balance and re-stock her business with seasonal fruit.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruit and pay her debt to her supplier.

The other members of the group buy and sell clothes, toys, fruit, food and cheese.  They are all requesting a loan to have capital for the month of December so that they can buy new merchandise.

The group's members are grateful to those who will take part in their dream by funding their loan and they pledge to make their repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy fruit and settle an outstanding debt with her supplier

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leonarda; La socia es casada y tiene  6 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de productos agropecuarios la socia vende a los revendedores sus productos ella tiene terrenos de cultivos y vende todo tipo de productos, como semillas, abonos, para las tierras de cultivos, la socia vende al por mayor y los clientes ya lo revenden al por menor, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y desde muy niña estuvo involucrada con las chacras (los terrenos de cultivos de sus padres), la socia no pudo terminar el colegio y ella desea lo mejor para sus hijos y trabaja arduamente para obtener el dinero suficiente y enviar a los hijos a la universidad, ella desea el préstamo para hacer de este un capital importante pata comprar productos como semillas, abonos y nuevas semillas para una nueva siembra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Leonarda belongs to the 'Sr. de Tayancani' community bank which is located in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Leonarda is married and has 6 children.  She sells farming and livestock products to resellers.  She has plots of land and sells all kinds of products such as seeds and manure for agricultural land.  She sells her products wholesale and her customers resell them retail.  She is a very hard-working woman and she has been involved with farms (her parents' land) since she was very young.  She couldn't finish school and she wants the best for her children.  She works hard to make enough money and to send her children to university.

Leonarda would like a loan so that she has capital to buy products such as seeds, manure and new seeds for new sowing.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying seeds and fertilizers.

She is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To invest in buying seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Krem

texts.en:
Krem T. has been in the farming business for years in Kompong Tom Province. She plants various crops to earn a living.  She typically generates an income of $1.20 per day. 

Her husband earns a living selling rattan beds in front of their house. He sells rattan that he produces by himself or that he orders from other producers who live in the village. He can earn on average a profit of $5.20 a day to share responsibility with Krem T. for the family’s need.  Krem T.’s husband runs his business well from day to day because he has good communication skills with his customers. 

This couple has been married for years. They have a child who is studying in school. Krem T. sees that her husband’s business is profitable and she would like to borrow some funds for her husband from Kiva to buy more wood to make beds to sell.

loans.use: To buy wood to make beds to sell

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Mrs. Orn P. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in the cultivation of crops from their own farmland. The couple has a child who attends public school. Mrs. Orn P. has raised a lot of piglets and she is hoping to sell them to buyers four months after she begins raising them. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Mrs. Orn P. and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets. She will use the rest of the funds to purchase many sacks of rice to store and then sell when rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets

loans.name: Pich Leakhna Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich L., 40 years old, is the village bank president selected by the ten members of a village group loan located in Ruessei Chrouy village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.
 
Mrs. Pich L. is a farmer who rents a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support her business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fishnets to support her son's fishing. Mrs. Pich L. is also a farm laborer, earning a small income to support her family. She is a widow with two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other is a fishermen who also helps his mother with the farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Ngoy

texts.en: Ngoy K. is a 46-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Kim Soeur, age 46. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have three children; two are married and one is single. Ngoy K. and her husband grow different kinds of crops on the farmland she inherited from her grandmother. In the past, Ngoy K. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. She is applying for a loan from Kiva in order to buy her own cow, which will also provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: to buy her own cow

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean A. is from the village of Tipolo. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Jean owns & operates a pig raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia J. is from the village of Danao. She is 49 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Emelia owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Emelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is from the village of Bato Plaridel. She is 57 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Rosalinda owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 16th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Chem's Group

texts.en:
Eleven members form this village loan. They are located in Ruessei Chrouy village in Kandal province. Mr. Chem C., who is 50 years old, has been selected by the village members as their village bank president. Each member will use their money for different purposes. 

Mr. Chem C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate different vegetables. He is also a house builder. With these occupations, he still earns a small income with which to support his family. To increase his income and improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Chem C. would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets to raise. He will use the rest of the loan to buy rice seeds for cultivating rice. His wife, Mrs. Phork Sokun, is 42 years old and works as a seamstress in a garment factory. 
 
This couple has six children: two of them are laborers and the others are students who also support their father's businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising.

loans.name: Gladys Marcela

texts.es: La señora Gladys vive en la zona rural de Matucana, participa en EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD desde el año 2007,  se dedica a la venta de pasteles y empanadas hace 5 años, su esposo es el que prepara las ricas tortas y empanadas que ella vende de manera ambulatoria, gracias a los préstamos que adquirió aumentaron sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Además tiene un pequeño kiosco en el cual expende golosinas con su hermana. Sus ingresos de estos negocios los emplea para construir su casa a fin de dar comodidad a los suyos y apoya también a su esposo en los servicios básicos. El crédito que requiere será para comprar azúcar, manteca, harina así mismo espera construir más adelante el segundo piso de su casa con el fin de poner cabinas de internet y una fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Gladys lives in the rural Matucana zone.  She has been participating in EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD since 2007.  She has been selling cakes and turnovers for five years.  Her husband prepares the delicious cakes and turnovers which she then sells as a street vendor.  

Thanks to the loans she has received sales increased and as a result so did her income.  Besides, she has a small kiosk where she sells snacks with her sister.  Income from these businesses will be used to build her house in order to provide more comfort for her loved ones.  She also helps her husband pay for basic utilities.

The loan she needs is to buy sugar, lard and flour as well as to later on build a second story on her house to install Internet access booths and a photocopying machine.

loans.use: To buy turnover and cake making ingredients.

loans.name: Sours

texts.en:
Sours T. sells rattan cupboards and beds. He is 35 and is a married father with one kid who is a pupil at the local public school. Sours T. and his wife sell their products in front of their house. They also order rattan items in bulk from braiders and then sell them retail, door-to-door, across the province. They always spend a week or two selling their items. 

Sours T. is now running his business very well because he sells his items at a reasonable price. To meet customer demand, he seeks a loan to buy pieces of wood to make beds. 

Note: Sours Toms’s wife is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy pieces of wood to make beds for selling.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita L. is from the village of Northern Poblacion. She is 44 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Rosita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Puchh's Group

texts.en:
Nine members form this village loan. They are located in Ruessei Chrouy village in Kandal province. Mr. Puchh S., 44 years old, is the village bank president having been selected by the members of this village. Each member will use their money for different purposes. 

Mr. Puchh S. makes his living breeding poultry, earning a small income to support his family. With this business, he still does not earn enough income to make improvements for his family. In order to increase his income to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Puchh S. would like to ask for a loan to buy more chickens and ducklings for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Chan Kunthea, 30 years old, works as a seamstress in a garment factory. They have a child who is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducklings for breeding

texts.en:
Tessie C. is from the village of Dapaon. She is 38 years old. Tessie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing & shoe products in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Tessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Tessie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

loans.name: Elvelita

texts.en:
Elvelita B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 40 years old. Elvelita is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvelita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market.

Elvelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvelita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvelita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
44-year-old Letecia G. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has 7 children. Her eldest child is 19 years old and her youngest child is 2 years old.

Letecia owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells vinegar, garlic and other various products. Letecia has been running the store for over a year now and earns 3000 PHP a month. Letecia also makes rice cakes and other delicacies.

Letecia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hourt's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of nine members living in Reang Dek village, Kandal province. This village selected Mrs. Hourt S., a 45 year old married woman, as the village bank president. With the loans, they hope to increase income to improve the family of their living. 

Mrs. Hourt S. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land that she uses to cultivate rice. Beside farming, she also earns her living by breeding fish. Her husband, Mr. Saing Channa, 45 years old, works as fisherman. To support her husband fishing, Mrs. Hourt S. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies. With their occupations, they are able to earn good profit to support their four children, including one who is a farmer, two who are seamstresses in a garment factory and one who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies to support her husband's fishing

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel G. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 53 years old. Maridel is married and has three children. To make a living, Maridel owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maridel works hard to build her business. 

Maridel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maridel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Maridel is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mr. Kong T., age 34, owns and operates a handicraft business in the province of Kompong Tom. Mr. Kong T. and his wife work together in this business and earn a profit of approximately $10 per day. Most of output consists of beds and cupboards, which they accumulate and sell as sets. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. The couple has two children. Both of the children are in school and (when school ends for the day) help their parents make furniture. In order to increase his income, Mr. Kong T. has applied for a loan to buy some pieces of wood to make beds to sell.

loans.use: To buy some pieces of wood to make beds to sell.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu Y. is a 38-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Putu is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tunas Rahayu (PK-10390).


Ni Putu is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Putu owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Putu has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Putu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by Ni Putu from MUK.  Ni Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

Ni Putu Y. is very grateful for the help of a loan for her pig farming business. She hopes cooperation with MUK and the KIVA group will remain intact. She also hopes the loan period can be extended to 12 months.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Putu Y. (0) merupakan 38 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Tunas Rahayu (PK-10390).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu menghasilkan sekitar 0,200 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.500.000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future

texts.en:
Nilo A. is from the town of Trinidad. He is married and has children. To make a living, Nilo owns & operates a fishing business gathering and selling seaweeds at the market. Nilo works hard to provide for his family and sustain his children's education.

Nilo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nilo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including nets

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica N. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 45 years old. Veronica is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 21 years old. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Veronica also raises pigs for fattening and sale. 

Veronica joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional products and piglets

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Korn N. is a single woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham Province, which is the best territory for farming. She was married but she divorced her husband years ago. Korn N. is devoted to her three children, and all of them are employed in various occupations in order to share their income with Korn N. for daily expenses. Korn N. has a few farmlands that she inherited from her grandmother. Korn N. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest and collect her profits when they are mature. Recently, her crop has not been growing well because it lacks fertilizers. Because of that obstacle, Korn N. has decided to seek a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her planting. The rest of the loan she will use to purchase an extra piece of land in good condition for a farming business.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and land for farming.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is from the village of Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married and has one child. Janeth is a sari-sari (variety) store owner where she sells a variety of products. She has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 pesos (PHP) a month..

In June 8, 2010, Janeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Janeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
